content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- News russian version News Winner Announced in the 2004 Russian Entrepreneur Of The Year Contest Winner Announced in the 2004 Russian Entrepreneur Of The Year Contest Rouben Vardanyan, President of Troika Dialog Group, Wins the National Entrepreneur Of The Year Contest in Russia Moscow, November 26, 200  The international Entrepreneur Of The Year © Award has been run by Ernst & Young for 18 years in 40 countries and is now established as the most prestigious and recognized international business awards program designed to recognize and honor outstanding entrepreneurial achievements in developing specific sectors of the national economy. The contest was launched in Russia in 2003. At the final ceremony held on November 25 in Moscow to honor the 2004 finalists, Rouben Vardanyan, president of Troika Dialog Group, was recognized as the winner of the national Entrepreneur Of The Year Contest in Russia. He also won in the Financial Services category. In June 2005, Mr. Vardanyan will represent Russia in competing for the World Entrepreneur Of The Year award in Monte Carlo, Monaco. Rouben Vardanyan was among the first employees of Troika Dialog, which was established in 1991. He was closely involved in the set-up and development of the company, and became its CEO in 1992. In 1996, he was promoted to president, becoming the CEO of Troika Dialog Group in 1997. Mr. Vardanyan is one of Russian stock markets leaders and is a member of the board of directors of the Russian Trading System (RTS). The awards ceremony also announced winners in ten categories. Manufacturing  Valentin Zverev , general director, Shatura Furniture (Shatura) Financial Services  Rouben Vardanyan , president, Troika Dialog (Moscow) Consumer Goods  Dmitry Tereshkov , chairman of the board, Siberian Bread Corporation (Novosibirsk) Trade  Oleg Zherebtsov , general director, Lenta Cash & Carry (Saint Petersburg) Services and Transport  Merab Elashvili , chairman of the board, Brothers & Co. (Moscow) Corporate Social Responsibility  Nikita Mouzyrya , chairman of the board, Avtoline Group (Moscow) Information Technology  Boris Bobrovnikov , general director, CROC Incorporated (Moscow) Regional Leadership  Vladimir Ermolin , director, ConsultantPlus Komy (Syktyvkar) Young Entrepreneur  Albert Gusev , general director, Sweet Life (Nizhny Novgorod) Female Business Leader  Anna Matveeva , general director, Ideal Cup (Saint Petersburg) "Our contest is among entrepreneurs rather than companies. The contest among participants focuses on their personality, implementation of their business ideas and unique market entry and success strategies. This year, finalists include companies from the regions such as Saint Petersburg, Nizhny Novgorod, Novosibirsk, etc. which we believe will help the contest move forward," said Alexander Ivlev, the partner at Ernst & Young who supervises the International Entrepreneur Of The Year Program in Russia. back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Winner Announced in the 2004 Entrepreneur Of The Year Contest

November 26, 2004

Rouben Vardanyan Wins Prestigious Award for Entrepreneurial Achievements

The Entrepreneur Of The Year Award, run by Ernst & Young for 18 years in 40 countries, is established as the most prestigious international business awards program recognizing outstanding entrepreneurial achievements. This prestigious contest began in 2003, and during the final ceremony held on November 25, Rouben Vardanyan, president of Troika Dialog Group, was honored as the winner of the national Entrepreneur Of The Year Contest. Additionally, he earned accolades in the Financial Services category. In June 2005, Rouben Vardanyan will represent the nation in the global competition for the World Entrepreneur Of The Year award in Monte Carlo, Monaco. Vardanyan, a key figure in the company's formation and growth since 1991, has significantly contributed to the development of the financial services sector.

About Other Organizations and Winners

The awards ceremony also celebrated winners in ten other categories. Valentin Zverev of Shatura Furniture won in Manufacturing, Dmitry Tereshkov of Siberian Bread Corporation triumphed in Consumer Goods, and Oleg Zherebtsov of Lenta Cash & Carry excelled in Trade. Other notable winners included Merab Elashvili from Brothers & Co. for Services and Transport, Nikita Mouzyrya of Avtoline Group for Corporate Social Responsibility, Boris Bobrovnikov from CROC Incorporated in Information Technology, Vladimir Ermolin of ConsultantPlus Komy for Regional Leadership, Albert Gusev of Sweet Life as Young Entrepreneur, and Anna Matveeva from Ideal Cup in the Female Business Leader category. Alexander Ivlev, the partner at Ernst & Young supervising the International Entrepreneur Of The Year Program, highlighted the unique focus on entrepreneurs' persona, strategy, and innovative market entries.

page_cooked.page_description: The Center for Entrepreneurship announces Rouben Vardanyan as the winner of the 2004 Entrepreneur Of The Year Contest.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- News russian version News Money Talk, or Investment in Business NN Entrepreneurship Group November 4, 2004 The Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group is an ongoing forum for entrepreneurs and top managers of growth companies and investors.  Raising Capital was the subject of this business breakfast sponsored by the U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship and OPORA Rossii at the Russky Lev restaurant on November 4, 2004. The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship (CFE) was initiated by the U.S. Russia Investment Fund, which recently celebrated its tenth year in Russia.  The Fund invests in growth-oriented Russian companies for periods of three to five years, and has invested over $300 million. At the end of the day, any investment is made in people, not companies - no matter how remarkable they may be - and investors continually confront a shortage of professional managers and talented owners in Russia, stated Victor Sedov, Executive Director of CFE. At the workshop, the investment sector was represented by Quadriga Capital Russia .  Quadriga is interested in companies with good reputations in high-growth and technology industries.  The funds Director, Kendrik White, spoke about principles of private equity financing, investment criteria, and stages of the investment process.  He also let entrepreneurs know that they can apply for investment directly or via consultants. Mr. White noted Quadrigas investment in Nizhpharm as an example of a successful deal. When the investment was made, the company was rated seventeenth. Now, it ranks third and is a company with a transparent accounting system. The service sector was represented by Konstantin Gubin of the Russian-British company Rbpartners , who described how a professional service provider can help companies looking for investments.  He spoke in detail about the difference between due diligence and the audit, with the goal of an audit being to confirm the reliability of the accounting and financial data, and due diligence in trying to understand and evaluate the business.  At the end of the day, due diligence is about understanding if the business in question is indeed what the owners claim it is, said Mr. Gubin in conclusion. Larisa Yekimova, CFO of Sladkaya Zhizn ( SPAR Middle Volga ) , spoke about why Albert Gusev sought out investment, the search for an investor, and about the due diligence process.  The difficult thing to do, she said, is to let an outsider into the business that you have been building for years.  Before an entrepreneur searches for investment, they need to understand the benefits.  Mr. Gusev approached an investor because he lacked his own funds.  He spent about a year finding a partner and looking at various options. There is a huge debate as to the value of the company, since the investor is interested in buying cheap and the entrepreneur in selling for a lot, stated Ms. Yekimova.  It is very important to specify the terms and conditions under which the investor will exit the agreement.  Be prepared to spend on lawyers and consultants and maintain vigilance when entering the agreement, because every comma matters. Author: Yelena Tsareva Source: 
			Birzha + Career (Nizhny Novgorod), November 9, 2004 back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Raising Capital at Business Breakfast

November 4, 2004

Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group Hosts Event on Raising Capital

The Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group is an ongoing forum for entrepreneurs, top managers of growth companies, and investors. Raising Capital was the subject of this business breakfast sponsored by the Center for Entrepreneurship and OPORA Rossii at the Russky Lev restaurant on November 4, 2004. The Center for Entrepreneurship was initiated by the U.S. Russia Investment Fund, which recently celebrated its tenth year. The Fund invests in growth-oriented companies for periods of three to five years and has invested over $300 million. “At the end of the day, any investment is made in people, not companies - no matter how remarkable they may be,” stated Victor Sedov, Executive Director of the Center for Entrepreneurship. At the workshop, the investment sector was represented by Quadriga Capital. Quadriga is interested in companies with good reputations in high-growth and technology industries. The fund’s Director, Kendrik White, spoke about principles of private equity financing, investment criteria, and stages of the investment process. He also let entrepreneurs know that they can apply for investment directly or via consultants. White noted Quadriga’s investment in Nizhpharm as an example of a successful deal. “When the investment was made, the company was rated seventeenth. Now, it ranks third and is a company with a transparent accounting system.” The service sector was represented by Konstantin Gubin of the Russian-British company Rbpartners, who described how a professional service provider can help companies looking for investments. He spoke in detail about the difference between due diligence and the audit, with the goal of an audit being to confirm the reliability of the accounting and financial data, and due diligence in trying to understand and evaluate the business. “At the end of the day, due diligence is about understanding if the business in question is indeed what the owners claim it is,” said Gubin in conclusion.

Key Organizations and Insights

Quadriga Capital is a private equity firm that invests in midsize growth companies. The firm focuses on sectors such as industrials, healthcare, and consumer products. Quadriga Capital aims to support the long-term development of its portfolio companies through strategic advice and partnerships. Rbpartners is a service provider that offers a range of consultancy services including financial advisory, business restructuring, and strategic planning. They help businesses navigate complex investment processes and ensure compliance with international standards. The Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group plays a critical role in fostering dialogue between entrepreneurs and investors, promoting growth through shared experiences and expert insights. The Center for Entrepreneurship continues to promote entrepreneurship by sponsoring events and providing resources for business growth, aiming to address the professional manager shortage in the investment landscape.
page_cooked.page_title: Raising Capital at Business Breakfast
page_cooked.page_description: Learn about the strategies and key insights shared during the business breakfast on raising capital, sponsored by the Center for Entrepreneurship.
page_cooked.page_keywords: capital, investment, entrepreneurs, growth companies, private equity, due diligence, financial data, investment process

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- News russian version News Russias Business Leaders of Tomorrow The meetings were held with some of the s leading institutions and figures in politics, business, public administration, mass media, NGOs and education. Below is a list of main meetings that took place during the trip, accompanied by some pictures: Media: Financial Times (Quenteen Peel, FTs international affairs editor and Andrew Jack, former Moscow bureau chief and currently FT correspondent on health care) TV Channel Four (Liam Halligan, economics correspondent for Channel 4 News, one of the most reliable and trusted information sources in the UK according to opinion polls) International Financial Organizations: European Bank for Reconstruction & Development (Alan Rousso, Lead Counsellor; Larry Sherwin, Deputy Director of Communications) UK Government Agencies: Foreign & Commonwealth Office (Simon Smith, Head of Eastern Department; The Rt Hon Jack Straw MP, Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs) Department of Trade & Industry (Thomas Walker, Deputy Director on Enterprise Policy, Small Business Service) UK Trade and Investment Agency, Inward Investment Group (Amanda Groom, Strategy & Communications team) British Parliament: House of Commons (Matt Waldman, Foreign Affairs & Defence Adviser to the Liberal Democrats; Michael Wills, Member of the Parliament, Liberal Democrat) Business: Federation of Small Businesses (Stephen Alambritis, Head of Press and Parliamentary Affairs) London Stock Exchange (Svetlana Rozanova, Manager on International Business Development) Citigroup (James Sleeman, Vice President, Energy & Utilities) NGOs: Reuters Foundation (Paddy Coulter, Director) Education: Oxford University / Said Business School (Professor Hopwood, the Dean; Stephen Chambers, Head of MBA Programs) One of the most interesting meetings Our Talents enjoyed in was held on September 21, 2005 at the UK Foreign and Commonwealth Office. Warm reception of Our Talents in the very heart of the British diplomacy was held by the Head of FCO Eastern Department, Mr. Simon Smith. Welcoming and convivial atmosphere of the conversation was a very good setting for an exchange of views on some of the most complex issues of British Russian relations such as absence of common standards in international anti-terrorism policy and approaches to Iraq and . Mr. Smith also told the participants about structure, main functions and principles of work in his department. Our Talents were also very lucky to meet face to face with The Rt Hon Jack Straw MP, Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs who complained in a short interview about extraordinary pressure from business and shared his concerns regarding problems in his constituency. Our Talents were truly impressed by such friendly face-to-face conversation with the Foreign Secretary. Source: Our Talents Foundation back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

- News russian version News Andrey Martirosov was awarded Entrepreneur of the Year in Russia. The General Director of airline UTair has been named the national winner of the international competition Entrepreneur of Year, 2005 organized by Ernst and Young. Andrey Martirosov, having headed airline UTair since 1999, has brought back the enterprise from bankruptcy and has transformed it into an industry leader.  In 2006, the company plans to earn 400 million rubles net profit, four times more than the 2005 figure. In June 2006, Mr. Martikrosov will represent at the international Entrepreneur of the Year competition in Monte-Carlo. Other winners of the Entrepreneur of the Year competition in Russia  were the General Director, Sibirsky Bereg, Alexander Ladan; Chairman of Board of Directors, Euroset, Evgeny Chichvarkin; General Director, Continent Express, Stanislav Kostiashkin; General Director, MAGRAM Market Research, Marina Malyhina; General Director, Digital Design, Andrey Fedorov; Chairman of Board, NBD-BANK, Alexander Sharonov;  President, Global Age, Michael Lifshits; President, The Microfinance Center, Paul Sigal; and the Rector of the St.-Petersburg International Institute of Management, Sergey Mordovin. Source: magazine "Svoi Biznes" ¹42-43 back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

The General Director of airline UTair, Andrey Martirosov, has been named the national winner of the international competition Entrepreneur of the Year, 2005 organized by Ernst and Young. Andrey Martirosov, having headed airline UTair since 1999, has brought back the enterprise from bankruptcy and has transformed it into an industry leader. In 2006, the company plans to earn 400 million rubles net profit, four times more than the 2005 figure. Key Organizations and Their Contributions

The Sibirsky Bereg is a leading force in the snack food market, praised for its innovative approaches and products. MAGRAM Market Research contributes valuable market insights that drive informed business decisions. Digital Design is at the forefront of software development and digital innovation. The efforts of these organizations collectively enhance the entrepreneurial ecosystem, fostering growth and innovation.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- News russian version News 3 March 2006: Moscow Entrepreneurship Group: Success Through Franchising Confirmed Speakers: Franchisor  Boris Krupkin, finder and co-owner, Chainaya Lozhka ( St. Petersburg ) . Mr. Krupkin discussed why he decided to begin franchising his successful fast food business in Russia, steps he took to begin franchising, criteria for entering new markets and partnering with franchisees, standards and practices he imposes on franchisees to ensure brand integrity, and adviced  on how to start a franchise. Franchisee  Alexander Birulin, Partner, MedOK, (Invitro franchisee) . Mr. Birulin discussed his experience buying an Invitro franchise, including how he choose the franchisor, support he received from them, working capital needs during the start-up phase, positive and negative aspects of being a franchisee, and recommendations to entrepreneurs which are interested in buying a franchise. Service Sector  Valery Perkov , General Manager, Russian Association of Franchising . Mr. Perkov discussed the history and trends in franchising in  Russia , legal aspects of franchising, success-stories, typical mistakes of franchisors and franchisees, and resources to use in learning about franchising. back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Success Through Franchising Confirmed

March 3, 2006

Insights on Succeeding Through Franchising at The Center for Entrepreneurship

On March 3, 2006, The Center for Entrepreneurship hosted a significant event centered on achieving success through franchising. The event featured critical discussions by notable participants, including franchisors, franchisees, and industry specialists. One of the speakers was Franchisor Boris Krupkin, the co-owner of Chainaya Lozhka. Mr. Krupkin shared his journey of deciding to franchise his successful fast food business, the steps he undertook to begin the franchising process, the criteria for identifying new markets and partners, and the practices he implements to ensure the integrity of his brand. Another important perspective was provided by Franchisee Alexander Birulin, a partner at MedOK (Invitro franchisee). Mr. Birulin detailed his experience in choosing and working with a franchisor, the support and working capital requirements during the initial phase, and offered recommendations to potential franchisees. OPORA served as the event's media partner.

About the Organizations Involved

Chainaya Lozhka operates as a prominent fast food franchise, specializing in delivering traditional home-cooked meals quickly and conveniently. The brand is well-regarded for its attention to maintaining quality and consistency across its franchises. Invitational's MedOK is a medical diagnostic service franchise known for its commitment to offering reliable diagnostic solutions and extensive support to its franchisees. The organization undertakes only those partners who meet strict quality standards, ensuring a high level of trust and reputation among customers. OPORA is an association of entrepreneurial organizations focused on supporting and advocating for the interests of small and medium-sized businesses. By providing resources, networking opportunities, and advocacy, OPORA plays a critical role in fostering entrepreneurship.
page_cooked.page_title: Success Through Franchising Confirmed
page_cooked.page_description: Explore valuable insights on how to succeed through franchising with expert talks from noted franchisors, franchisees, and industry leaders at The Center for Entrepreneurship.
page_cooked.page_keywords: franchising, success, entrepreneurship, franchisor, franchisee, business, startup, scaleup

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- News russian version News Conference-Exhibition: Franchising  Business Perspectives in Nizhny Novgorod The conference was opened by the Director of the U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneursh office in Nizhny Novgorod Mikhail Terentiev.  He welcomed the particants, gave an overview of CFEs activities and wished the particants success in achieving their goals in finding the right business partners. Denis Labusa, Minister for Small Business Support and Development of the Nizhny Novgorod Regional Administration, spoke about the small business structure of the Region and the role and potential of franchising for its development. Speakers from the Russian Franchising Association, the Russian Chamber of Commerce, BISNIS and NBD-Bank gave an overview of problems and opportunities connected with franchising in Russia. Gennady Kochetkov, representative of Subway in Russia , who was invited to the conference by the U.S. Russia Center of Entrepreneursh, highlighted the role of franchising in the US economy and compared it to the situation in Russia . Representatives of franchisor companies spoke about current trends in such industries as food and apparel retail, restaurants, medical services, tourism and automotive. Two seminars followed. Experts from Deloshop gave a seminar for would-be franchisees, which covered all aspects and stages of buying a franchise. Soyuz Magazinov conducted a seminar for franchisors and taught about preparing a franchising package and implementing a franchising system. The exhibition hosted about 40 franchises (retail, services, restaurant, and automotive) from Nizhny Novgorod, and St.Petersburg. Around 400 particants attended the conference from , Moscow , Nizhny Novgorod, Kirov, Cheboksary, Yoshkar-Ola and Saransk. back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

News Conference-Exhibition: “Franchising – Business Perspectives”

September 25, 2006

Exploring Franchise Opportunities at the News Conference-Exhibition

The conference was opened by the Director of The Center for Entrepreneurship office in Nizhny Novgorod. The attendees were welcomed, given an overview of CFE’s activities and wished success in achieving their goals in finding the right business partners. Denis Labusa, Minister for Small Business Support and Development, spoke about the small business structure of the Region and the role and potential of franchising for its development. Speakers from the Russian Chamber of Commerce, Subway, who was invited to the conference by The Center for Entrepreneurship, highlighted the role of franchising in the US economy and compared it to the situation in Russia. Representatives of franchisor companies spoke about current trends in such industries as food and apparel retail, restaurants, medical services, tourism and automotive. Two seminars followed. Experts from Deloshop gave a seminar for would-be franchisees, covering all aspects and stages of buying a franchise. Soyuz conducted a seminar for franchisors, teaching about preparing a franchising package and implementing a franchising system. The exhibition hosted about 40 franchises (retail, services, restaurant, and automotive) from Nizhny Novgorod, and St.Petersburg. Around 400 participants attended the conference from various cities.

Key Organizations at the Conference

OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) played a significant role in supporting the conference, providing insights into the growth of small businesses and the entrepreneurial spirit. Another key organization was Startup Huddle, fostering an environment for entrepreneurs to develop ideas and receive feedback. The presence of financial institutions like NBD-Bank was instrumental in discussing funding opportunities for new franchises. Industry representatives from various sectors contributed to a rich dialogue on the current state and future directions of franchising, making the conference a comprehensive resource for all attendees.

- News russian version News 18 March 2006: Iron Entrepreneur Competition 7 teams from 5 Nizhny Novgorod universities took part in the competition. During the competition the students had to present the strategy of commercialization of   an innovative product at markets of different countries. The winners represented  Higher School of Economics. Their prize is the opportunity to participate in the meeting of the Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group which is to take place on April, 14. The team from Nizhny Novgorod Linguistic University won the second place while the team from Nizhny Novgorod Institute for Management and Business  the third. The prizes were provided by the U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship and the Youth Organization Juniour Achievement Nizhny Novgorod. back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Iron Entrepreneur Competition Winners Announced

March 18, 2006

Iron Entrepreneur Competition Sees Students Compete for Top Honors

The Iron Entrepreneur Competition saw seven teams from five universities compete in a lively contest. Participants were tasked with presenting strategies for the commercialization of innovative products in various international markets. The winning team, representing the Higher School of Economics, earned the opportunity to attend the next meeting of the Entrepreneurs Group on April 14. The second place was secured by the team from Linguistic University, while the Institute for Management and Business took third place. The prizes were provided by The Center for Entrepreneurship and the Youth Organization Junior Achievement. The event was media partnered by My Business Magazine and OPORA.

About Our Esteemed Partners

The Youth Organization Junior Achievement is a global non-profit organization that empowers young individuals to create engaging, relevant, and experiential learning sessions in work readiness, entrepreneurship, and financial literacy. Founded in 1919, it reaches millions of students yearly with its impactful programs. OPORA serves as the voice of entrepreneurial organizations and provides a platform for advocacy, networking, and continuous learning within the entrepreneurial ecosystem. Its efforts support the growth and sustainability of small and medium-sized enterprises, contributing to a robust economy. Meanwhile, My Business Magazine offers valuable insights, tips, and news for entrepreneurs. It serves as a vital resource for emerging and established entrepreneurs, providing them with the information needed to navigate the business world effectively.

- News russian version News 14 April 2006: Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group: Increasing Competitiveness with the Help of Capital Investment Speakers: Entrepreneur - Andrey Mladentsev, General Director of Nizhfarm company. Mr. Mladentsev will speak about his successful experience of attracting capital investments to increase the position of Nizhpharm on the market and about the lessons learnt from this experience. Investment sector - Sergey Ivanushkin, General Director of AVK Investment company. Mr.Ivanushkin  will show the advantages of capital investments as compared to other forms of investment at different stages of  company development. He will also mention the role of the investor in managing the enterprise and speak about the security of the owners in investment deals. Service sector - Kendrick White, Managing Princal of Marchmont Capital Partners. Kendrick White will explain the current problems of competitiveness in the regions, the opportunities of the investment funds in increasing competitiveness of enterprises and the role of consulting companies in enterprise-investor relations. back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group: Increasing Competitiveness with the Help of Capital Investment

April 14, 2006

Strategies to Enhance Market Position Through Capital Investment

Entrepreneur Andrey Mladentsev, General Director of Nizhpharm company, will discuss his successful experience in attracting capital investments to boost Nizhpharm's market position and share lessons learned. Additionally, Sergey Ivanushkin, General Director of AVK Investment company, will highlight the advantages of capital investments over other forms of investment during different stages of company development. He will also discuss the investor's role in managing the enterprise and ensuring owner security in investment deals. Finally, Kendrick White, Managing Principal of Marchmont Capital Partners, will offer insights into the role of investment funds in increasing enterprise competitiveness and the importance of consulting firms in enterprise-investor relations.

About Partner Organizations

AVK Investment company, led by Sergey Ivanushkin, is a prominent investment firm focused on providing capital funds across various stages of company development. With a strong emphasis on strategic partnerships and thorough market analysis, AVK Investment aids businesses in securing essential funds to drive growth and enhance market presence. Nizhpharm company, under the leadership of Andrey Mladentsev, is a notable player in the pharmaceutical industry. The company has consistently demonstrated prowess in utilizing capital investments to fortify its market stance and ensure consistent product innovation. On the other hand, Marchmont Capital Partners specializes in consulting services that bridge the gap between enterprises and investors. Led by Kendrick White, the firm excels in providing business solutions that bolster competitiveness and optimize enterprise-investor collaboration.

page_cooked.page_description: Explore how Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group enhances competitiveness through strategic capital investments featuring insights from industry leaders.
page_cooked.page_keywords: Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship, capital investment, competitiveness, business growth, investment strategies, consulting firms

The company has consistently demonstrated prowess in utilizing capital investments to fortify its market stance and ensure consistent product innovation. On the other hand, Marchmont Capital Partners specializes in consulting services that bridge the gap between enterprises and investors. Led by Kendrick White, the firm excels in providing business solutions that bolster competitiveness and optimize enterprise-investor collaboration.

Franchisee  Elena Kuznetsova, Founder, Tender Age (FasTracKids Franchisee) . Ms. Kuznetsova will discuss the experience of buying a FasTracKids franchise, including why she choose this US-based franchisor, support provided her by the franchisor, working capital needs during the start-up phase, positive and negative aspects of being a franchisee, and recommendations to entrepreneurs who are interested in buying a franchise. Service Sector  Viktor Sukhotin, Expert, Buy Brand magazine . page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Success through Franchising Confirmed Speakers

April 21, 2006

Discover Franchising Success with Industry Experts

The St. Petersburg Entrepreneurship Group recently held an insightful event titled 'Success through Franchising'. Among the confirmed speakers was Olga Sharapova, the franchisor of FORUM Outlet Stores. Ms. Sharapova discussed why FORUM decided to begin franchising its outlet store business in new regions, the steps taken to initiate franchising, criteria for entering new markets, partnering with franchisees, and maintaining brand integrity. She also highlighted both the challenges and positive experiences of franchising. Another key speaker was Elena Kuznetsova, founder of Tender Age (FasTracKids Franchisee). Ms. Kuznetsova detailed her experience in acquiring a FasTracKids franchise, including her reasons for selecting this US-based franchisor, the support received, initial working capital needs, as well as the pros and cons of being a franchisee. Buy Brand magazine expert Viktor Sukhotin discussed the history and current trends in franchising, legal aspects, success stories, common mistakes by franchisors and franchisees, and useful resources to learn more about franchising.

Key Organizations and Their Impact

Buy Brand magazine is renowned for its in-depth analysis and coverage of the franchising industry. Providing a wealth of information on successful franchise models, legal guidance, market trends, and expert advice, the magazine is an invaluable resource for both new and experienced entrepreneurs. Fasttrac, as highlighted by Elena Kuznetsova, is a highly regarded program offering entrepreneurial training and support, particularly beneficial for those entering the franchising sector. Through comprehensive education and mentorship, Fasttrac equips entrepreneurs with the tools necessary to successfully launch and grow their businesses. These organizations, among others, play a significant role in fostering a robust entrepreneurial ecosystem, offering vital resources and support to ensure the success and sustainability of new ventures.

- News russian version News 7 June 2006: Moscow Entrepreneurship Group. Entrepreneurs and Hired Managers Confirmed Speakers: Entrepreneur  Dmitry Agarunov, Owner, (game)land (publisher of 20 magazines, including My Business) .  Mr. Agarunov will discusses his approach to delegating duties; his criteria and qualities he looks for in hired managers; how he handles conflicts between himself and managers; motivating management; and his advice to entrepreneurs on how to delegate management duties in order to ensure the further growth of their company. Service Sector  Ekaterina Ryazantseva , Managing Partner, Anderson Partners . Ms. Ryasentseva will discuss the goal of delegating duties in entrepreneurial companies; problems that frequently occur; steps in delegating authority; balancing the interests of entrepreneurs and hired managers; factors that can draw hired managers to your company; and motivation tips in retaining hired managers. Hired General Manager  Valery Lukovnikov, General Manager, New Idea Investment Group . Mr. Lukovnikov will discuss his experience working as a hired manager in several entrepreneurial-owned companies; his view on how to build a good relationship between hired managers and entrepreneurs; common conflicts that hired managers have with entrepreneurs, and how to minimize them; and advice to entrepreneurs on how to best integrate the services of hired managers within their company. Official Information Date: Wednesday, June 7, 2006 Time: 9:00 am Registration dead-line: Tuesday, June 6, 2006 Location: National Hotel St. Petersburg Room (2nd Floor) Language: Russian Fee: 1000 roubles (can be paid cash by entrance) Information: adanilova@cfe.ru back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Entrepreneurship Group Event

June 7, 2006

Delegation and Management in Entrepreneurial Companies

The Center for Entrepreneurship is organizing an event to discuss key topics in delegation and management within entrepreneurial companies. Featured speakers include Dmitry Agarunov, Owner of (game)land, who will discuss his approach to delegating duties, the qualities he looks for in hired managers, handling conflicts, and motivating management. Ekaterina Ryazantseva, Managing Partner of Anderson Partners, will cover the goal of delegating duties, common problems, steps in delegating authority, balancing interests, and motivation tips for retaining hired managers. Valery Lukovnikov, General Manager of New Idea Investment Group, will share his experience as a hired manager, providing insights on building relationships with entrepreneurs, minimizing conflicts, and integrating hired managers' services within a company. This event will be held on Wednesday, June 7, 2006 at the National Hotel St. Petersburg Room (2nd Floor), and the discussions will be conducted in Russian.

Key Organizations Involved

The event is supported by several notable organizations. OPORA Russia, an Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations, is one of the media partners. OPORA Russia promotes entrepreneurship by offering support and resources to business owners and aspiring entrepreneurs. Their efforts include lobbying for better business conditions, providing educational programs, and fostering a network of entrepreneurs and industry leaders. They work closely with government bodies and other associations to improve the entrepreneurial ecosystem. Another supporter of the event is My Business Magazine, which provides insightful articles and resources for business owners and entrepreneurs. Their content covers various aspects of running a business, from management advice to industry trends, and helps entrepreneurs stay informed and inspired. This collaborative effort aims to enhance the skills and knowledge of participants, ensuring the growth and success of their entrepreneurial ventures.

- News russian version News 2 March Moscow Entrepreneurship Group.Expanding Your Business:Building and Managing a Holding Company Enrepreneur  Oleg Gamazin, President, SynerGo Holding Company. Mr. Gamazin will discuss the history of his holding company; the legal structure of his holding; standards he uses in choosing new companies; his role in managing the holding and daughter companies; the role and responsibilities of the managing company; and, how the managing company balances the necessity to control, yet motivate managers of daughter companies. Service Sector  Alexander Pechersky, General Director, ALT Consulting Company. Mr. Pechersky will discuss typical management models for holding companies; the most proven management models for holding companies; why diversified holdings are rarely successful; how to coordinate activities between the managing company and holding companies; and, how to standardize the relationship between the managing company and the daughter company. Legal Sector  Vassili Rudomino, Senior Partner, ALRID Law Firm. Mr. Rudomino will discuss how to structure a holding company; legal issues entrepreneurs need to keep in mind when building a holding structure; legal and antimonopoly issues with holding companies; and, legal mechanisms for managing holding structures. Official Information Date: Friday, March 2, 2007 Time: 8:30 am Registration dead-line: Thursday, March 1, 2007 Location: National Hotel St. Petersburg Room 15/1 Mokhovaya St., Moscow Language: Russian (No Translation Provided.) Fee: 1200 roubles (can be paid cash by entrance) Information: adanilova@cfe.ru You can make entry filling registration form back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

March 2, 2007

Learning from Business Experts: Building and Managing Successful Holding Companies

Join us for an insightful discussion with notable experts about the intricacies of building and managing a holding company. Key speakers include Oleg Gamazin, President of SynerGo Holding Company, who will delve into the history and legal structure of his holding company, the standards for selecting new companies, and his managerial roles. The event will provide valuable insights for entrepreneurs aiming to build and manage diversified business structures effectively.

Entrepreneur  Igor Buchshtab, Director, «LYNX », presented a case study on how he defended his company from a hostile takeover and gave advice to entrepreneurs on protecting their companies. Expert  Elena Lomakina, Partner , Ernst & Young , focused on types of mergers and acquisitions (M&As); typical examples of M&As in ; M&A deal strategy; due diligence; steps in the deal process; and threats and risks of M&A deals. Organizational Development Expert  Mark Rozin, President, Ecopsy , discussed how to integrate corporate cultures and personnel after an acquisition and reducing resistance to an M&A by employees and management. Media Expert  Ànton Smirnov, Chief Editor , Merges & Acquisitions magazine, gave an overview of M&As in Russia, and successful media strategies. page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Mergers & Acquisitions: An Instrument for Company Growth

October 5, 2008

Expert Insights on Mergers & Acquisitions for Business Growth

Entrepreneur Salim Tharani, CEO of Gallery Out of Home Media, shared his insights on why he prefers M&As over organic growth, critical factors considered during an M&A, the criteria used for selecting an M&A target, post-M&A integration, HR strategy post-deal, and evaluating the short-term and long-term success of acquisitions. Entrepreneur Igor Buchshtab, Director of LYNX, presented a case study on defending his company from a hostile takeover and offered advice to entrepreneurs on protecting their businesses. Expert Elena Lomakina, Partner at Ernst & Young, discussed the different types of M&As, provided typical examples, shared M&A deal strategies, outlined due diligence steps, and highlighted the risks involved. Organizational Development Expert Mark Rozin, President of Ecopsy, emphasized the importance of integrating corporate cultures and reducing employee resistance to M&As. Media Expert Anton Smirnov, Chief Editor of the Mergers & Acquisitions magazine, gave an overview of M&As in the media sector and successful media strategies.

Key Organizations Supporting Mergers & Acquisitions

Ernst & Young is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction, and advisory services. Their comprehensive M&A services include strategic advice, due diligence, valuation, and post-transaction integration. LYNX and Gallery Out of Home Media are notable for their roles in M&As, showcasing the application of strategies discussed. For further insights into corporate culture and organizational development post-M&A, Ecopsy offers expert consultation services. Mergers & Acquisitions magazine provides in-depth analysis and coverage on the latest trends, deals, and strategies within the M&A space.

- News russian version News The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Signs on as Co-organizer of CRDF Business Training Workshop in Russia During the four-day workshop, 25 Russian science & technology (S&T) entrepreneurs will attend CRDF and CFE designed training and mentoring sessions to prepare each for future CRDF-organized U.S. business introductions. CRDF has provided extensive business training opportunities to a broad network of Russian S&T entrepreneurs for more than a decade. Its support and partnership has promoted functional and lasting collaborations between Russian research and industrial sectors, and has encouraged the development of new U.S.-Russian business opportunities. As a leading organization advancing entrepreneurship in Russia CFEs experience is a welcome addition to CRDFs work, CRDF Senior Vice President Dr. Eric Novotny said. Technological innovation is one of Russias competitive advantages and CFE looks forward to working with CRDF in promoting technology entrepreneurship as a way to diversify Russias emerging economy, notes , Executive Director of CFE. More information about the workshop and CRDFs entrepreneurship and innovation-focused work can be found at www.crdf.org/industry . To learn more about CFEs initiatives to accelerate entrepreneurship in please reference www.cfe.ru . Source: CRDF back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
The Center for Entrepreneurship Signs on as Co-organizer of CRDF Business Training Workshop

May 23, 2008

The Center for Entrepreneurship Partners with CRDF for Business Training Workshop

During the four-day workshop, 25 science and technology (S&T) entrepreneurs will attend CRDF and The Center for Entrepreneurship (CFE) designed training and mentoring sessions to prepare each for future CRDF-organized U.S. business introductions. CRDF has provided extensive business training opportunities to a broad network of S&T entrepreneurs for more than a decade. Its support and partnership have promoted functional and lasting collaborations, encouraging the development of new U.S. business opportunities. As a leading organization advancing entrepreneurship, CFE’s experience is a welcome addition to CRDF’s work, CRDF Senior Vice President Dr. Eric Novotny said. Technological innovation is one of the S&T field’s competitive advantages and CFE looks forward to working with CRDF in promoting technology entrepreneurship as a way to diversify the emerging economy, notes Executive Director of CFE. More information about the workshop and CRDF’s entrepreneurship and innovation-focused work can be found at www.crdf.org/industry. To learn more about CFE’s initiatives to accelerate entrepreneurship in the region, please reference www.cfe.ru. Source: CRDF. Back My Business Magazine, Media Partner OPORA. Copyright © 2002, The Center for Entrepreneurship. Design by Creative Marketing Group, Agency of Internet Technologies ltd. Development by Agency of Internet Technologies ltd.

More about Key Organizations

CRDF, or the Civilian Research and Development Foundation, has been dedicated to fostering cross-border collaboration, innovation, and business development through various training programs and workshops. Their mission is to create opportunities that advance science and technology by involving entrepreneurs, researchers, and industry leaders. CRDF’s work focuses on enhancing the capabilities of S&T entrepreneurs, providing them with the tools and knowledge needed to succeed internationally. Their extensive network and resources have made them a prominent figure in the realm of business training and mentorship.OPORA is an association of entrepreneurial organizations committed to improving the business environment for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). By advocating for policy changes and providing support services, OPORA plays a critical role in promoting entrepreneurship and economic growth. Their efforts ensure that entrepreneurs have a voice and the necessary resources to thrive in a competitive landscape. Combining forces with other organizations, OPORA actively contributes to the creation of a robust entrepreneurial ecosystem.

The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- News russian version News Russian Association for Entrepreneurship Education is Launched For The Russian Association for Entrepreneurship Education is designed to make the best western and Russian practices available to all who are eager to absorb it.  It was initiated by The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship which organized a working group meeting attended by about 20 leading Russian universities, business schools and entrepreneurs involved in training. The template for the Association was the United States Association for Small Business and Entrepreneurship (USASBE), which has been successfully operating in the USA for 52 years. Geralyn Franklin, President of USASBE, and Dean of the College of Business at the University of South Florida, came to Moscow specifically to tell her colleagues about the structure of USASBE, an organization that unites about 800 people disseminating knowledge about SMEs and entrepreneurship.  They include scholars, authors of training courses in psychology and dramatic art, as well as professors of classical business subjects.  USASBE members are entitled to free journals and information bulletins in the field of entrepreneurship; they improve their skills at seminars and workshops; and they meet annually for a major conference in various cities of the US.  USASBE is not confined to US practices, and is part of the International Council for Small Business. Following the above model, the Russian Association for Entrepreneurship Education will be able to identify the best Russian programs and use them as a basis on which to establish higher levels of training.  Association members will regularly take part in workshops and conferences abroad thus creating a bridge via which the most up-to-date entrepreneurial knowledge will enter this country. Ludmila Murgulets, Vice President of the Stockholm School of Economics in St. Petersburg, has been elected President of the Russian Association for Entrepreneurship Education. For details about the new business association, call the U.S.-Russia Center for Entrepreneurship at (495) 252-7927 or write to Ms. Alla Danilova of the center at: adanilova@cfe.ru . Author: By Alexei Makurin Source: My Business magazine back My Business Magazine Media Partner OPORA Russia (Association of Entrepreneurial Organizations) Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Association for Entrepreneurship Education Launched

May 23, 2008

New Association to Integrate Best Practices in Entrepreneurship Education

The Association for Entrepreneurship Education is designed to make the best Western practices available to all who are eager to absorb it. It was initiated by The Center for Entrepreneurship which organized a working group meeting attended by about 20 leading universities, business schools, and entrepreneurs involved in training. The template for the Association was the United States Association for Small Business and Entrepreneurship (USASBE), which has been successfully operating in the USA for 52 years. Geralyn Franklin, President of USASBE, and Dean of the College of Business at the University of South Florida, came specifically to tell her colleagues about the structure of USASBE, an organization that unites about 800 people disseminating knowledge about SMEs and entrepreneurship. They include scholars, authors of training courses in psychology and dramatic art, as well as professors of classical business subjects. USASBE members are entitled to free journals and information bulletins in the field of entrepreneurship; they improve their skills at seminars and workshops; and they meet annually for a major conference in various US cities. USASBE is part of the International Council for Small Business. Following the above model, the Association for Entrepreneurship Education will be able to identify the best programs and use them to establish higher levels of training. Association members will regularly take part in Global Entrepreneurship Week thus creating a bridge via which the most up-to-date entrepreneurial knowledge will enter this country. Ludmila Murgulets, Vice President of the Stockholm School of Economics, has been elected President of the Association for Entrepreneurship Education.

Organizations Involved in Entrepreneurship Education

The United States Association for Small Business and Entrepreneurship (USASBE) is dedicated to advancing the theory, practice, and significance of entrepreneurship and small business. Founded in 1957, USASBE is an inclusive community of educators, researchers, and practitioners who are seeking to enhance entrepreneurial outcomes on a global scale. One of its key offerings is the annual conference that brings together top minds in entrepreneurship to share their research and teaching practices. USASBE also provides various resources such as journals, information bulletins, and professional development opportunities. Members benefit from a network of peers, access to cutting-edge research, and insights into the latest trends affecting small businesses and entrepreneurs.
page_cooked.page_title: Association for Entrepreneurship Education Launched
page_cooked.page_description: The Center for Entrepreneurship has initiated the Association for Entrepreneurship Education, designed to integrate the best practices of Western and local domains.
page_cooked.page_keywords: Entrepreneurship Education, Center for Entrepreneurship, USASBE, business training, entrepreneurial knowledge

The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- News russian version News 29 Febriary Moscow Entrepreneurship Group:Outsourcing for Growth:Minimizing Risks and Increasing Efficiency Entrepreneur  Irina Nikiforova, President , Zimaletto , will focus on why his company decided to use outsourcing, the criteria used in choosing partners, steps in outsourcing, controlling quality when outsourcing, and efficiencies gained when using outsourcing. Entrepreneur  Mikhail Khazov, President, Kosmoteros, will present a case study on an unsuccessful outsourcing experience and lessons learned and advice on how to choose an outsourcing partner. Service Provider  Inna Kachalova, Lawyer , Pepeliaev, Goltsblat & Partners will discuss the legal aspects of outsourcing; contracts; outsourcing activities subject to licensing; and responsibility of an outsourcing company, and methods to ensure they deliver. Consultant  Vyacheslav Lev, Associate Partner, and Natalia Oparina, Partner, Top-Management Consult , will discuss outsourcing myths; pluses and minuses of outsourcing; how to estimate if outsourcing is economically justified; how to minimize outsourcing risks; and will give advice on personnel outsourcing. Outsourcing for Growth: Minimizing Risks and Increasing Efficiency

February 29, 2008

Maximizing Business Efficiency Through Outsourcing

Entrepreneur Irina Nikiforova, President of Zimaletto, will focus on why her company decided to use outsourcing, the criteria used in choosing partners, steps in outsourcing, controlling quality when outsourcing, and efficiencies gained when using outsourcing. Service Provider Inna Kachalova, Lawyer at Pepeliaev, Goltsblat & Partners will discuss the legal aspects of outsourcing; contracts; outsourcing activities subject to licensing; responsibility of an outsourcing company; and methods to ensure they deliver. Consultant Vyacheslav Lev, Associate Partner, and Natalia Oparina, Partner at Top-Management Consult, will discuss outsourcing myths, pluses and minuses of outsourcing, how to estimate if outsourcing is economically justified, how to minimize outsourcing risks, and will give advice on personnel outsourcing.

About our Key Organizations

Zimaletto is a renowned company known for its innovative approaches in the fashion industry. Pepeliaev, Goltsblat & Partners is a leading law firm providing comprehensive legal support in the field of outsourcing. Top-Management Consult offers expert consulting services for businesses aiming to optimize their operations through outsourcing. These organizations bring a wealth of experience and knowledge that can help other businesses navigate the complexities of outsourcing and achieve substantial growth.
page_cooked.page_title: Outsourcing for Growth: Minimizing Risks and Increasing Efficiency
page_cooked.page_description: Learn from seasoned entrepreneurs and experts about the benefits and risks of outsourcing, steps to ensure quality, and economic justifications at The Center for Entrepreneurship discussion.
page_cooked.page_keywords: outsourcing, entrepreneurship, risk management, quality control, efficiency, business growth

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Customized Programs for Entrepreneurial Success

May 1, 2011

The Center for Entrepreneurship Offers Tailored Programs to Enhance Business Knowledge

The Center for Entrepreneurship offers customized worldwide programs that improve an entrepreneurs functional business knowledge and develop skills important for company success. These programs cover areas such as entrepreneurial marketing and business planning. Additionally, they help entrepreneurs overcome environmental challenges that hinder company growth, such as protecting intellectual property, utilizing the legal system, and approaching capital providers. The Center utilizes a robust delivery methodology, including focused courses, workshops, peer learning events, and networking opportunities. These programs foster not only entrepreneur-to-entrepreneur but also mentor-to-entrepreneur, entrepreneur-to-investor, and entrepreneur-to-policymaker learning. By bringing together all the players that influence entrepreneurial success, the Center offers unique, integrated, and experiential learning programs.

Key Organizations in Entrepreneurial Support

Among the key organizations supporting entrepreneurial growth is Ernst & Young, which sponsors the prestigious Entrepreneur of the Year program. This program recognizes entrepreneurs who demonstrate excellence and extraordinary success in areas such as innovation, financial performance, and personal commitment to their businesses and communities. Fasttrac, one of the programs under the Center, is a leading educational initiative that provides entrepreneurs with the tools to build their businesses. It includes a series of workshops and courses that cover critical aspects of business management, market research, and strategic planning. Moreover, the Entrepreneurship Groups offer a platform for continued learning and peer networking, enabling participants to share experiences and insights, thus fostering a collaborative community of like-minded individuals dedicated to entrepreneurial success.
page_cooked.page_title: Customized Programs for Entrepreneurial Success
page_cooked.page_description: Learn about the Center for Entrepreneurships tailored programs that enhance business knowledge and develop essential skills for entrepreneurs to achieve company success.
page_cooked.page_keywords: entrepreneurship, business knowledge, entrepreneur programs, networking, mentoring, entrepreneurial success, intellectual property, capital providers

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Entrepreneurs as Leaders in Business and Society

June 23, 2011

Insights from Leading Entrepreneurs on Leadership in Business and Society

The Center for Entrepreneurship is hosting its annual conference titled Entrepreneurs as Leaders in Business and Society. This event will feature distinguished speakers like Maxim Nogotkov, Sergey Vykhodtsev, Viktor Klimov, and author and expert in entrepreneurship Ray Smilor. This conference aims to provide valuable insights into the role of entrepreneurs as pivotal leaders in both business and society, sharing their experiences and best practices to inspire new generations of leaders to drive innovation and growth.

Key Organizations and Initiatives

Ernst & Young is one of the prominent organizations involved in supporting and recognizing entrepreneurs through their prestigious Global Entrepreneurship Week. This annual event celebrates and fosters the spirit of entrepreneurship around the globe. Additionally, the MIRBIS business school supports entrepreneurship education through partnerships and events aimed at enhancing the capabilities of current and future business leaders. Similarly, the OPORA RUSSIA organization focuses on empowering small and medium-sized enterprises to elevate their contributions to economic development and societal advancement. These organizations play a crucial role in nurturing entrepreneurial talent and fostering a supportive ecosystem for business growth.

content_item.parsed_text: Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city to receive our e-Bulletin (3 times a year) Last Name First Name Company Title E-mail Telephone City Industry - Agriculture Construction and Real Estate Consulting Food Industry Investor Legal Media NGO Production Other Russian Government Services Technology Transport/Logistics U.S. Government University Education Role Manager Entrepreneur Top Manager Instructor Government Employee Expert Student Other Submit Русский Join us on Facebook Twitter Subscribe For announcements of upcoming events and/or our e-Bulletin About Programs for Entrepreneurs Entrepreneurship Groups Conferences FastTrac Seminars Mentoring Program Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program Archive Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development Resource Center Partners Contacts Developing Entrepreneurial Companies September 27, 2012 Thursday, September 27, 2012 Radisson Royal Hotel, Moscow, Russia Center for Entrepreneurship held its annual conference "Developing Entrepreneurial Companies " . The event  provided entrepreneurs with a platform to discuss best practices in leading their company’s growth, including how to use information technology, personnel management, raising capital, and the role entrepreneurs play in creating jobs, national wealth and developing society. Event Agenda: 9:30 – 9:45 - Welcome address to participants and overview of the conference agenda Victor Sedov , President, Center for Entrepreneurship 9:45 – 10:45 – "The Entrepreneurial Ecosystem" Jonathan Ortmans, President, Global Entrepreneurship Week; Senior Fellow, Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation; Chairman, Global Entrepreneurship Congress I nternationally renown expert in building effective entrepreneurship ecosystems, Mr. Ortmans  discussed global best practices in creating conditions for fostering small and medium businesses, how to develop a culture that embraces entrepreneurship, and compared the experiences in developing and developed countries in advancing entrepreneurship. 10:45 – 12:00– Moderated Discussion “Russia’s Entrepreneurial Ecosystem: Today and Tomorrow” In this discussion, experts discussed the process of creating an healthy entrepreneurship eco-system in Russia. Moderator - Sergey Borisov, President, "OPORA RUSSIA" Panel Members: Natalia Larionova, Director, Department of Small and Medium Business and Competition, Ministry of Economic Development of the Russian Federation Elena Bocherova , Deputy Director, Federal Agency for Youth Yury Rubin , President of Russian Association for Entrepreneurship Education (RAEE),Rector of Moscow University for Industry and Finance "Synergy" Olesya Teploukhova, Deputy Chairman of the Board, member of the board Oscar Hartmann , General Director, KupiVIP; President, Foundation of Russian Economy 12:00 – 12:20 – Coffee Break 12:20 -13:30 – Sales: International vs. Regional Expansion Case Studies Presenters: Entering the U.S. and European Markets Andrey Korneev , Chief Executive Officer, Research Center Bioform Alex Kosik, СEO, Gravitonus Inc. Developing Regional Businesses Oleg Husaenov, Chairman of the Board, International Automobile Holding, Atlant-M 13:30 – 14:30 – Lunch 14:30 – 17:00 – Creating Effective Business Models Master Class by Patrick van der Pijl, СEO, Business Models Inc. Expert and producer of the global bestseller, “Business Model Generation: A Handbook for Visionaries, Game Changers, and Challengers”. Mr. van der Pijl gave a practical master class on the most effective ways to optimize your organization’s business model to grow your business and increase sales. The world is changing at a high speed. The shelf life of business models becomes shorter and shorter. We need new tools and skills to understand, design and innovate business models. Patrick provided an introduction to why business modelling is so popular, explaining the business model canvas and providing practical examples of how you can innovate and test your own business model. 17:00 – 17:20 – Coffee Break 17:20 – 17:40 - Open Innovation as an Instrument to Grow Entrepreneurial Companies Ekaterina Inozemtseva , Strategy Director, Skolkovo Foundation 17:40 – 18:00 – Creating an Innovation Lab and Managing Innovation in your Business (Case Study) Yan Abubakirov , General manager, a group of companies "TETRA Electric" 18:00 – 18:20 – Signing Ceremony for First Members of the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development 18:20 – 18:30 – Conference Closing 18:30 – 21:00 – Gala celebration honoring the 10th anniversary of the Center for Entrepreneurship and the Entrepreneurship Ecosystem Awards ceremony Participation fee: The fixed price for all entrepreneurs: 9000 rubles (including VAT); Sponsors: Strategic Partner: Sponsors: Supported by the entrepreneurial companies: Information Partners: Exclusive Sponsor of the reception: Download Material 's presentation (pptx, 1.07 MB) 's presentation (pptx, 1.58 MB) 's presentation (pptx, 1.71 MB) 's speech (ppt, 5.25 MB) Photos 1 of 6 Videos В вашем браузере отключен JavaScript ← Return to Events List © The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 2010 Site Map Development — Webmaster.SPb

Developing Entrepreneurial Companies

September 27, 2012

Annual Conference on Developing Entrepreneurial Companies

The Center for Entrepreneurship held its annual conference Developing Entrepreneurial Companies. The event provided entrepreneurs with a platform to discuss best practices in leading their company's growth, including how to use information technology, personnel management, raising capital, and the role entrepreneurs play in creating jobs, national wealth, and developing society.

Key Organizations and Participants

Global Entrepreneurship Week's President, Jonathan Ortmans, discussed global best practices in creating conditions for fostering small and medium businesses. Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation's Senior Fellow shared experiences in developing cultures that embrace entrepreneurship. The event also featured talks and case studies by CEOs like Andrey Korneev of Research Center Bioform and Patrick van der Pijl of Business Models Inc. Their insights spanned topics from mastering sales in international markets to optimizing business models for growth and innovation.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
FOOD STARTUPS Forum Highlights

March 27, 2013

Insights and Trends at FOOD STARTUPS Forum

The Center for Entrepreneurship is excited to announce the FOOD STARTUPS Forum, taking place at the restaurant-bar 'Projector'. The event aims to bring together various food projects, mentors, and investors in the food industry. Attendees will gain insights into the current trends, analytics, and case studies of both Russian and international food startups. The event showcases presentations from leading food industry experts and offers networking opportunities for entrepreneurs looking to scale their ventures. Don't miss out on this unique opportunity to connect with key players and stay up-to-date with the latest industry developments.

Key Organizations and Partners

One of the highlighted programs at the Forum is the Global Entrepreneurship Week, which promotes entrepreneurial initiatives worldwide. Another noteworthy entity is Ernst & Young, renowned for their Entrepreneur of the Year program that recognizes exceptional business talents. The event is organized by STARTUP WOMEN, a partner of the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development, which supports and empowers female entrepreneurs across various industries. These organizations play a vital role in fostering innovation and growth within the entrepreneurial ecosystem, providing resources and mentorship to budding startups.

The Center for Entrepreneurship is excited to announce the FOOD STARTUPS Forum, taking place at the restaurant-bar 'Projector'. The event aims to bring together various food projects, mentors, and investors in the food industry. Attendees will gain insights into the current trends, analytics, and case studies of both Russian and international food startups. The event showcases presentations from leading food industry experts and offers networking opportunities for entrepreneurs looking to scale their ventures. Don't miss out on this unique opportunity to connect with key players and stay up-to-date with the latest industry developments.

Key Organizations and Partners

One of the highlighted programs at the Forum is the Global Entrepreneurship Week, which promotes entrepreneurial initiatives worldwide. Another noteworthy entity is Ernst & Young, renowned for their Entrepreneur of the Year program that recognizes exceptional business talents. The event is organized by STARTUP WOMEN, a partner of the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development, which supports and empowers female entrepreneurs across various industries. These organizations play a vital role in fostering innovation and growth within the entrepreneurial ecosystem, providing resources and mentorship to budding startups.

Paths to Success for Women in Business

August 20, 2016

Empowering Women Through Networking and Learning

This conference is designed to bring together business and professional women to increase business knowledge and motivation by being engaged in networking and learning surrounded by like-minded individuals. Participants will have the opportunity to make connections, build relationships, create opportunities, and find a better work-life balance in an interactive and creative atmosphere.

Key Organizations Supporting the Event

Ernst & Young is a multinational professional services network and one of the largest audit firms in the world. The Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program celebrates the achievements of outstanding entrepreneurs who demonstrate vision, leadership, and success. DD Atelier is a renowned fashion brand that focuses on designing and producing tailored attire for women, promoting empowerment through fashion. Additionally, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce is a key partner, working to support and advocate for businesses of all sizes across industries.

content_item.parsed_text: Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city to receive our e-Bulletin (3 times a year) Last Name First Name Company Title E-mail Telephone City Industry - Agriculture Construction and Real Estate Consulting Food Industry Investor Legal Media NGO Production Other Russian Government Services Technology Transport/Logistics U.S. Government University Education Role Manager Entrepreneur Top Manager Instructor Government Employee Expert Student Other Submit Русский Join us on Facebook Twitter Subscribe For announcements of upcoming events and/or our e-Bulletin About Programs for Entrepreneurs Entrepreneurship Groups Conferences FastTrac Seminars Mentoring Program Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program Archive Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development Resource Center Partners Contacts CFE Annual Conference “Entrepreneurs as Leaders in Business and Society” June 23, 2011 Thursday, June 23, 2011 Radisson Royal Hotel, Moscow, Russia Center for Entrepreneurship is holding its annual conference "Entrepreneurs as Leaders in Business and Society" . The event will provide entrepreneurs with a platform to discuss best practices in leading their company’s growth, including how to use information technology, personnel management, raising capital, and the role entrepreneurs play in creating jobs, national wealth and developing society. The event is in Russian and English with simultaneous interpretation. Event Agenda: 08:30 - 09:00: Registration and welcome coffee 09:00 - 09:40: Welcome Addresses •    Victor Sedov, President, Center for Entrepreneurship •    Natalia Larionova, Director, SME Development Department, Ministry of Economic Development of the Russian Federation •    Andrei Korkunov, Vice-President, OPORA ROSSII •    Phidias Pilides, Chairman of the Board, Cyprus Investment Promotion Agency 9:40 – 10:40: Leadership That Lasts: How Entrepreneurs Lead Growth Companies Dr. Ray Smilor, Texas Christian University, Author and editor of more than 15 books on entrepreneurship This master class will focus on the personal dimensions of leadership. It highlights three powerful attributes of leadership – authenticity, trust and optimism – those that inspire people to follow leaders. Through giving examples, practical recommendations, and useful worksheets, the session provides participants with effective ways of enhancing their leadership skills. 10:40 – 11:00: Coffee Break and Networking 11:00 – 12:30: Information and Internet Technologies for Business Development Entrepreneurs and experts discuss new trends in the development of information and Internet technologies, how information and mobile technology development will affect future consumer behavior, and using internet and social networking tools to attract and retain customers. Panelmembers: • Natalia Matveeva , Director for Strategic Development, Realore Studios • Denis Margolin, Vice President, Mobile Development, DataArt • Igor Borovikov , Chairman of the Board, Softline • Boris Akimov , General Director, Lavka 12:30 – 13:45: Lunch 13:45 – 15:15: Break-Out Sessions: Session One: Search for talent: attracting and keeping the best personnel Speakers will discuss how to find talent during Russia’s demographic crisis; creative approaches to selecting and hiring talent, career expectations of the next generation, and retaining, motivating and developing highly professional specialists. • Finding excellent personnel in the era of an ageing population • Non-standard techniques for searching talents Inna Mozhayskaya , General Director, "Mozhayskaya&Partners" • Retaining and motivating highly qualified professionals Yury Rubtsov , President, Score Group • Practical approaches to motivation and talent development Dmitry Agarunov , General Director, Gameland Session Two: Raising capital for business growth Speakers will discuss trends in private equity; credit programs; Cyprus as a springboard to international expansion and capital; packaging a company for investment; and a case study of raising capital at an entrepreneurial company. • Private equity investment trends in Russia Kirill Veselov , Investment Director, Mint Capital • Leasing as a tool of support for small and medium business Alexey Akindinov, General Director, Ros-BR • Alternative funding for small and medium businesses Nadezhda Martynova, Vice Managing Chair, The Russian Bank for Development • Using Cyprus as Your Springboard for International Expansion Mr. Phidias Pilides, Chairman, Board of Directors, Cyprus Investment Promotion Agency (CIPA) • Preparing a company for a deal with investor Ekaterina Sedova, Senior Manager, Ernst&Young • Case Study: An entrepreneur’s experience in attracting investment Alexander Gloushkov, president, MONE salons 15:15 – 15:45: Coffee Break 15:45 – 17:00: Entrepreneurs and Society Moderated Discussion on roles entrepreneurs play in mentoring young entrepreneurs, developing socially responsible businesses, and improving the culture for entrepreneurship in Russia. Moderator: Boris Tkachenko , Director of the Russian Affiliate, International Business Leaders Forum Panel members: • Maxim Nogotkov , President, Svyaznoy • Arkady Lopukhov , Founder, Moscow club of Entrepreneurs • Sergey Vykhodtsev, President, Velle • Alexey Komissarov, General Director, Autorepair Systems 17:00 – 17:30: Entrepreneur as Leader in Business and Society Keynote address by Alexander Brechalov , Member, Board of Directors, Uniastrum Bank, Vice-president of all-Russian Noncommercial Small and Mid-Size Entrepreneurship Organization OPORA ROSSII Alexander Brechalov will share his experience in building Uniastrum Bank, one of the top 10 banks in Russia, and also discuss his efforts to promote entrepreneurship in Russia through his work in OPORA ROSSII. 17:30 - 17:45: Closing Remarks 18:00 - 20:00: 2011 CFE Entrepreneurship Development Awards followed by a Networking Reception The event is in Russian and English with simultaneous interpretation. Event venue: Radisson Royal Hotel, Moscow, Russia Conference Times: 9:00 to 18:10 Gala Reception Follows at: 18:10 to 20:00 Sponsors of the conference: Strategic Partner: General Sponsor: Sponsors: Supported by: Exclusive sponsor of the reception: Supported by the entrepreneurial companies: Information Partners: Participation fee: For entrepreneurs from Moscow and Moscow region: 6000 rubles (including VAT); For participants from other Russian cities: 4800 rubles (including VAT). Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program recognizes leaders who drive sustainable growth in their businesses.
