content_item.parsed_text: Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city to receive our e-Bulletin (3 times a year) Last Name First Name Company Title E-mail Telephone City Industry - Agriculture Construction and Real Estate Consulting Food Industry Investor Legal Media NGO Production Other Russian Government Services Technology Transport/Logistics U.S. Government University Education Role Manager Entrepreneur Top Manager Instructor Government Employee Expert Student Other Submit Русский Join us on Facebook Twitter Subscribe For announcements of upcoming events and/or our e-Bulletin About Programs for Entrepreneurs Entrepreneurship Groups Conferences FastTrac Seminars Mentoring Program Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program Archive Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development Resource Center Partners Contacts Entrepreneurship group "Franchising: Solutions for Business Development" March 3, 2011 The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship held a meeting of the Nizhny Novgorod Entrepreneurship Group on the topic: "Franchising: Solutions for Business Development", held in the format of a business breakfast on March 3 at the restaurant "Alexandrovsky Garden". At the meeting the members of Entrepreneurship Group had an opportunity not only to communicate in a comfortable atmosphere but to meet new, interesting people, and get useful information. We had invited speakers, successful representatives of the Nizhny Novgorod and St. Petersburg business, who spoke about practice of their companies in the context of the unit. Guest-cpeakers: Andrey Popov (business development consultant "Subway Rush Service Company, St. Petersburg) spoke about creating a successful franchise network as an example of fast food chain SUBWAY; gave valuable advice to entrepreneurs who were interested in buying a franchise. Marya Iljina (Director of franchising project Spar Middle Volga, Nizhny Novgorod, Russia) talked about how to build relationships between the franchisor and the franchisee, the typical mistakes that both parties commit and how to avoid them. Michael Trishin (Director General of OOO "Consult Studio", the author of Russia's first tutorial on the development of the franchise package: http://infopraktik.ru/product/ # 1) talked about the development of a franchise package and building franchise network, as well as the difference between foreign and "our" franchise. Alexander Skornyakov (Director of Franchise Network of cafeterias "Tea Spoon", St. Petersburg) shared his experience of working at a franchising company "Tea Spoon." page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Franchising: Solutions for Business Development

March 3, 2011

A Closer Look at Franchising for Business Growth

The Center for Entrepreneurship recently held a successful meeting focusing on franchising as a solution for business development. The event, hosted in a business breakfast format, provided a renewed networking opportunity, information exchange, and business insights. Key speakers included Andrey Popov, a business development consultant from Subway, who delved into strategies for creating a successful franchise network. Marya Iljina, the Director of franchising project of Spar Middle Volga, spoke on the dynamics between franchisors and franchisees and common pitfalls to avoid. Michael Trishin, CEO of OOO 'Consult Studio', discussed the development of franchise packages and contrasts between local and international franchises. Lastly, Alexander Skornyakov, Director of Franchise Network of Tea Spoon, shared his leadership experiences in growing a successful franchise network.

About The Center for Entrepreneurship

The Center for Entrepreneurship is dedicated to fostering the spirit of entrepreneurship by providing resources, training, and networking opportunities to budding and established entrepreneurs. They host various programs including Fasttrac, which offers comprehensive entrepreneurial training, and the Scaleup Club, designed to support businesses in their growth phase. Through its seminars, mentoring programs, and conferences, The Center for Entrepreneurship empowers entrepreneurs to innovate and scale their businesses effectively. For more information and to stay updated on upcoming events, consider subscribing to their e-Bulletin, available three times a year.

page_cooked.page_description: Discover insights from successful entrepreneurs on franchising as a business development solution, hosted by The Center for Entrepreneurship.

Entrepreneurship Education Initiatives in Universities

November 19, 2010

Highlighting Best Practices in Entrepreneurship Education

This conference organized by The Center for Entrepreneurship and supported by the MIRBIS business school will be held as a signature event for Global Entrepreneurship Week. The conference will highlight best practices in entrepreneurship education in universities.

Key Organizations Supporting Entrepreneurship Education

Global Entrepreneurship Week is an initiative that introduces entrepreneurship to young people in six continents. Founded by the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation and the UKs Enterprise Campaign, this week-long event inspires millions to explore entrepreneurial activities. Another crucial supporter, MIRBIS business school, offers high-quality business education and is known for its international orientation. The Center for Entrepreneurship consistently organizes such initiatives, supporting the development of a robust entrepreneurial ecosystem.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Great Habits to Be Great Entrepreneur

January 29, 2010

Join the Workshop by Verne Harnish on Effective Entrepreneurship

The Center for Entrepreneurship, in collaboration with the Entrepreneurs' Organization, was privileged to host a workshop entitled 'Great Habits to Be Great Entrepreneur. Growth Tools' featuring renowned speaker and author Verne Harnish. In this workshop, Harnish shared valuable insights on team-building, management, and motivation strategies, which are essential for any entrepreneur aiming for greatness. This event, part of the Scaleup Acceleration Program, was a significant opportunity for attendees to enhance their entrepreneurial skills.

About the Collaborating Organizations

The Entrepreneurs' Organization (EO) is a global network of entrepreneurs dedicated to helping small and large business owners achieve their full potential through peer-to-peer learning and connections. EO provides invaluable resources and support, fostering a thriving community where members can share their experiences and gain insights from each other. Another key partner, Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program, recognizes and celebrates the accomplishments of exceptional entrepreneurs who inspire others with their vision, leadership, and achievement. This program provides not only recognition but also access to a valuable network that can help entrepreneurs grow and scale their businesses. Their combined efforts with The Center for Entrepreneurship aim to provide a comprehensive platform for entrepreneurial development and success.

page_cooked.page_description: Learn about effective team-building, management, and motivation strategies for entrepreneurs from the workshop 'Great Habits to Be Great Entrepreneur'. The event featured Verne Harnish, author of the best-seller 'Mastering the Rockefeller Habits'.

January 29, 2010

Join the Workshop by Verne Harnish on Effective Entrepreneurship

The Center for Entrepreneurship, in collaboration with the Entrepreneurs' Organization, was privileged to host a workshop entitled 'Great Habits to Be Great Entrepreneur. Growth Tools' featuring renowned speaker and author Verne Harnish. In this workshop, Harnish shared valuable insights on team-building, management, and motivation strategies, which are essential for any entrepreneur aiming for greatness. This event, part of the Scaleup Acceleration Program, was a significant opportunity for attendees to enhance their entrepreneurial skills.

About the Collaborating Organizations

The Entrepreneurs' Organization (EO) is a global network of entrepreneurs dedicated to helping small and large business owners achieve their full potential through peer-to-peer learning and connections. EO provides invaluable resources and support, fostering a thriving community where members can share their experiences and gain insights from each other. Another key partner, Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program, recognizes and celebrates the accomplishments of exceptional entrepreneurs who inspire others with their vision, leadership, and achievement. This program provides not only recognition but also access to a valuable network that can help entrepreneurs grow and scale their businesses. Their combined efforts with The Center for Entrepreneurship aim to provide a comprehensive platform for entrepreneurial development and success.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Changing Direction: I Am Opening a New Business!

June 25, 2009

Insights from Experienced Entrepreneurs on Opening a New Business

On June 25, 2009, The Center for Entrepreneurship held its regular meeting of the Entrepreneurship Group, focusing on the theme, 'Changing direction: I am opening a new business!' Experienced entrepreneurs shared their wisdom on selecting a new business direction and overcoming difficulties along the way. Whether you're cutting facility management costs, navigating economic contexts, or leading during crises, the diverse insights can guide new business founders in making informed decisions.

Further Insights from Key Organizations

The meeting had several sessions focused on practical challenges and solutions for new entrepreneurs. Topics included cutting infrastructure costs and understanding the socioeconomic and cultural context of entrepreneurship. The keynote speakers were experts from various fields, offering diverse perspectives on business leadership and management strategies. One notable program, Global Entrepreneurship Week, encourages collaboration and innovation among entrepreneurs worldwide, helping them scale their ideas effectively. Additionally, the Fasttrac program and Young Entrepreneurs Alliance provided resources and guidance tailored to young and emerging business leaders. These initiatives underline the importance of mentorship, strategic planning, and adapting to market changes. For more information, The Center for Entrepreneurship offers numerous resources, including seminars and conferences, aimed at supporting and fostering entrepreneurship.

Effective Distribution Channels for FMCG and Retail Businesses

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Entrepreneur as a leader in business and public life

June 23, 2011

The Role of Entrepreneurs in Business and Public Life

The Center for Entrepreneurship holds its annual conference 'Entrepreneur as a leader in business and public life.' This event brings together entrepreneurs and policymakers to discuss strategies for business growth and public impact. The conference focuses on building innovative companies, values-based management, leadership, and raising capital. It provides a platform for attendees to learn from experienced professionals and connect with like-minded individuals. The event also features panels and workshops aimed at fostering entrepreneurial culture and addressing policy issues that affect the growth of new businesses.

Key Organizations Supporting Entrepreneurs

Several key organizations partner with The Center for Entrepreneurship to support this initiative. Ernst & Young is well-known for its 'Entrepreneur of the Year' program, which celebrates outstanding entrepreneurs. Another significant partner is the U.S. Department of Commerce, which collaborates on forums that connect entrepreneurs with policymakers. These partnerships are essential in creating a supportive environment for entrepreneurial growth. The Center also collaborates with regional groups to address policy and foster a favorable ecosystem for new businesses. These efforts are instrumental in empowering entrepreneurs with the knowledge and resources they need to succeed.

The event  provided entrepreneurs with a platform to discuss best practices in leading their company’s growth, including how to use information technology, personnel management, raising capital, and the role entrepreneurs play in creating jobs, national wealth and developing society. Event Agenda: 9:30 – 9:45 - Welcome address to participants and overview of the conference agenda Victor Sedov , President, Center for Entrepreneurship 9:45 – 10:45 – "The Entrepreneurial Ecosystem" Jonathan Ortmans, President, Global Entrepreneurship Week; Senior Fellow, Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation; Chairman, Global Entrepreneurship Congress I nternationally renown expert in building effective entrepreneurship ecosystems, Mr. Ortmans  discussed global best practices in creating conditions for fostering small and medium businesses, how to develop a culture that embraces entrepreneurship, and compared the experiences in developing and developed countries in advancing entrepreneurship. 10:45 – 12:00– Moderated Discussion “Russia’s Entrepreneurial Ecosystem: Today and Tomorrow” In this discussion, experts discussed the process of creating an healthy entrepreneurship eco-system in Russia. Moderator - Sergey Borisov, President, "OPORA RUSSIA" Panel Members: Natalia Larionova, Director, Department of Small and Medium Business and Competition, Ministry of Economic Development of the Russian Federation Elena Bocherova , Deputy Director, Federal Agency for Youth Yury Rubin , President of Russian Association for Entrepreneurship Education (RAEE),Rector of Moscow University for Industry and Finance "Synergy" Olesya Teploukhova, Deputy Chairman of the Board, member of the board Oscar Hartmann , General Director, KupiVIP; President, Foundation of Russian Economy 12:00 – 12:20 – Coffee Break 12:20 -13:30 – Sales: International vs. Regional Expansion Case Studies Presenters: Entering the U.S. and European Markets Andrey Korneev , Chief Executive Officer, Research Center Bioform Alex Kosik, СEO, Gravitonus Inc. Developing Regional Businesses Oleg Husaenov, Chairman of the Board, International Automobile Holding, Atlant-M 13:30 – 14:30 – Lunch 14:30 – 17:00 – Creating Effective Business Models Master Class by Patrick van der Pijl, СEO, Business Models Inc. Expert and producer of the global bestseller, “Business Model Generation: A Handbook for Visionaries, Game Changers, and Challengers”. Mr. van der Pijl gave a practical master class on the most effective ways to optimize your organization’s business model to grow your business and increase sales. The world is changing at a high speed. The shelf life of business models becomes shorter and shorter. We need new tools and skills to understand, design and innovate business models. Patrick provided an introduction to why business modelling is so popular, explaining the business model canvas and providing practical examples of how you can innovate and test your own business model. 17:00 – 17:20 – Coffee Break 17:20 – 17:40 - Open Innovation as an Instrument to Grow Entrepreneurial Companies Ekaterina Inozemtseva , Strategy Director, Skolkovo Foundation 17:40 – 18:00 – Creating an Innovation Lab and Managing Innovation in your Business (Case Study) Yan Abubakirov , General manager, a group of companies "TETRA Electric" 18:00 – 18:20 – Signing Ceremony for First Members of the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development 18:20 – 18:30 – Conference Closing 18:30 – 21:00 – Gala celebration honoring the 10th anniversary of the Center for Entrepreneurship and the Entrepreneurship Ecosystem Awards ceremony Participation fee: The fixed price for all entrepreneurs: 9000 rubles (including VAT); Sponsors: Strategic Partner: Sponsors: Supported by the entrepreneurial companies: Information Partners: Exclusive Sponsor of the reception: Download Material 's presentation (pptx, 1.07 MB) 's presentation (pptx, 1.58 MB) 's presentation (pptx, 1.71 MB) 's speech (ppt, 5.25 MB) Photos 1 of 6 Videos В вашем браузере отключен JavaScript ← Return to Events List © The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 2010 Site Map Development — Webmaster.SPb

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Developing Entrepreneurial Companies

November 7, 2012

Join the Annual Conference on Developing Entrepreneurial Companies

The Center for Entrepreneurship held its annual conference, providing a platform for entrepreneurs to discuss best practices in company growth, information technology, personnel management, capital raising, and the role of entrepreneurs in creating jobs and national wealth. The event began with a welcome address and an overview of the conference agenda, followed by sessions on The Entrepreneurial Ecosystem by Jonathan Ortmans and a moderated discussion on the state and future of entrepreneurship. Experts discussed the creation of a healthy entrepreneurial ecosystem, highlighting both global and regional perspectives. The conference also featured case studies on international vs. regional business expansion and a master class on effective business models by Patrick van der Pijl. The event concluded with sessions on open innovation and managing innovation, followed by a gala celebration and the signing ceremony for the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development.

Key Organizations Involved

Jonathan Ortmans, President of Global Entrepreneurship Week, shared his insights on fostering entrepreneurship ecosystems. Global Entrepreneurship Week is a celebration of innovators who dream big and launch startups that bring ideas to life. Patrick van der Pijl, expert and producer of the bestseller Business Model Generation, conducted a master class on business model innovation. His organization, Business Models Inc., helps global businesses innovate and design new business models. The session on innovation was led by Ekaterina Inozemtseva, Strategy Director at Skolkovo Foundation. The Skolkovo Foundation aims to accelerate the transformation of Russia from a natural resource-based economy to an innovation-based one. Finally, Yan Abubakirov, General Manager of TETRA Electric, presented a case study on creating an innovation lab and managing innovation in business.

page_cooked.page_description: Join us for the annual conference by The Center for Entrepreneurship. Learn about fostering entrepreneurship, global practices, and innovative business modeling.

content_item.parsed_text: Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city to receive our e-Bulletin (3 times a year) Last Name First Name Company Title E-mail Telephone City Industry - Agriculture Construction and Real Estate Consulting Food Industry Investor Legal Media NGO Production Other Russian Government Services Technology Transport/Logistics U.S. Government University Education Role Manager Entrepreneur Top Manager Instructor Government Employee Expert Student Other Submit Русский Subscribe For announcements of upcoming events and/or our e-Bulletin ﻿ About Programs for Entrepreneurs Entrepreneurship Groups Conferences FastTrac Seminars Mentoring Program Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Conferences Archive Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives Matching Funding Resource Center For Donors Partners Contacts Annual Conference  "Entrepreneur as a leader in business and public life" June 23 Thursday, June 23, 2011 Radisson Royal Hotel The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship holds its annual conference "Entrepreneur as a leader in business and public life" in Moscow on June 23, 2011. New leaders today are those entrepreneurs who were able to overcome the crisis period, running a successfully functioning company and is currently making the transition to the business outlook and values ​​of sustainable business development. All new leaders combine a holistic understanding of success as an effective fusion of business and social achievements, when the achievement of personal and business well-being leads to success and prosperity of society as a whole. The main purpose of the event is to provide entrepreneurs with a platform where they could discuss issues of effective management of a growing company, to share best practices in information technology, personnel management, capital raising, as well as look at entrepreneurship as a source of economic and social spheres of society, the social contract between a businessman and the environment in which it operates. The debate promises to be dynamic, since it is aimed at business owners who want to effectively grow their business, acquire knowledge and establish new contacts and actively participate in solving social problems in Russia. In the first part of the day Dr. Ray Smilor, an expert of world renown in the field of entrepreneurship, will speak on "How to keep the lead: managing growing companies". Further, the conference participants will discuss the use of information technology for business development, as well as take part in one of the thematic sections devoted to finding talent and raising capital. After lunch a discussion on the topic of leadership in public and social life will take place. The official part of the conference report, "Sustainable development and entrepreneurship" will be provided by entrepreneur - Bruce Poon Tip, the founder of the company “Gap Adventures”, internationally recognized for outstanding business solutions. After the main part of the conference participants and guests will take part in the gala evening devoted to the activities of the Center for Entrepreneurship. We will express our appreciation and present commemorative awards to partners and associates of the Centre in development of business environment in Russia. The conclusion of the evening will be devoted to networking. Duration of the conference - from 9:00 to 18:00. The gala party will be held from 18:00 to 20:00. Conference venue - Radisson Royal Hotel (hotel "Ukraine"). We expect about 200 entrepreneurs from Moscow, St. Petersburg and Nizhny Novgorod, representatives of governmental and other organizations within the framework of business support, as well as our international colleagues. Submit Application Form Participation fee: for entrepreneurs from Moscow and Moscow region 6000 rubles (including VAT); for participants from other cities 4800 rubles (including VAT). Entrepreneur as a Leader in Business and Public Life

June 23, 2011

Annual Conference on Entrepreneurship and Public Life

The Center for Entrepreneurship holds its annual conference "Entrepreneur as a leader in business and public life". The main purpose of the event is to provide entrepreneurs with a platform to discuss effective management of growing companies, share best practices in information technology, personnel management, capital raising, and explore the social contract between businessmen and their environment. The event will be dynamic, addressing business owners aiming for growth, knowledge, new contacts, and social problem-solving. Dr. Ray Smilor, an expert in entrepreneurship, will speak on "How to keep the lead: managing growing companies". Conference participants will discuss the use of information technology for business development and participate in thematic sections on talent acquisition and capital raising. Bruce Poon Tip, founder of Gap Adventures, will deliver a report on "Sustainable development and entrepreneurship". The conference will conclude with a gala evening to recognize partners and associates, followed by networking. Duration: 9:00 - 18:00, Gala: 18:00 - 20:00.

Key Organizations and Contributions

The Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year program celebrates the contributions of entrepreneurial leaders across various industries. Facilitating leadership development and acknowledging the achievements of these leaders, this program is vital for fostering a vibrant business community. Another critical entity is Gap Adventures, founded by Bruce Poon Tip. Known for outstanding business solutions and sustainable practices, Gap Adventures serves as a model for integrating business success with social responsibility. The Fasttrac program empowers entrepreneurs with the tools and strategies necessary to sustain business growth. These efforts are critical in promoting sustainable development and supporting the next generation of business leaders.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Programs for Entrepreneurs: Networking and Learning Opportunities

May 2, 2011

Explore Networking and Learning Opportunities for Entrepreneurs

The Center for Entrepreneurship offers a variety of programs designed to support entrepreneurs at different stages of their journey. Key offerings include Fasttrac seminars, mentorship programs, and high-profile conferences. These events bring together industry leaders and experts to discuss essential topics such as raising capital, innovative HR practices, branding, and more. These formal presentations are followed by networking sessions where participants can meet new contacts, potential partners, and clients. Each gathering aims to provide valuable insights and foster partnerships for sustained business growth. The Center's events are known for attracting prominent entrepreneurs who share their experiences and business strategies.

Key Organizations and Their Roles

The Center for Entrepreneurship collaborates with several key organizations to deliver its programs. Programs for Entrepreneurs: Networking and Learning Opportunities

May 2, 2011

Explore Networking and Learning Opportunities for Entrepreneurs

The Center for Entrepreneurship offers a variety of programs designed to support entrepreneurs at different stages of their journey. Key offerings include Fasttrac seminars, mentorship programs, and high-profile conferences. These events bring together industry leaders and experts to discuss essential topics such as raising capital, innovative HR practices, branding, and more. These formal presentations are followed by networking sessions where participants can meet new contacts, potential partners, and clients. Each gathering aims to provide valuable insights and foster partnerships for sustained business growth. The Center's events are known for attracting prominent entrepreneurs who share their experiences and business strategies.

FastTrac programs are resources for entrepreneurs that have been developed by and with hundreds of successful entrepreneurs who have shared their knowledge, insights, and stories so that others might learn from them. In 1998 FastTrac won the Small Business Administration`s Model of Excellence Award for Entrepreneurial Education. CFE offers FastTrac Planning as a nine module, 32.5 hour course that allows entrepreneurs to take a hard look at all aspects of their company and write a new business plan to address present and future needs and to help them manage their company on a daily basis. Entrepreneurs learn with a group of peers, entrepreneurs like themselves, who are working to improve their businesses. They also work with certified facilitators, people with real entrepreneurial business experience, who understand the challenges of operating and growing entrepreneurial business ventures. In this supportive environment, they incubate new business ideas, uncover areas that need reinforcing, and establish a foundation from which to make future decisions. © The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 2010 Site Map Development — Webmaster.SPb

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
FastTrac Planning Program Enhances Entrepreneurship

May 2, 2011

Empowering Entrepreneurs with Comprehensive Business Strategy

Since 2005, The Center for Entrepreneurship has licensed and offered the FastTrac Planning business planning program. FastTrac programs are invaluable resources for entrepreneurs developed with contributions from numerous successful entrepreneurs sharing their knowledge and insights. In 1998, FastTrac won the Small Business Administration's Model of Excellence Award for Entrepreneurial Education. The FastTrac Planning program is a nine-module, 32.5-hour course enabling entrepreneurs to scrutinize every aspect of their companies and draft new business plans to meet current and future needs. Participants collaborate with a group of entrepreneurial peers and certified facilitators—individuals with significant business experience and understanding of entrepreneurial challenges. This supportive setting cultivates new business ideas, addresses areas requiring improvement, and establishes a robust decision-making foundation.

Additional Key Organizations Supporting Entrepreneurs

The FastTrac Planning program is just one of many initiatives put forth by The Center for Entrepreneurship. Entrepreneurs can also benefit from programs like the Startup Huddle, which fosters a supportive environment where entrepreneurs share ideas and receive constructive feedback. Another notable program is the Global Entrepreneurship Week, a global celebration of entrepreneurship marked by events and activities that inspire and support entrepreneurs in over 170 countries. Additionally, the Young Entrepreneurs Alliance offers young business enthusiasts opportunities to connect, learn, and grow in their entrepreneurial journeys. Each of these programs provides unique resources and networking opportunities, significantly contributing to the overall entrepreneurial ecosystem.

The program fosters personalized experience and enables mentors to provide advice not only on business issues, but also general advice as many program participants are just beginning their careers. page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Mentoring Program for Young Entrepreneurs

June 18, 2012

The Center for Entrepreneurship Mentoring Program Launches to Foster Young Talent

In the fall of 2010, The Center for Entrepreneurship launched its mentoring program that pairs young entrepreneurs with mentors. The program fosters personalized experience and enables mentors to provide advice not only on business issues but also general advice as many program participants are just beginning their careers. Mentors serve as a sounding board, provide a second opinion, share lessons from their experiences, and become a trusted long-term relationship. A mentor helps expand a new entrepreneur's business and social network and access to senior decision makers. This one year program includes pre-program training to introduce both mentors and mentees to the skills, knowledge and attitudes necessary to be effective in their respective roles. Over the course of the year, mentors and mentees meet twice a month and mentees are invited to participate in two CFE Entrepreneurship Groups and two CFE 4-hour open enrollment seminars in order to provide a formal learning element to the program. To ensure the success of this program, The Center for Entrepreneurship has partnered with the International Business Leaders Forum which lends their program experience in conducting mentoring programs in 37 countries worldwide.

Partner Organizations

The Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program celebrates successful entrepreneurs, recognizing the positive impact they make in their communities and around the world. The International Business Leaders Forum is a non-profit organization that has played a significant role in nurturing global entrepreneurship by providing resources and sharing expertise in over 37 countries. This collaboration underscores the importance of experienced mentorship for emerging entrepreneurs. The Ashoka Foundation also partners with The Center for Entrepreneurship, promoting social entrepreneurship and innovation. Their expansive network provides critical support systems for young entrepreneurs striving to make a difference. Such partnerships are key to The Center for Entrepreneurship's mission of fostering a supportive ecosystem for startups and growing businesses.

content_item.parsed_text: Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city to receive our e-Bulletin (3 times a year) Last Name First Name Company Title E-mail Telephone City Industry - Agriculture Construction and Real Estate Consulting Food Industry Investor Legal Media NGO Production Other Russian Government Services Technology Transport/Logistics U.S. Government University Education Role Manager Entrepreneur Top Manager Instructor Government Employee Expert Student Other Submit Русский Join us on Facebook Subscribe For announcements of upcoming events and/or our e-Bulletin ﻿ About Programs for Entrepreneurs Entrepreneurship Groups Conferences FastTrac Seminars Mentoring Program Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Program Archive Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives Matching Funding Resource Center For Donors Partners Contacts Seminars The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship (CFE) has developed ten, 4-hour training modules specifically for the Russian market. We conducted surveys of entrepreneurs to determine and prioritize the specific training needs of Russian entrepreneurs and enlisted the expertise of worldwide experts and authors in developing the courses. Once the course was written, we translated, localized the material, and trained Russian entrepreneurs to be facilitators of these modules. Because of their effectiveness, our modules have been donated for use in Eastern Europe at the Centers for Entrepreneurship and Executive Development initiated by the Small Enterprise Assistance Funds with USAID support. Topics of CFE 4-hour learning modules include: Making Winning Presentations to Investors: How to Raise Money to Build Your Company By revealing the secrets of what investors look for in making an investment decision, the program helps entrepreneurs successfully pitch their companies — whether they have 60 minutes at a negotiation table, 6 minutes at a conference, or 60 seconds in an elevator. Seminar authored by Dr. Ray Smilor, author and reviewer of 14 books in entrepreneurial leadership. Raising Capital for Growth As the Russian market matures, entrepreneurs increasingly realize that access to capital to finance growth is essential to increasing their company’s competitive advantage. This seminar, developed in Russia and reflecting the realities of this market, takes participants through the investment process so that they understand various sources of capital and the steps needed to obtain investment. Seminar authored by Konstantin Gubin, Partner, RB Partners, Moscow. An Entrepreneur’s Guide to Strategic Planning To survive and prosper in a permanently changing environment, entrepreneurs must think strategically about the internal and external factors impacting their organizations, and the actions to take in response. This seminar provides participants with hands-on training in methods used to support effective and strategic decision making. Seminar authored by Dr. Alex DeNoble, Head of Entrepreneur Training Programs at San Diego State University (USA). The Power of Numbers: How Entrepreneurs Use Financial Statements to Grow Their Businesses Entrepreneurs who really understand what is behind their companies’ numbers are more credible business leaders. This seminar demonstrates to entrepreneurs that financial statements are an effective, compelling, interesting and powerful tool for business development. Seminar authored by Bill McIntire, Kent State University (USA). Cash Flow Management for Growth When the management of a fast-growing company lacks understanding of how to optimize cash flow, a lack of cash inevitably inhibits growth and sometimes leads to bankruptcy. The seminar shows entrepreneurs how to resolve problems associated with cash flow management. Seminar authored by Bill McIntire, Kent State University (USA). Entrepreneurial Marketing By focusing on the unique marketing challenges and opportunities in fast-growth entrepreneurial firms this workshop shows entrepreneurs innovative and cost-effective marketing techniques to win customers and capture markets. Seminar authored by Dr. Mike Morris, Chair of Entrepreneurship Department, Oklahoma State University (USA), and author of four books. Leading a High Performance Company One of the best investments entrepreneurs can make to ensure the success of their growing companies is to invest in the guiding and driving force of the business — themselves. This seminar reveals the secrets of how entrepreneurs can get the most out of their people and their company. Seminar authored by Dr. Jana Matthews, President, Jana Matthews Group (USA), and author of seven books, including one translated into Russian. Hiring and Retaining Key Staff The seminar teaches entrepreneurs to get outstanding people onboard and ensure the employees’ targets are aligned with business goals. Seminar authored by Dr. Jana Matthews, President, Jana Matthews Group (USA), and author of seven books, including one translated into Russian. Corporate Governance for Successful Entrepreneurs This workshop identifies the key provisions of the Russian Code of Corporate Governance and shows entrepreneurs how to adapt and apply them to their companies. Seminar co-authored by Paul Kouris (U.S. corporate law expert) and Alexander Filatov, Executive Director, Independent Directors Association (Moscow, Russia). Implementing the Balanced Scorecard: Maximizing Performance and Creating Sustainable Results What is needed to successfully implement the selected strategy is a system that provides good insight into an organization’s operations and helps align short-term actions with the strategy. One system that does this is a widespread Balanced Scorecard (BSC) model. Seminar authored by Paul Niven, President of Sanalosa Group, and author of four books, including two translated into Russian. © The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 2010 Site Map Development — Webmaster.SPb

Subscribe to Receive Announcements about Upcoming Events

June 18, 2012

Stay Updated with Our E-Bulletin

Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city and receive our e-Bulletin three times a year. Ensure you never miss out on important updates and opportunities in your industry. Stay informed about various programs for entrepreneurs, including Fasttrac, conferences, seminars, and mentoring programs. Our comprehensive training modules, crafted by global experts, are designed to enhance entrepreneurial skills and business acumen across various sectors. Whether you're a manager, entrepreneur, or student, our resources are tailored to help you succeed.

Key Organizations Supporting Entrepreneurs

Ernst & Young is renowned for its Entrepreneur of the Year program, celebrating the achievements of innovative business leaders across the globe. Kent State University is known for its robust business and entrepreneurship programs. Experts from this institution, such as Bill McIntire, provide invaluable insights into financial management and growth strategies. Oklahoma State University supports entrepreneurial marketing initiatives through the expertise of Dr. Mike Morris, who specializes in innovative marketing techniques for fast-growth firms. These organizations play a crucial role in empowering the next generation of entrepreneurs.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives by The Center for Entrepreneurship

May 1, 2011

Youth Entrepreneurship Education and Promotion

The Center for Entrepreneurship's youth entrepreneurship initiatives promote entrepreneurship as a viable career alternative to ensure future generations are able to fulfill their entrepreneurial potential. The Center for Entrepreneurship is a co-host for Global Entrepreneurship Week and promotes university entrepreneurship education by training instructors and professors in how to teach entrepreneurship. They also founded and support the Association of Entrepreneurship Education, a professional organization for entrepreneurship educators. By utilizing proven programs, innovative curriculums, and inspiring role models, The Center for Entrepreneurship shows youth that being one's own boss can be a satisfying and rewarding path to success and community well-being.

Key Organizations Supporting Entrepreneurship

Global Entrepreneurship Week is an initiative that seeks to inspire people around the world to explore their potential as self-starters and innovators. The event encourages networking and collaboration among entrepreneurs and aspiring entrepreneurs. The Association of Entrepreneurship Education aims to enhance the quality of entrepreneurship education worldwide. By providing a platform for sharing best practices and fostering innovation in teaching methodologies, it supports educators in preparing future business leaders. These organizations play a critical role in empowering the next generation of entrepreneurs through education, mentorship, and community engagement.

content_item.parsed_text: Youth Enterpreneurship Initiatives Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city to receive our e-Bulletin (3 times a year) Last Name First Name Company Title E-mail Telephone City Industry - Agriculture Construction and Real Estate Consulting Food Industry Investor Legal Media NGO Production Other Russian Government Services Technology Transport/Logistics U.S. Government University Education Role Manager Entrepreneur Top Manager Instructor Government Employee Expert Student Other Submit Русский Join us on Facebook Subscribe For announcements of upcoming events and/or our e-Bulletin ﻿ About Programs for Entrepreneurs Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives Russian Association of Entrepreneurship Education Global Entrepreneurship Week G20 Young Entrepreneurs’ Alliance Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom Matching Funding Resource Center For Donors Partners Contacts G20 Young Entrepreneurs’ Alliance The G20 Young Entrepreneurs’ Alliance is a collective of leading entrepreneurially-minded organizations representing the G20 countries who seek to promote youth entrepreneurship as a powerful driver of economic renewal, job creation, innovation and social change. The Alliance was founded as a movement to engage the G20 leaders in the cause of youth entrepreneurship, share information across borders, affect positive policy change and create a global network of young entrepreneur advocates while building a collaborative entrepreneurial environment worldwide. Find out more at www.g20yea.com Toronto Communique Seoul Incheon Charter G20 Young Entrepreneur Summit G20 Young Entrepreneur Summit (G20 YES) is an international summit with over 400 entrepreneurs from 18 to 45 years old attending the event from each G20 member country. Delegates work during the summit to finalize recommendations on promoting youth entrepreneurship which are forwarded to the G20 Heads of State during their summit. For more information, please reference the following site: www.g20yes.com Toronto Press-Release Toronto Post-Release Nice Press-Release G20YES Nice Official Program McKinsey Report See attached link for a G20 YES McKinsey report "Power of the Many: Realizing the socioeconomic potential of entrepreneurs for the 21st century”, a comparative analysis of entrepreneurship in the G20 countries. CFE, as a founding member of the G20 Young Entrepreneurs’ Alliance (G20 YEA) assisted in data collection for this report that will be presented at the G20 YEA’s Young Entrepreneur Summit in Nice, France, in November 2011. page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
G20 Young Entrepreneur Summit Insights

June 18, 2012

Insights from the G20 Young Entrepreneur Summit 2012

The G20 Young Entrepreneur Summit (G20 YES) is an international summit that brings together over 400 entrepreneurs aged 18 to 45 from each G20 member country. Delegates work collaboratively during the summit to finalize recommendations on promoting youth entrepreneurship, which are then forwarded to the G20 Heads of State during their summit. The G20 YES in Nice, France, attracted diverse participants who shared their insights and expertise in fostering innovative entrepreneurial ecosystems. For more information, visit the G20 YES official program and the McKinsey Report titled 'Power of the Many: Realizing the socioeconomic potential of entrepreneurs for the 21st century,' which offers a comparative analysis of entrepreneurship in the G20 countries. Additionally, check out the Ernst & Young Report, also known as 'The Nice 2011 Entrepreneurship Barometer,' for a comprehensive analysis of the entrepreneurial ecosystem across all G20 countries.

Key Insights from Global Organizations

G20 Young Entrepreneurs Alliance is a coalition of leading entrepreneurially-minded organizations representing the G20 countries. The alliance focuses on promoting youth entrepreneurship as a potent driver of economic renewal, job creation, innovation, and social change. It was established to engage G20 leaders in supporting youth entrepreneurship, sharing information across borders, implementing positive policy changes, and creating a global network of young entrepreneur advocates. Another key organization, Ernst & Young, plays a pivotal role in analyzing the entrepreneurial ecosystems within G20 countries. Their 2011 report, 'The Nice 2011 Entrepreneurship Barometer,' offers both quantitative and qualitative insights that are crucial for understanding the entire entrepreneurial landscape. For more extensive details, refer to the official G20 YES program and associated reports.

Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives

June 18, 2012

Join Our Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives and Reap the Benefits

Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city and receive our e-Bulletin three times a year. The Center for Entrepreneurship invites you to participate in our programs designed for entrepreneurs. Membership benefits include global networking and collaboration opportunities, access to best practices in teaching methodology, cases, curriculum, participation in international conferences and training programs, research grants, international faculty exchange and career opportunities, publications, recognition and award programs, personal and professional development, and access to members-only areas with materials to support entrepreneurship educators.

About Key Organizations

Global Entrepreneurship Network (GEN) aims to provide everyone with the opportunity to start and scale a business. Through a platform of programs in 170 countries, GEN leverages data, networks, and initiatives to fuel healthier entrepreneurship ecosystems around the world. Global Entrepreneurship Week is one of the signature programs hosted by GEN, galvanizing more than 10 million people each November through a series of events and activities. These initiatives help educate aspiring entrepreneurs, celebrate success, and foster connections between innovators and startup communities. Similarly, the G20 Young Entrepreneurs Alliance is a collective of organizations across G20 countries dedicated to developing entrepreneurship among young people. This network amplifies the voice of young entrepreneurs and implements critical policies supporting their growth and development.

Global Entrepreneurship Week by The Center for Entrepreneurship

November 15, 2010

Join the Global Movement to Celebrate Entrepreneurship

The Center for Entrepreneurship is thrilled to co-host the Global Entrepreneurship Week in partnership with Junior Achievement. Each November, millions of young people from 100 countries participate in tens of thousands of events aimed at joining a growing movement of entrepreneurial people to generate new ideas and to seek better ways of doing things. This week-long event connects young people everywhere through local, national, and global activities to explore their potential as self-starters and innovators. Students, educators, entrepreneurs, business leaders, employees, non-profit leaders, government officials, and many others participate in a range of activities both online and face-to-face to harness the energy of social networking, connect people taking action in their local and global communities, and celebrate entrepreneurship across the globe.

Key Organizations Supporting Entrepreneurship

Kauffman Foundation is a U.S.-based organization that innovates in entrepreneurship and education. They are known for their comprehensive research and ability to support startup funding and educational programs. Enterprise U.K. is another pivotal player, which works towards promoting entrepreneurial culture in the U.K. through various initiatives like Global Entrepreneurship Week. The goal of these organizations is to empower young entrepreneurs by providing them with the tools and resources they need to succeed. Their contributions to initiatives like Global Entrepreneurship Week result in a powerful, collaborative effort to foster innovation and economic growth worldwide.

Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom

June 18, 2012

Training Educators to Cultivate Future Entrepreneurs

Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom (DEC) program provides university faculty with a comprehensive introduction to effective techniques in the teaching of entrepreneurship, including syllabus development, course content, experiential learning techniques, and teaching approaches. DEC enhances the ability of educators to provide critical training to potential entrepreneurs, who can then go on to develop companies that create sustainable jobs. Program instructors include: Dr. Ray Smilor, Schumacher Fellow at the Neeley School of Business at Texas Christian University; Dr. Michael Morris, Mitchell Chair in Entrepreneurship at Oklahoma State University; and Dr. Minet Schindehutte, Associate Professor of Entrepreneurship in the Whitman School of Management at Syracuse University. Over 110 professors and instructors have participated in this program since 2006.

About the Organizations Involved

The Global Entrepreneurship Week is an annual event hosted by the Center for Entrepreneurship that introduces potential entrepreneurs to new strategies and ideas, igniting their innovative spirit. The Young Entrepreneurs Alliance focuses on connecting young business minds worldwide, promoting collaboration and networking to foster entrepreneurial growth. Another key association is the Center for Entrepreneurship, which drives initiatives like the DEC program to support educators and potential entrepreneurs, ensuring long-term sustainability and economic impact.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Learning Programs The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship offers customized worldwide "best practice" programs that improve an entrepreneur's functional business knowledge and develop skills important for company success in areas such as entrepreneurial marketing, negotiating/conflict resolution, and decision-making.  In addition, our programs help entrepreneurs overcome environmental challenges that hinder company growth, such as protecting intellectual property, utilizing the legal system, and approaching capital providers. CFE utilizes a robust delivery methodology, including:  focused courses; workshops; peer learning events; networking opportunities; entrepreneur exchanges; and business plan competitions.  These programs foster not only entrepreneur-to-entrepreneur, but also mentor-to-entrepreneur, entrepreneur-to-investor, and entrepreneur-to-policymaker learning.  By bringing together all of the players that influence entrepreneurial success, CFE offers unique, integrated and experiential learning programs. Testimonials These seminars attract me because only entrepreneurs participate, and not employees, as in other events of this type.  It is also very important that both the facilitators and the participants have professional business experience. Sergey Vykhodtsev, Bistroff Our company is founded on the entrepreneurial spirit, and on the efforts of its employees. So, seminars specifically targeted and oriented to entrepreneurs, and taught by entrepreneurs are extremely interesting. Alexander Mikhailov, DeltaLeasing Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

The Center for Entrepreneurship Learning Programs

June 23, 2003

Comprehensive Learning and Support for Entrepreneurs

The Center for Entrepreneurship offers customized worldwide 'best practice' programs that improve an entrepreneur's functional business knowledge and develop skills important for company success in areas such as entrepreneurial marketing, negotiating/conflict resolution, and decision-making. In addition, our programs help entrepreneurs overcome environmental challenges that hinder company growth, such as protecting intellectual property, utilizing the legal system, and approaching capital providers. The Center utilizes a robust delivery methodology, including: focused courses; workshops; peer learning events; networking opportunities; entrepreneur exchanges; and business plan competitions. These programs foster not only entrepreneur-to-entrepreneur, but also mentor-to-entrepreneur, entrepreneur-to-investor, and entrepreneur-to-policymaker learning. By bringing together all of the players that influence entrepreneurial success, The Center offers unique, integrated and experiential learning programs.

It is also very important that both the facilitators and the participants have professional business experience.' So, seminars specifically targeted and oriented to entrepreneurs, and taught by entrepreneurs are extremely interesting.' Alexander Mikhailov, DeltaLeasing.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Making Winning Presentations To Investors: How to Raise Money To Build Your Company A 4-Hour Workshop for Entrepreneurs Seeking Investment Entrepreneurs may have the best product, the most innovative technology, the largest market or the most detailed business plan, but they may still not be able to secure the capital they need to grow their businesses.  To raise money, entrepreneurs must be able to present their companies and their capabilities in a compelling and effective manner to investors.  This workshop gives entrepreneurs the tools they need to make that winning presentation. The workshop focuses on: Identifying the key factors that entrepreneurs must communicate to investors; What entrepreneurs must never say; What investors look for in making an investment decision; How to present the opportunity; How entrepreneurs should establish their credibility with investors; How entrepreneurs can enhance their image and stature in the minds of investors; Preparing for the presentation; Dealing with stage fright; and Structuring a clear and persuasive message for potential investors. At the end of the training session, a senior Investment Manager from Delta Capital Management, the leading private equity investor in Russia, will speak on what investors look for in potential investment target companies, and answer participants questions. Facilitators Dmitry Vechkanov and George Gorshkov are successful entrepreneurs and Partners at CMG strategy, a marketing consultancy founded in 1994 that works with major international clients, including American Express, PricewaterhouseCoopers, AIG and DeltaCredit, as well as entrepreneur-owned businesses.  Both have conducted seminars and master classes on marketing and business education for The British Council, the American Chamber of Commerce in Russia (AmCham), and the Academy of National Economy (ANE).  They also served as judges for AmChams MBA competition and ANEs business plan competition.  They were both awarded honors degrees from the Academy of National Economy.  As recipients of the Queens Award and the Chevening Awards, they earned their MBAs from the Imperial College Management School in London, which boasts the top-ranked school of entrepreneurship in Europe.  They were both nominated for the Ernst & Young "Entrepreneur of the Year" award in 2003. Time: Seminar from 14:00  18:00 What Past Seminar Participants Say: "My new business partners and I formed a very aggressive business plan for year 2003.  It was a tough decision, because it was a first time for us to launch a really venture business in the high-tech industry, which required an involvement of an outside investor.  We compiled the presentation with some basic ideas.  We spoke about the opportunity , supported by third-party evidence and information.  We spoke about credibility , based on success stories and experience.  We proved our passion for what we do.  And, we calculated precisely the amount of investment funds needed.  The following week, we signed the investment agreement.  Please find our compliments and appreciation for your impact to this success.  It is the best practical implementation of a training session I could ever think of." Mikhail Kupriyanov, Syscom Official Information Date: Wednesday, November 5, 2003 Time: 2:00 pm Registration dead-line: Wednesday, November 5, 2003 Location: The President Hotel 24, Bolshaya Yakimanka St. Seminar in the Blue Room (2nd Floor) Language: Russian Fee: $125 (includes course materials, and coffee break) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Making Winning Presentations To Investors: How to Raise Money To Build Your Company

November 5, 2003

How to Present to Investors and Raise Funds Effectively

Entrepreneurs may have the best product, the most innovative technology, the largest market or the most detailed business plan, but they may still not be able to secure the capital they need to grow their businesses. To raise money, entrepreneurs must be able to present their companies and their capabilities in a compelling and effective manner to investors. This workshop gives entrepreneurs the tools they need to make that winning presentation. The workshop focuses on: Identifying the key factors that entrepreneurs must communicate to investors; What entrepreneurs must never say; What investors look for in making an investment decision; How to present the opportunity; How entrepreneurs should establish their credibility with investors; How entrepreneurs can enhance their image and stature in the minds of investors; Preparing for the presentation; Dealing with stage fright; and Structuring a clear and persuasive message for potential investors. At the end of the training session, a senior Investment Manager from Delta Capital Management, the leading private equity investor, will speak on what investors look for in potential investment target companies, and answer participants’ questions. Facilitators Dmitry Vechkanov and George Gorshkov are successful entrepreneurs and Partners at CMG Strategy, a marketing consultancy founded in 1994 that works with major international clients, including American Express, PricewaterhouseCoopers, AIG and DeltaCredit, as well as entrepreneur-owned businesses.

Additional Information About Key Organizations

CMG Strategy is a well-regarded marketing consultancy established in 1994. They are known for working with top international clients such as American Express, PricewaterhouseCoopers, AIG, and DeltaCredit, as well as various entrepreneur-owned businesses. The consultancy specializes in helping companies with their marketing strategies, business development, and overall corporate strategy to achieve sustainable growth. Facilitators like Dmitry Vechkanov and George Gorshkov bring a wealth of experience and accolades, including the Queens Award and Chevening Awards. Delta Capital Management is a premier private equity firm known for investing in promising businesses and helping them scale. Their insights and criteria for investment are highly respected in the entrepreneurial community.

Making Winning Presentations To Investors: How to Raise Money To Build Your Company

November 5, 2003

How to Present to Investors and Raise Funds Effectively

Entrepreneurs may have the best product, the most innovative technology, the largest market or the most detailed business plan, but they may still not be able to secure the capital they need to grow their businesses. To raise money, entrepreneurs must be able to present their companies and their capabilities in a compelling and effective manner to investors. This workshop gives entrepreneurs the tools they need to make that winning presentation. The workshop focuses on: Identifying the key factors that entrepreneurs must communicate to investors; What entrepreneurs must never say; What investors look for in making an investment decision; How to present the opportunity; How entrepreneurs should establish their credibility with investors; How entrepreneurs can enhance their image and stature in the minds of investors; Preparing for the presentation; Dealing with stage fright; and Structuring a clear and persuasive message for potential investors. At the end of the training session, a senior Investment Manager from Delta Capital Management, the leading private equity investor, will speak on what investors look for in potential investment target companies, and answer participants’ questions. Facilitators Dmitry Vechkanov and George Gorshkov are successful entrepreneurs and Partners at CMG Strategy, a marketing consultancy founded in 1994 that works with major international clients, including American Express, PricewaterhouseCoopers, AIG and DeltaCredit, as well as entrepreneur-owned businesses.

Additional Information About Key Organizations

CMG Strategy is a well-regarded marketing consultancy established in 1994. They are known for working with top international clients such as American Express, PricewaterhouseCoopers, AIG, and DeltaCredit, as well as various entrepreneur-owned businesses. The consultancy specializes in helping companies with their marketing strategies, business development, and overall corporate strategy to achieve sustainable growth. Facilitators like Dmitry Vechkanov and George Gorshkov bring a wealth of experience and accolades, including the Queens Award and Chevening Awards. Delta Capital Management is a premier private equity firm known for investing in promising businesses and helping them scale. Their insights and criteria for investment are highly respected in the entrepreneurial community.

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange The Russia - U.S. Entrepreneurship Forum:  Economic Revitalization Through Entrepreneurship Russia-U.S. Entrepreneurial Forum Event Date:  September 24, 2003 - A healthy climate for entrepreneurship is essential in building a strong economy, creating jobs, opening markets, and raising the standard of living.  The Russian Ministry of Industry, Science and Technology and the United States Department of Commerce, co-organizers of the Russia  US Entrepreneurship Forum, are pleased to invite you to participate in this important event to accelerate economic growth in Russia through entrepreneurship. This unique, all-day Forum will bring together US and Russian entrepreneurs, investors, government officials and scholars to address key issues and develop practical strategies to expand entrepreneurship in Russia, and build better and stronger business ties between Russia and the United States.  The Forum will have four panels, each consisting of two Russian and two American experts discussing: - The use of investment capital as a tool for growth; - The impact of regulatory and infrastructure issues on business start-up and growth; - The role of innovation and technology in economic development, and - The importance of training and education in promoting entrepreneurship. Following the Forum, policy recommendations will be formulated with action plans to further develop entrepreneurship. Speakers include: Secretary Evans & Minister Klebanov Ilya Klebanov , Russian Minister of Industry, Science and Technology of the Russian Federation Donald Evans , United States Secretary of Commerce Andrey Fursenko , Deputy Minister of Industry, Science and Technology of the Russian Federation Grant Aldonas , United States Under Secretary of Commerce for International Trade Mikhail Gamzin , General Director, Russian Technologies venture fund (Alpha Group) Patricia Cloherty , Chairman & CEO, the US Russia Investment Fund / Delta Capital Management Sergey Borisov , President, OPORA Steve Chase , President, Intel Russia Kirill Dmitriev , Senior Vice President, Delta Capital Management Ray Smilor, President, Foundation for Enterprise Development Robert Agee , General Manager, Russia & CIS, CISCO Anatoly Karachinsky , President & CEO, IBS Group Oganes Oganya , Chairman of the Committee on Economic Policy, Entrepreneurship and Property, Federation Council of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation Nancy Carter , Richard M. Economic Revitalization Through Entrepreneurship

September 24, 2003

Exploring Strategies to Boost Economic Growth and Entrepreneurship

A healthy climate for entrepreneurship is essential in building a strong economy, creating jobs, opening markets, and raising the standard of living. The United States Department of Commerce, co-organizers of the Entrepreneurship Forum, invite you to participate in this important event. This unique, all-day forum will bring together entrepreneurs, investors, government officials, and scholars to address key issues and develop practical strategies to expand entrepreneurship and build better, stronger business ties. The forum will have four panels, each consisting of experts discussing: the use of investment capital as a tool for growth; the impact of regulatory and infrastructure issues on business start-ups and growth; the role of innovation and technology in economic development; and the importance of training and education in promoting entrepreneurship. Following the forum, policy recommendations will be formulated with action plans to further develop entrepreneurship. Notable speakers include: Secretary Evans, Andrey Fursenko, Grant Aldonas, Patricia Cloherty, Steve Chase, Ray Smilor, Robert Agee, Nancy Carter, and Bob Sullivan.

Key Organizations Involved

The United States Department of Commerce is a cabinet department of the United States government concerned with promoting economic growth. It works to create the conditions for economic growth and opportunity by promoting innovation, entrepreneurship, competitiveness, and economic development. The department also helps to improve the standard of living for all Americans through initiatives that support business efficiency and economic vitality. The Foundation for Enterprise Development promotes the adoption of employee ownership and business sustainability practices. Its goal is to empower entrepreneurs and support long-term business sustainability through comprehensive approaches to job creation and wealth dispersion. They partner with educational institutions, policymakers, and industry leaders to provide valuable resources and foster robust entrepreneurial ecosystems.

Confirmed Speakers: Oleg Tinkov Entrepreneur  Oleg Tinkov, Chairman of the Board, Tinkoff Ltd.  Mr. Tinkov will discuss how his company achieved branding success, how the brand has increased his companys value, mistakes made, and growth strategies. page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Branding – More Than Just a Fancy Name!

November 28, 2003

Insights on Branding Success and Challenges

The Center for Entrepreneurship recently hosted a highly informative event focusing on the importance and challenges of branding under the theme Branding – More Than Just a Fancy Name! Key speakers included industry leaders who shared their unique insights and experiences. Notable speaker Oleg Tinkov, Chairman of the Board at Tinkoff Ltd, discussed how his company achieved branding success, the value it added, and shared growth strategies. Tatyana Lifantyeva, President of LBL Media Advertising Agency, elaborated on brand creation, market research, and the intricate process of introducing and repositioning a brand. From an investor's perspective, Paul Price and Natalie Polischuk of Delta Capital Management delved into the financial implications of branding, highlighting costs and profitability trade-offs.

Key Organizations Making an Impact

Tinkoff Ltd, known as one of the leading banks and online financial ecosystems, has garnered substantial success due to its innovative branding efforts. Led by Oleg Tinkov, the company has revolutionized the way financial services are marketed and consumed, demonstrating the power of effective branding. LBL Media Advertising Agency, managed by Tatyana Lifantyeva, serves a diverse range of high-profile clients including Bistroff, Danone, and Ahmad Tea. Their expertise in market research and brand tactics has solidified their reputation as a premier advertising agency. Delta Capital Management, with key figures Paul Price and Natalie Polischuk, plays a crucial role in the investment sector by educating entrepreneurs on the financial significance of branding. Their insights into the costs and benefits of branding contribute significantly to business growth and investor confidence.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Cash Flow Management for Growth January 28, 2004 - Moscow, Russia January 30, 2004 - St. Petersburg, Russia As an entrepreneur you took an idea and turned it into reality.  While most businesses never make it past the start-up stage, you beat the odds.  However, after initial success, you now find that a lack of cash is inhibiting your companys growth: affecting strategic planning, product development, and sales.  For your company to grow, cash needs to be available to help managers develop and implement strategy, to fund new products, and to finance sales and marketing campaigns.  With a proper understanding of cash flow management, you can help ensure that your employees have the resources they need to grow your company. Cash Flow Management for Growth teaches entrepreneurs how to solve the cash flow problems faced by growing businesses. The seminar begins with the difference between profit and cash , followed by interactive discussion and problem-solving sessions on the sources and uses of cash in a growth business , the use of the right financial ratios to measure and monitor cash flow, and the relationship between growth and cash flow .  Working with other entrepreneurs you will analyze a case study about a company in a cash flow crisis and develop operational strategies and tactics to help the company survive.  This workshop focuses on you, the entrepreneur, and your understanding of the impact of cash flow on your companys growth. Course Developer & Facilitator Bill McIntyre is the Program Coordinator for the Ohio Employee Ownership Center.  Previously, he was on the Board of Directors and spent 15 years as Chief Financial Officer of ComSonics, Inc., a fast growing high technology company.  He is a frequent speaker at conferences and has taught Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting and Accounting Systems at James Madison University in Harrisonburg, Virginia.  He is a CPA and worked as a consultant at Arthur Andersen.  McIntyre earned his MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business. Official Information Date: Wednesday, January 28, 2004 Time: 9:00 am Registration dead-line: Wednesday, January 28, 2004 Location: January 28, 2004: Marriott Tverskaya Kaminny Zal, 8th Floor January 30, 2004: Radisson SAS Royal Hotel, St. Petersburg Glinka Hal Language: English with simultaneous Russian translation Fee: $150 - Moscow, $125 - St. Petersburg (includes course materials and coffee break) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Cash Flow Management for Growth

January 30, 2004

Ensure Resources for Company Growth with Cash Flow Management

As an entrepreneur you took an idea and turned it into reality. While most businesses never make it past the start-up stage, you beat the odds. However, after initial success, you now find that a lack of cash is inhibiting your company’s growth: affecting strategic planning, product development, and sales. For your company to grow, cash needs to be available to help managers develop and implement strategy, to fund new products, and to finance sales and marketing campaigns. With a proper understanding of cash flow management, you can help ensure that your employees have the resources they need to grow your company. Cash Flow Management for Growth teaches entrepreneurs how to solve the cash flow problems faced by growing businesses. The seminar begins with the difference between profit and cash, followed by interactive discussion and problem-solving sessions on the sources and uses of cash in a growth business, the use of the right financial ratios to measure and monitor cash flow, and the relationship between growth and cash flow. Working with other entrepreneurs you will analyze a case study about a company in a cash flow crisis and develop operational strategies and tactics to help the company survive. This workshop focuses on you, the entrepreneur, and your understanding of the impact of cash flow on your company’s growth. Course Developer & Facilitator Bill McIntyre is the Program Coordinator for the Ohio Employee Ownership Center. Previously, he was on the Board of Directors and spent 15 years as Chief Financial Officer of ComSonics, Inc., a fast-growing high technology company. He is a frequent speaker at conferences and has taught Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, and Accounting Systems at James Madison University in Harrisonburg, Virginia. He is a CPA and worked as a consultant at Arthur Andersen. McIntyre earned his MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business.

About Key Organizations

The Ohio Employee Ownership Center is dedicated to promoting sustainable employee ownership through education, research, and outreach. Formed in 1987, it provides resources and support for businesses that are considering or have chosen employee ownership models. James Madison University, established in 1908 in Harrisonburg, Virginia, is a public research university known for its strong emphasis on undergraduate teaching, innovative learning opportunities, and community engagement. Arthur Andersen, once one of the largest accounting firms in the world, was headquartered in Chicago. Despite its controversial end following the Enron scandal, the firm was renowned for its rigorous standard in audit and consulting services. The Stanford Graduate School of Business, part of Stanford University, is recognized globally for its MBA program, which focuses on leadership, innovation, and analytical thinking, providing students with the skills necessary to make impactful changes in the business world.

page_cooked.page_description: Learn how to manage cash flow for business growth with expert-led seminars focused on solving challenges faced by growing companies.
page_cooked.page_keywords: Cash Flow Management, business growth, entrepreneurship, seminars, financial strategy

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Moscow Entrepreneurship Group - Selling Your Company (March 12, 2004) The Moscow Entrepreneurship Group is an ongoing networking and panel event that brings together AmCham members in the investment and service sectors with Russian entrepreneurs of growing companies to discuss topics that educate and are vital to creating a healthy entrepreneurial climate in Russia. Marchs Topic: Selling Your Company Confirmed Speakers: Entrepreneur  Sergey Vykhodstev, Founder, Bistroff .  Sergey will discuss how he raised money to start Bistroff in 1998 and how he turned it into a fast growing company and one of the most recognized brand names in Russia.  He will also relate his experience as a serial entrepreneur who has built successful companies ( Invite instant drinks & Bistroff ), sold them, and started the process over again. Service Sector  Vitaly Yablokov, Senior Associate, Allen & Overy Legal Services .  Vitaly will discuss different stages and aspects in the process of selling entrepreneur-owned companies, including due diligence and negotiation tactics with the purchaser.  He will also speak about common mistakes entrepreneurs make, and ways entrepreneurs can protect their interests. Entrepreneurs  and , Partners, Creative Marketing Group .  Dmitry and George, who recently sold their successful marketing consultancy to Art Unit, an advertising subsidiary of SK Group (publisher of Men's Fitness, Seventeen, PC Week and PC Magazine), will relate their experience in a live case study format.  They will describe why they decided to sell their company, the search for a potential buyer, negotiations, due diligence, and closing the deal. Selling Your Company

March 12, 2004

Insights into Selling Your Company: A Guide for Entrepreneurs

The Center for Entrepreneurship is hosting an ongoing networking and panel event that brings together members in the investment and service sectors with entrepreneurs of growing companies. The aim is to discuss topics that educate and foster a healthy entrepreneurial environment. This month’s topic is 'Selling Your Company'.Confirmed Speakers:
Entrepreneur – Sergey Vykhodstev, Founder, Bistroff. Sergey will discuss how he raised money to start Bistroff in 1998, transforming it into a fast-growing company and a recognized brand. He will also share his experience as a 'serial entrepreneur' who has built successful companies (Invite instant drinks & Bistroff), sold them, and started anew.
Service Sector – Vitaly Yablokov, Senior Associate, Allen & Overy Legal Services. Vitaly will talk about different stages in selling entrepreneur-owned companies, including due diligence and negotiation tactics. He will also highlight common mistakes and how entrepreneurs can safeguard their interests.
Entrepreneurs – Dmitry and George, Partners, Creative Marketing Group. Dmitry and George, who recently sold their marketing consultancy to Art Unit, an advertising subsidiary of SK Group (publisher of Men's Fitness, Seventeen, PC Week and PC Magazine), will provide a live case study. They will recount their rationale for selling, finding a potential buyer, negotiations, due diligence, and closing the deal.

Key Organizations Involved

The American Chamber of Commerce (AmCham) is a key organization involved in this event. AmCham supports and promotes business development globally through corporate, commercial, and investment interests. Another essential organization is Allen & Overy, a prominent legal services firm, which helps businesses with corporate law, including mergers and acquisitions, and other complex transactions. Finally, the SK Group, which has a significant presence in the publishing industry, also plays a crucial role. It operates several well-known magazines, contributing to information dissemination and entrepreneurship support.
