content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange An Entrepreneurs Guide to Strategic Planning As a leader of a growing company, you are continually focused on finding and pursuing new opportunities to maintain and accelerate momentum.  Your challenges are compounded by the rapidly changing and turbulent environment in which your firm operates.  To survive and prosper in such settings, you must learn to think strategically about the forces impacting your organization and the actions you must take in response.  Thus, strategic planning is concerned with envisioning how markets are evolving and deciding how best to procure and allocate resources which can help you to be a player in those markets. An Entrepreneurs Guide to Strategic Planning is a workshop designed to provide participants with hands-on training in methods used to support effective strategic decision making . Strategic decisions are those which define a firms future direction and shape the necessary allocation of resources to attain longer term objectives.  Participants will have the opportunity to work with and apply various strategic tools and techniques to their own organizational situations.  Particular emphasis will be placed upon tools for evaluating your firms external environment for critical opportunities and threats and internal environment for an assessment of key strengths and weaknesses.  You will use the insights generated from these tools to formulate a strategic vision for your organization and a strategic plan designed to attain that vision. This program is designed for entrepreneurs, founders and CEOs of growing organizations who: - Wish to bring new products and services into the market place through innovation and creativity. -  Are currently seeking new avenues for growth. -  Desire to move their companies to pursue new opportunities within their existing markets. The Entrepreneurs Guide to Strategic Planning workshop will encompass a series of lectures, discussions, experiential exercises and a case study all designed to enable you to introduce a culture of strategic thinking into your own organization.  From this experience, you will take away a set of tools you can use with your own people to develop a comprehensive strategic assessment of where your firm is today, where it desires to be tomorrow and action plans to get you from here to there, and the knowledge to implement those tools. Facilitator Alex F. DeNoble is a Professor of Management at . As a Director in the , he is in charge of the Entrepreneurship Academic Program, the Venture Challenge International Business Plan Competition and serves as a Board Member for the Center for the Commercialization of Advanced Technologies. His research has been published in various journals including the Journal of Business Venturing, the Journal of High Technology Management Research and Entrepreneurship: Theory and Practice. Dr. DeNoble's other professional activities encompass both executive training and strategic management. Recent clients include Banco Nacional de Commercio Exterior (the National Export Bank of ), NEC Electronics USA, and Shell Technology Ventures. Dr. DeNoble was recently recognized by Ernst and Young as an Entrepreneur of the Year recipient in the Supporter of Entrepreneurship category and by the Price-Babson Fellows Program as a recipient of the Gloria and Edwin Appel Prize for Excellence in Entrepreneurship Education. Dr. DeNoble has a B.A. in Accounting from , a Masters in Accounting and a Ph.D. in Strategic Management from Virginia Polytechnic Institute and . Official Information Date: Wednesday, March 31, 2004 Time: 9:00 am Registration dead-line: Wednesday, March 31, 2004 Location: President Hotel Blue Room, 2nd Floor Language: English and Russian (with Simultaneous Translation) Fee: $150 (inc. VAT, materials and coffee breaks) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Leading a High Performance Company A 4-Hour Leadership Workshop for Entrepreneurs As an entrepreneur you took a great business idea and started and grew your company  overseeing every step and making the most important decisions.  Now, as your business expands you face new challenges that require more and more of your time and resources.  One of the best investments you can make to ensure the success of your growing company is to invest in yourself as a leader.  By boosting your performance as a leader, you boost the performance of your company by creating a team ready to overcome obstacles and take your company to new levels of success. Leading a High Performance Company focuses on you, the entrepreneur, and your companys growth potential.  Discover how to get the most out of your company and your people at this dynamic workshop, where you will learn the four major components of being a leader of a high performance company: Setting a strong example; Learning to delegate effectively; Measuring the performance of your company and your team; and Rewarding and promoting your best people. Finally, we will also discuss how to de-motivate employees , so that you wont! The Leading a High Performance Company workshop begins with a presentation, followed by an interactive discussion and problem-solving session, and ends with the creation of a Personal Action Plan that you can use immediately.  A networking reception with your fellow entrepreneurs immediately follows the session. Seminar Author - Dr. Jana Matthews is an expert on entrepreneurial leadership, and has written or co-authored six books.  She received her doctorate from Harvard University, and is the founding President and CEO of Boulder Quantum Ventures, that works with founding entrepreneurs, CEOs, corporate executives and top teams to unlock their company's growth potential.  She also consults with Foundations, government agencies and corporations trying to help entrepreneurs commercialize technology and manage growth.  Previously, Dr. Matthews was a senior staff member at the for Entrepreneurial Leadership, where she developed highly successful programs designed to teach entrepreneurs how to manage growth. Seminar Facilitator Dr. Mikhail Klarin earned two levels of PhD from the Russian Academy of Education.  He is the author over 150 publications including books and articles on teaching/training methods, facilitation and group work, adult learning, executive and management development. The latest titles are  Technology of Education , Riga, 1999 and  Corporate Training: A to Z , Moscow, 2000, 2002 (the first and so far the only Russian title on the subject).  Since 1990, Dr. Klarin was an independent management trainer and organizational development consultant, working with executive teams and providing programs for organizational change, developing corporate culture, teambuilding. For seven years, Mikhail was Senior Consultant/Trainer, Center for Business Skills Development (Thunderbird University) working with Russian and multinational companies across CIS and Eastern Europe.  At the Russian Institute of Directors Dr. Klarin presides over the methodology of Corporate Governance Program for members of Boards of Directors and runs training sessions for Boards of Directors on strategic decision-making. He also runs training workshops in executive MBA programs in Moscow. Time: Seminar from 14:00  18:00 Official Information Date: Thursday, December 4, 2003 Time: 2:00 pm Registration dead-line: Thursday, December 4, 2003 Location: The President Hotel 24 Bolshaya Yakimanka St. Seminar in the Blue Room (2-nd Floor) Language: Russian Fee: $125 (includes course materials, and coffee break) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Implementing the Balanced Scorecard:  Maximizing Performance and Creating Sustainable Results As an entrepreneur leading a growing company, you are continually scanning the environment for new markets and opportunities.  You have made the hard strategic decisions which define your firms future direction and shape the necessary allocation of resources to attain your longer term objectives.  You have crafted what looks to be a winning strategy, and are ready to sit back and let it happen.  Right? Wrong!  For those who can execute their strategy, the rewards are significant.  However, its one thing to craft a winning strategy, but successfully implementing it is another thing entirely.  Unfortunately, the vast majority of companies fail miserably when attempting to execute their strategies.  What is needed to successfully implement strategy is a system that provides real insight into an organizations operations, balances the historical accuracy of financial numbers with the real drivers of future performance, and helps align short-term actions with strategy.  One system that does this is the Balanced Scorecard. In this seminar, Implementing the Balanced Scorecard , you will get an in-depth, hands-on examination of the powerful Balanced Scorecard system. You will be exposed to all key facets of the Balanced Scorecard model, allowing you to take full advantage of this breakthrough tool in your own organization.  Through lecture, hands-on exercises, a real-life case study, and actual Balanced Scorecard success stories, you will learn: - How the Balanced Scorecard helps solve fundamental business issues; - How it translates vision and strategy into action; - How to define key performance measurement terms and concepts; - How to determine what to measure in each of the four Scorecard perspectives; and - How to communicate strategy on a strategy map. You will take away a set of tools you can use with your own strategy to develop a comprehensive set of balanced measurements to successfully drive your future results. Facilitator Noted author, speaker and consultant Paul R. Niven. Mr. Niven is the President of Primerus Consulting, and the author of Balanced Scorecard Step-by-Step: Maximizing Performance and Maintaining Results , and Balanced Scorecard Step-by-Step for Government and Nonprofit Agencies .  A former consultant with both KPMG and Computer Sciences Corporation (CSC), his work on performance management has been published in many professional publications.  He is a frequent and popular speaker on the Balanced Scorecard methodology and implementation at seminars around the world.  He may be reached through his web site at: www.primerusconsulting.com . Official Information Date: Thursday, April 22, 2004 Time: 9:00 am Registration dead-line: Thursday, April 22, 2004 Location: President Hotel 24 Bolshaya Yakimanka St. Blue Room, 2nd Floor Language: English with simultaneous Russian translation Fee: $150 (inc. VAT, materials and coffee breaks) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

Implementing the Balanced Scorecard: Maximizing Performance and Creating Sustainable Results

April 22, 2004

Balanced Scorecard Implementation: Enhance Your Strategic Performance

As an entrepreneur leading a growing company, you are continually scanning the environment for new markets and opportunities. You have made the hard strategic decisions which define your firm’s future direction and shape the necessary allocation of resources to attain your longer-term objectives. You have crafted what looks to be a winning strategy, and are ready to sit back and let it happen. Right? Wrong! For those who can execute their strategy, the rewards are significant. However, it’s one thing to craft a winning strategy, but successfully implementing it is another thing entirely. Unfortunately, the vast majority of companies fail miserably when attempting to execute their strategies. What is needed to successfully implement strategy is a system that provides real insight into an organization’s operations, balances the historical accuracy of financial numbers with the real drivers of future performance, and helps align short-term actions with strategy. One system that does this is the Balanced Scorecard. In this seminar, Implementing the Balanced Scorecard, you will get an in-depth, hands-on examination of the powerful Balanced Scorecard system. You will be exposed to all key facets of the Balanced Scorecard model, allowing you to take full advantage of this breakthrough tool in your own organization. Through lecture, hands-on exercises, a real-life case study, and actual Balanced Scorecard success stories, you will learn: - How the Balanced Scorecard helps solve fundamental business issues; - How it “translates” vision and strategy into action; - How to define key performance measurement terms and concepts; - How to determine what to measure in each of the four Scorecard perspectives; and - How to communicate strategy on a strategy map. You will take away a set of tools you can use with your own strategy to develop a comprehensive set of balanced measurements to successfully drive your future results.

About Paul R. Niven and Primerus Consulting

Facilitator Paul R. Niven is a noted author, speaker, and consultant. Mr. Niven is the President of Primerus Consulting, and the author of Balanced Scorecard Step-by-Step: Maximizing Performance and Maintaining Results, and Balanced Scorecard Step-by-Step for Government and Nonprofit Agencies. A former consultant with both KPMG and Computer Sciences Corporation (CSC), his work on performance management has been published in many professional publications. He is a frequent and popular speaker on the Balanced Scorecard methodology and implementation at seminars around the world. Additional information is available on Paul R. Niven’s website at www.primerusconsulting.com.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Hiring and Retaining Key Staff A company with great ideas and strong plans cannot grow without the right people in place.  As a business owner, you may wonder, Why cant we hire the right people? or Why are the people we want to stay leaving?  This seminar will show you how to get outstanding people onboard, and how to ensure their goals are aligned with yours.  You will learn how to create a company where your best people want to stay and help you grow. Hiring and Retaining Key Staff was developed by entrepreneurship expert, Dr. Jana Matthews, and addresses the essential issues of finding and keeping the best people in your company. Hiring Key Staff The hiring process can get derailed in many places.  In this seminar, youll learn to solve the common challenges of hiring, by developing a hiring process that works.  You will review your own hiring process, assess its strengths and weaknesses, and identify changes that need to be made.  We will address key questions, such as: What do we need to do before we start a hiring search? How do we identify the best candidates from the ones that are not right for us? How do we get people to reveal who they really are during the interview, not who they want us to think they are? Who should be moved from potential candidates to finalists? What questions should we ask when we do reference checks? How do we negotiate a win-win employment agreement? What red flags should we be watching for during the hiring process? Retaining Key Staff Knowing how to find the right people is just the beginning. You must be able to identify your key staff and retain them (and assess who might need to leave.)  This seminar will teach many of the ways to retain key staff and enable them to be peak performers, including: Getting your new employees off to a strong start. Setting clear performance expectations and measurements. Keeping your employees focused on your companys goals and plans Getting them to execute and produce results Rewarding and motivating your best people Understanding your employees expectations of respect, trust, communication and feedback, and involvement in planning the future of the company. How to manage situations where employees do not produce the expected results or fit with your companys culture Tools to decide whether employees are worth keeping, or whether they have to go. The Hiring and Retaining Key Staff workshop features a presentation and case study followed by an interactive discussion.  The seminar provides tools you can use in your company immediately to develop better job descriptions, conduct hiring interviews, and perform reference checks.  Well review a matrix of Performance and Values, develop a performance improvement plan, and discuss ways to have that difficult discussion with an employee  when you tell them they need to leave.  The seminar concludes with the creation of a Personal Action Plan that will prioritize changes youll need to make in your company. Facilitator As the founder and CEO of Boulder Quantum Ventures, Dr. Jana Matthews has first-hand experience with the issues of growth that she writes and speaks about.  She works with CEOs and their top teams to unlock their company's growth potential.  Dr. Matthews developed and delivered to entrepreneurs in Moscow the acclaimed workshop Leading a High Performance Company for the US Russia Center for Entrepreneurship.  She is currently working with CEOs of growing companies in the USA, the government of New Zealand on an initiative to grow 100 companies to $100 million in 10 years, and the government of South Australia.  Previously, Dr. Matthews was a senior staff member at the Kauffman Center for Entrepreneurial Leadership, where she developed highly successful programs designed to teach entrepreneurs how to manage growth. Dr. Matthews received her doctorate from Harvard University.  She is a popular lecturer and the author of seven books, including Leading at the Speed of Growth , Building the Awesome Organization and Lessons from the Edge . Official Information Date: Wednesday, May 19, 2004 Time: 9:00 am Registration dead-line: Tuesday, May 18, 2004 Location: Marriott Tverskaya Hotel 34, 1st Tverskaya-Yamskaya St. Nevsky Hall (2nd Floor) Language: English with simultaneous Russian translation Fee: $150 (inc. VAT, materials and coffee breaks) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

Hiring and Retaining Key Staff Workshop

May 19, 2004

Learn How to Hire and Retain Top Talent with Dr. Jana Matthews

A company with great ideas and strong plans cannot grow without the right people in place. As a business owner, you may wonder, “Why can’t we hire the right people?” or “Why are the people we want to stay leaving?” This seminar will show you how to get outstanding people onboard, and how to ensure their goals are aligned with yours. You will learn how to create a company where your best people want to stay and help you grow. The Hiring and Retaining Key Staff workshop was developed by entrepreneurship expert, Dr. Jana Matthews, and addresses the essential issues of finding and keeping the best people in your company. The hiring process can get derailed in many places. In this seminar, you’ll learn to solve the common challenges of hiring, by developing a hiring process that works. You will review your own hiring process, assess its strengths and weaknesses, and identify changes that need to be made. Who should be moved from potential candidates to finalists? What red flags should we be watching for during the hiring process? Knowing how to find the right people is just the beginning. You must be able to identify your key staff and retain them (and assess who might need to leave.) This seminar will teach many of the ways to retain key staff and enable them to be peak performers. The seminar provides tools you can use in your company immediately to develop better job descriptions, conduct hiring interviews, and perform reference checks. We’ll review a matrix of Performance and Values, develop a performance improvement plan, and discuss ways to have that difficult discussion with an employee – when you tell them they need to leave. The seminar concludes with the creation of a Personal Action Plan that will prioritize changes you’ll need to make in your company.

Key Organizations

Boulder Quantum Ventures is led by Dr. Jana Matthews, who has extensive experience with the challenges of business growth. She works directly with CEOs and their top teams to unlock growth potential within their companies. Previously, Dr. Jana Matthews developed and delivered workshops such as Leading a High Performance Company for The Center for Entrepreneurship. She has worked on growth initiatives with various governments, including New Zealand and South Australia, aiming to facilitate the growth of businesses to significant scales. Dr. Matthews, an alumna of Harvard University, is an accomplished author and popular lecturer known for her expertise in entrepreneurial leadership and organizational growth strategies.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Entrepreneurial Marketing: Why the Entrepreneur Must Know the Marketing Function To build successful companies, entrepreneurs must learn how to do much more with marketing while spending much less.  By focusing on the unique marketing challenges and opportunities in fast-growth, entrepreneurial firms, this workshop shows entrepreneurs how to utilize innovative, powerful and cost-effective marketing techniques to win customers and capture markets. Great marketing begins with a fundamental understanding of your market.  Consequently, this workshop addresses what entrepreneurs need to know about their customers and provides practical tools for helping entrepreneurs gain and keep customers!  By revealing key trends in the emerging marketplace and explaining what they mean, the program helps entrepreneurs develop and implement successful marketing strategies and tactics. The workshop introduces entrepreneurs to a simple but powerful framework for organizing their marketing activities in a customer-centered manner.  It provides entrepreneurs with a practical and effective way to deal with the full-range of marketing decision variables to significantly enhance the value creating capabilities in their firms.  In addition, the workshop presents methods and techniques for discovering new sources of customer value in areas that entrepreneurs often overlook. The workshop shows entrepreneurs how to utilize guerrilla marketing approaches to achieve high impact marketing results without spending large amounts of money.  Entrepreneurs can thus enhance their abilities to leverage resources, stretch resources, discover under-utilized resources and create their own resources.  In addition, by providing examples of a variety of guerrilla methods, the workshop will show entrepreneurs ways in which marketing can be used creatively to mitigate and manage the risks facing their firms. Too many entrepreneurs take a reactive and tactical approach to marketing.  This workshop shows entrepreneurs how to be more proactive and strategic and thus far more effective  in developing and implementing their firms entire marketing program.  In the process, entrepreneurs come to better understand the need for a close relationship between their customers buying process and their firms selling process. In addition to relevant examples and case studies, the program utilizes questionnaires and worksheets so that each entrepreneur walks away with a customized marketing plan that he or she can use to build their companies.  Through this program, entrepreneurs will learn how the right entrepreneurial marketing approach can lead to more profitable enterprises. Facilitators Dmitry Vechkanov and George Gorshkov are successful entrepreneurs and Partners at CMG strategy, a marketing consultancy founded in 1994 that works with major international clients, including American Express, PricewaterhouseCoopers, AIG and DeltaCredit, as well as entrepreneur-owned businesses.  Both have conducted seminars and master classes on marketing and business education for The British Council, the American Chamber of Commerce in Russia (AmCham), and the Academy of National Economy (ANE).  They also served as judges for AmChams MBA competition and ANEs business plan competition.  They were both awarded honors degrees from the Academy of National Economy.  As recipients of the Queens Award and the Chevening Awards, they earned their MBAs from the Imperial College Management School in London, which boasts the top-ranked school of entrepreneurship in Europe.  They were both nominated for the Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year award in 2003. Time: Seminar from 9:00  13:00 What Past Seminar Participants Say: "Its no doubt that I will use the recommended pricing strategy.  Up to now, prices for our companys products (instant oatmeal and kasha) have been pretty much in one price range.  However, we are starting to manufacture products oriented to people whose income is higher than middle-class, and who are health conscious (for example, different fitness-porridges), and therefore we are planning to apply different pricing methodologies for these products. Sergey Vykhodtsev, Bistroff Official Information Date: Wednesday, November 5, 2003 Time: 9:00 am Registration dead-line: Thursday, March 13, 2003 Location: The President Hotel 24, Bolshaya Yakimanka St. Seminar in the Blue Room (2nd Floor) Language: Russian Fee: $125 (includes course materials, and coffee break) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Entrepreneurial Marketing: Why the Entrepreneur Must Know the Marketing Function

November 5, 2003

Enhance Your Marketing Skills with the Right Entrepreneurial Approach

To build successful companies, entrepreneurs must learn how to do much more with marketing while spending much less. By focusing on the unique marketing challenges and opportunities in fast-growth, entrepreneurial firms, this workshop shows entrepreneurs how to utilize innovative, powerful and cost-effective marketing techniques to win customers and capture markets. Great marketing begins with a fundamental understanding of your market. Consequently, this workshop addresses what entrepreneurs need to know about their customers and provides practical tools for helping entrepreneurs gain and keep customers! By revealing key trends in the emerging marketplace and explaining what they mean, the program helps entrepreneurs develop and implement successful marketing strategies and tactics. The workshop introduces entrepreneurs to a simple but powerful framework for organizing their marketing activities in a customer-centered manner. It provides entrepreneurs with a practical and effective way to deal with the full-range of marketing decision variables to significantly enhance the value creating capabilities in their firms. In addition, the workshop presents methods and techniques for discovering new sources of customer value in areas that entrepreneurs often overlook. The workshop shows entrepreneurs how to utilize guerrilla marketing approaches to achieve high impact marketing results without spending large amounts of money. Entrepreneurs can thus enhance their abilities to leverage resources, stretch resources, discover under-utilized resources and create their own resources. In addition, by providing examples of a variety of guerrilla methods, the workshop will show entrepreneurs ways in which marketing can be used creatively to mitigate and manage the risks facing their firms. Too many entrepreneurs take a reactive and tactical approach to marketing. This workshop shows entrepreneurs how to be more proactive and strategic – and thus far more effective – in developing and implementing their firms entire marketing program. In the process, entrepreneurs come to better understand the need for a close relationship between their customers buying process and their firms selling process. In addition to relevant examples and case studies, the program utilizes questionnaires and worksheets so that each entrepreneur walks away with a customized marketing plan that he or she can use to build their companies. Through this program, entrepreneurs will learn how the right entrepreneurial marketing approach can lead to more profitable enterprises.

Key Organizations Supporting Entrepreneurs

The facilitators, Dmitry Vechkanov and George Gorshkov, partners at CMG Strategy since 1994, have successfully guided both multinational corporations and entrepreneur-owned businesses in effective marketing strategies. Their consultancy firm has collaborated with respected international clients including American Express, PricewaterhouseCoopers, AIG, and DeltaCredit. Both Vechkanov and Gorshkov have earned reputable academic accolades such as honors degrees from the Academy of National Economy, the Queens Award, and the Chevening Awards. They achieved their MBAs from the Imperial College Management School in London, known for its top-ranked School of Entrepreneurship. Recognized for their contributions to entrepreneurship, both were nominated for the Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year award in 2003. Their extensive experience in providing marketing and business education through seminars and master classes, and their roles as judges in prestigious business competitions, further underline their expertise in the field. Participate in this workshop to leverage their knowledge and enhance your entrepreneurial marketing approach.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange The Real Power of Numbers:  How Entrepreneurs Can Use Financial Statements to Grow Their Businesses Investors and bankers place high value on accurate financial statements and realistic, defensible forecasts.  Entrepreneurs who really understand what is behind the numbers of their companies are more credible business leaders and thus are far more likely to get the funding they need to build their firms.  Consequently, it is critical for entrepreneurs to understand and speak intelligently about their financial statements and the key performance metrics and ratios that are essential to their businesses, as well as about the set of key assumptions that form the basis for their financial projections. Entrepreneurs usually have a good feel for their businesses.  They know their products and markets, and they can manage people.  Too often, however, entrepreneurs view financials as necessary but tedious and uninteresting aspects of their businesses that someone else, like an accountant, ought to deal with.  But research shows that the most successful entrepreneurs demonstrate real financial know-how about the critical numbers in their companies.  They recognize that financial statements are valuable sources of information, powerful planning mechanisms and essential tools for managing and growing their businesses faster and more profitably. This program gives entrepreneurs the tools to: Use financial statements in running and expanding their businesses; Read, understand and use critical financial information; Use financial statements to model their businesses; Detect business problems early, before they become critical; Improve their forecasting abilities; Create flash reports based on key financial balances, ratios and other metrics to help manage their businesses better; and Present financial information to bankers and investors more effectively. In addition to relevant examples and case studies, the program utilizes questionnaires and worksheets so that each entrepreneur walks away with a customized set of financial tools that he or she can use to help build their companies.  Through this practical and revealing program, entrepreneurs will learn how their financial statements can be powerful, compelling, interesting and insightful tools to build their companies. Author of the Seminar - Allan Edwin, Ph.D., is President of Edwin & Associates, which specializes in strategic and business planning; joint venture and strategic partnership negotiation; conflict resolution; capital formation; and operational consulting.  As an entrepreneur, Mr. Edwin started and was CEO for 10 years of Interactive Systems, Inc., a computer and communications company that he managed through three rounds of venture funding, and its acquisition by 3M.  Mr. Edwin is a Fellow of the Foundation for Enterprise Development, which has extensive experience in designing and delivering entrepreneurship programs in Russia and worldwide. Seminar Facilitator Mikhail Stepanov graduated from the Moscow State Institute of International Relations.  From 1994 to 2001 he worked in the banking/financial sector. He started his career at the International Finance Corporation (IFC). For three years he was the head of financial services and accounting at the commercial bank Bank Societe Generale Vostok (an affiliated bank of the French Banking Group Societe Generale). He was financial director at the investment bank Dresdner Kleinwort Benson (Dresdner Bank group). He was the head of the financial department at the Russian banking holding Investment Banking Corporation.  Since 2001, Mikhail has been an independent consultant on structuring financial control systems.  He is both an owner and a director of an educational-consulting center. Time: Seminar is from 9:00  13:00 Official Information Date: Thursday, December 4, 2003 Time: 9:00 am Registration dead-line: Thursday, December 4, 2003 Location: President Hotel Bolshaya Yakimanka, 24 Blue Hall (2nd Floor) Language: Russian Fee: $125 (includes course materials and coffee break) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
The Real Power of Numbers: How Entrepreneurs Can Use Financial Statements to Grow Their Businesses

December 4, 2003

Maximize Your Business Potential Through Financial Statements

Investors and bankers place high value on accurate financial statements and realistic, defensible forecasts. Entrepreneurs who really understand what is behind the numbers of their companies are more credible business leaders and thus are far more likely to get the funding they need to build their firms. Consequently, it is critical for entrepreneurs to understand and speak intelligently about their financial statements and the key performance metrics and ratios that are essential to their businesses, as well as about the set of key assumptions that form the basis for their financial projections. Entrepreneurs usually have a good “feel” for their businesses. They know their products and markets, and they can manage people. Too often, however, entrepreneurs view financials as necessary but tedious and uninteresting aspects of their businesses that someone else, like an accountant, ought to deal with. But research shows that the most successful entrepreneurs demonstrate real financial know-how about the critical numbers in their companies. They recognize that financial statements are valuable sources of information, powerful planning mechanisms and essential tools for managing and growing their businesses faster and more profitably.

About The Center for Entrepreneurship

Allan Edwin, Ph.D., is President of Edwin & Associates, which specializes in strategic and business planning; joint venture and strategic partnership negotiation; conflict resolution; capital formation; and operational consulting. As an entrepreneur, Mr. Edwin started and was CEO for 10 years of Interactive Systems, Inc., a computer and communications company that he managed through three rounds of venture funding, and its acquisition by 3M. Mr. Edwin is a Fellow of the Foundation for Enterprise Development, which has extensive experience in designing and delivering entrepreneurship programs worldwide. This workshop provides entrepreneurs the tools to use financial statements in running and expanding their businesses, read, understand and use critical financial information, model their businesses, detect business problems early, improve forecasting abilities, create flash reports, and present financial information more effectively. In addition to relevant examples and case studies, the program utilizes questionnaires and worksheets so that each entrepreneur walks away with a customized set of financial tools that he or she can use to help build their companies. For more information, you can contact us at contact@cfe.ru.

page_cooked.page_description: Learn how entrepreneurs can leverage financial statements to secure funding and grow their businesses in this comprehensive workshop hosted by Allan Edwin, Ph.D.

The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange The U.S. Russia Entrepreneur Exchange Program On May 20 - 30, 2004, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship, along with our partner in the United States, the Foundation for Enterprise Development is sponsoring five Russian entrepreneurs for a 10-day business development and on-site exchange with an American entrepreneur from the same industry. Members of the 2003 US Russia Entrepreneur Exchange in Washington DC, May 2003 Mission To bring together growth entrepreneurs from Russia and the U.S. to learn from each other, get inspiration and validation from their peers, and to expand their networking. Goals 1.  To provide a peer-to-peer learning activity by matching selected Russian entrepreneurs with their U.S. counterparts to exchange ideas and business practices that shape an emerging company. 2.  To immerse Russian entrepreneurs in the American entrepreneurial culture, and expose their American hosts to the business culture of Russia. 3.  To build personal relationships between entrepreneurs within a shared industry sector as a foundation for future business opportunities or trade. Selection Prospective Russian candidates will be screened and chosen through the use of information gathered from an application form and a personal interview with The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship (CFE).  Once five Russian entrepreneurs of growing companies have been identified, CFE, with the assistance of our partner organizations the Foundation for Enterprise Development and Young Entrepreneurs Organization (YEO), will identify U.S.-based entrepreneurs from similar industries, type and size of business, stage of business, etc., for possible matches with their Russian counterparts. Download Application Form Here .  Applications due February 27, 2004. For more information, please call 7(095) 252-7927, or e-mail us at contact@cfe.ru Participants in the 2003 Exchange: On May 28-June 7, 2003 CFE sponsored six Russian entrepreneurs of growing companies on a network learning event to meet and exchange knowledge with American entrepreneurs from the same industry.  The Russian entrepreneurs included: Mikhail Kupriyanov, CEO of Syscom, a flat screen monitor manufacturing company; Alexey Voloshin, CEO of Consoil, a venture finance company; Andrei Korneev, CEO of Bioform, a medical products company; Yelena Ulyanova, CEO of Studio Alisa, a television production company; Dmitry Vechkanov, CEO of CMG Strategy, a marketing consulting company; and Alexander Soloviev, CEO of FIS, a food industry equipment manufacturing company. Official Information Date: Thursday, May 20, 2004 Time: 12:00 pm Registration dead-line: Friday, February 27, 2004 Fee: $2,000.00 (payable in rubles) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

The Entrepreneur Exchange Program

May 20, 2004

A Groundbreaking Initiative for Entrepreneurs

The Center for Entrepreneurship is sponsoring five entrepreneurs for a 10-day business development and on-site exchange with their American counterparts. Participants will immerse themselves in the entrepreneurial culture of the United States while sharing their own business practices and insights. Their collaboration with The Center for Entrepreneurship in this program underscores the importance of international cooperation in fostering a vibrant entrepreneurial community.

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Growth in Competitive Conditions: Faster, Higher, Stronger On April 11, 2003, The US Russia Center for Entrepreneurship and the business newspaper Vedomosti co-organized the conference, Growth in Competitive Conditions:  Faster, Higher, Stronger Over 70 growth entrepreneurs, consultants, investment professionals, as well as top managers from large Russian companies participated in the conference that focused on ways to improve company success in Russias increasingly competitive market.  The full day conference was divided into panel discussions, each focusing on an issue growth companies face, including: growth strategies, how to implementing these strategies, and raising capital. Dennis Bugrov from McKinsey & Company discussed Elements of Successful Growth Strategies, outlining examples of international companies, such as Gillette, that have remained strong by acquiring and creating new products (shaving crème, deodorant, etc.) to complement older products that have entered a mature life cycle (razors).  After Mr. Bugrovs presentation, Alexey Evgenev, General Director of Severstalmash, a large conglomerate, spoke about how his company successfully implemented McKinseys growth strategy recommendations.  Elena Chirkova, from Deloitte & Touche, expanded upon this theme and spoke about diversification, using companies such as Revlon, GE, as examples of companies that have used acquisitions to diversify and expand their business. Kirill Dimitriev of Delta Capital Management presented on what private equity funds look for in potential investment targets.  As the audience included growth entrepreneurs who are, or may seek private equity investment in the near future, Mr. Dimitriev outlined important factors in the decision by private equity fund to invest in a growth enterprise, including: Can the fund make money investing in this company? Who will be interested in buying the business in 3-4 years? How much will they pay? What factors will be important to the potential buyer? How much money must be invested, and in what business lines in order to maximize return on investment? How to motivate the management toward the planned sale of the company? CFE invited Vladimir Burenkov, Chair of the Russian Venture Capital Association, to speak about the state of venture capital in Russia.  He first outlined the distinction between venture and private equity capital, and stressed that private equity investment is more prevalent than venture capital because of the high-risk associated with venture investment in Russian start-up companies.  Mr. Burenkov then went on to outline the market sectors which have received the most direct investment, namely the food and telecommunications sectors (25.9% and 25.3% respectively). One of the most fascinating presentations was from Mr. Victor Saks, Director of Strategy and Development at 36.6 an entrepreneur-owned, fast growth pharmaceutical company with a retail chain of 55 pharmacies.  By 2002, 36.6 had a strong brand and a leadership position in its market.  However, it needed funding to support future growth through merger and acquisitions, as the Russian pharmacy industry is entering a phase of consolidation.  Mr. Saks outlined 36.6s decision to raise capital via a Russian IPO versus pursuing direct-equity investment.  36.6 chose an IPO because it gave its owners the best opportunity to retain control over the company, and it forced the company to become transparent, which will facilitate mergers and acquisitions and access to future capital.  Finally, a listing in Russia is obligatory before a company can issue ADRs, a long-term goal.  36.6 went public on February 6, 2003 and raised $14.4 million through the sale of 1.6 million shares, or 20% of the companys shares. Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

content_item.parsed_text:
The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Corporate Governance for Successful Entrepreneurs Successful entrepreneurs understand a critical fact about investors  they place their funds with a company that is transparent, and governed by a system that provides them with certain rights, a steady flow of information, and specific safeguards.  Cutting-edge technology, market share, or even the most experienced team mean nothing to investors unless they are confident that they are placing their money in an enterprise that will treat them fairly.  To raise capital for their growing companies, entrepreneurs must create this confidence in the minds of potential investors.  One of the most powerful ways to do this is by establishing a credible system of corporate governance.  This workshop shows entrepreneurs how to create such a system, and in the process increase their chances of raising capital for their growing companies. Corporate governance is the set of rules that define the relationship between a company, its shareholders and the community.  The more effectively entrepreneurs implement these rules, the better the relationships they build, and the faster their companies grow.  This workshop identifies the key provisions of the Russian Code of Corporate Governance and shows entrepreneurs how to adapt and apply them to their companies.  Through real-world examples and case-based scenarios, entrepreneurs will learn: How an effective disclosure policy will inspire investor confidence in the companys management; How to select, structure and work with a Board of Directors to better manage the company; How to best utilize outside auditors to insure credible financial reporting; What rights to provide shareholders and investors to keep them informed of company developments; and How to address conflicts between shareholders and management to maintain trust in the organization. This workshop will help entrepreneurs develop and implement practical solutions to corporate governance issues.  It will expose entrepreneurs to universally accepted good corporate governance practices so that they can develop a system that best fits their companys needs. Investors want to place their money in an enterprise that discloses everything they need to know about the company before investing, and then keeps them appraised on the progress of the company after they invest.  Through worksheets, cases, relevant examples and interactive discussion, entrepreneurs will walk away from this workshop with a customized corporate governance structure that can help them insure investor confidence and increase their chances of attracting capital.  They will learn the need for fair, timely and accurate disclosure of information, the optimal structure of their board of directors, and the powerful role of corporate governance in making their companies more successful. Course Developer and Facilitator Paul Kouris is a corporate attorney with extensive international experience counseling on matters relating to corporate governance, financing, employee ownership, privatization and securities issues.  He is a renowned corporate governance expert who has worked with hundreds of entrepreneurs and taught in several countries. Official Information Date: Thursday, May 22, 2003 Time: 2:00 pm Location: President Hotel Language: English with simultaneous Russian translation Fee: $250 (includes course materials and coffee break) Information: contact@cfe.ru Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

Understanding the Importance of Corporate Governance for Entrepreneurs

May 22, 2003

The Center for Entrepreneuership Workshop on Corporate Governance

Successful entrepreneurs understand the critical importance of corporate governance in attracting investor confidence and raising capital for their growing companies. This workshop equips entrepreneurs with the knowledge to establish a credible corporate governance system and enhance their chances of securing investments.

Key Provisions and Practices for Effective Corporate Governance

Learn more about how corporate governance can build better relationships with shareholders, inspire investor confidence, improve financial reporting, and address conflicts within the organization. By implementing good governance practices, entrepreneurs can create a transparent and trustworthy environment for investors.

- Learning Programs russian version Workshops Conferences Entrepreneur Exchange Moscow Entrepreneurship Group (June 2003) The US Russia Center for Entrepreneurship and AmChams Enterprise Development Committee held its first Moscow Entrepreneurship Group to discuss Raising Capital.  The Moscow Entrepreneurship Group is an ongoing networking and panel event that brings together entrepreneurs of growing companies with investment and service sector professionals to discuss topics that educate and are vital to creating a healthy entrepreneurial culture in Russia. Speakers on the Raising Capital Panel: Investment Industry  Kirill Dmitriev, Vice President, Delta Capital Management.  Mr. Dmitriev discussed what equity funds look for in investment targets, and common mistakes entrepreneurs make when seeking investment. Entrepreneur  Dmitry Agarunov, Owner, GameLand (Publisher of seven magazines, including Svoi Business).  Mr. Agarunov talked about the process he went through to obtain private equity investment to fund the expansion of his growing publishing business. Service Sector  Yuri Mostovoy, CEO, RosBusinessConsulting International.  Mr. Mostovoy discussed his companys recent IPO, and steps entrepreneurs need take in order to obtain equity funding. Kirill Dmitriev, Dmitry Agarunov, Yuri Mostovoy, and CFE Director Victor Sedov Copyright © 2002, The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship Design — Creative Marketing Group , Agency of Internet Technologies ltd Development — Agency of Internet Technologies ltd

Raising Capital Panel Discussion

June 2003

Inaugural Entrepreneurship Group Discusses Raising Capital Challenges

The Center for Entrepreneurship held its first entrepreneurship group to discuss raising capital. This ongoing networking and panel event brings together entrepreneurs of growing companies with investment and service sector professionals to discuss topics vital to creating a healthy entrepreneurial culture. The panel included experts from various industries. Kirill Dmitriev, Vice President at Delta Capital Management, discussed what equity funds look for in investment targets and common mistakes entrepreneurs make when seeking investment. Entrepreneur Dmitry Agarunov, owner of GameLand, shared his experience of obtaining private equity investment to fund the expansion of his publishing business. Yuri Mostovoy, CEO of RosBusinessConsulting International, discussed his company’s recent IPO and the steps entrepreneurs need to take to obtain equity funding. The event generated valuable insights for all attendees and was a stepping stone towards a more collaborative entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Key Organizations Contributing to the Event

Delta Capital Management is a prominent investment firm known for its focus on funding innovative startups and businesses. Their expertise in identifying high-potential investment opportunities has made them a leader in the equity funding space. GameLand, under the leadership of Dmitry Agarunov, is a successful publishing company that has expanded significantly through strategic equity investments. They publish multiple magazines, catering to a diverse audience, and have set a benchmark in the publishing industry. RosBusinessConsulting International, a comprehensive business services provider, successfully completed an IPO, showcasing their robust business model and growth potential. Their insights into equity funding and IPO processes offer practical knowledge to other aspiring entrepreneurs.

Leading a High Performance Company

July 16, 2003

A 4-Hour Leadership Workshop for Entrepreneurs

As an entrepreneur you took a great business idea and started and grew your company – overseeing every step and making the most important decisions. Now, as your business expands you face new challenges that require more and more of your time and resources. One of the best investments you can make to ensure the success of your growing company is to invest in yourself as a leader. This workshop offers entrepreneurs the tools and techniques needed to enhance their leadership skills, allowing them to effectively manage and scale their businesses.

Key Organizations Involved

The Entrepreneurs' Organization is a global network of entrepreneurs that helps business leaders leverage their skills and resources through shared experiences and peer-to-peer learning. By providing a supportive community, this organization aims to inspire and help entrepreneurs achieve their business goals. Another key organization, the Global Entrepreneurship Week, hosts a series of events and activities to promote entrepreneurial engagement on a global scale. These initiatives provide entrepreneurs with opportunities to learn, connect, and be motivated by successful business practices from across the world.

Leading a High Performance Company

July 16, 2003

A 4-Hour Leadership Workshop for Entrepreneurs

As an entrepreneur you took a great business idea and started and grew your company – overseeing every step and making the most important decisions. Now, as your business expands you face new challenges that require more and more of your time and resources. One of the best investments you can make to ensure the success of your growing company is to invest in yourself as a leader. This workshop offers entrepreneurs the tools and techniques needed to enhance their leadership skills, allowing them to effectively manage and scale their businesses.

Key Organizations Involved

The Entrepreneurs' Organization is a global network of entrepreneurs that helps business leaders leverage their skills and resources through shared experiences and peer-to-peer learning. By providing a supportive community, this organization aims to inspire and help entrepreneurs achieve their business goals. Another key organization, the Global Entrepreneurship Week, hosts a series of events and activities to promote entrepreneurial engagement on a global scale. These initiatives provide entrepreneurs with opportunities to learn, connect, and be motivated by successful business practices from across the world.

Growth in Competitive Conditions: Faster, Higher, Stronger

April 11, 2003

The Center for Entrepreneurship Co-organizes a Landmark Conference

On April 11, 2003, The Center for Entrepreneurship and the business newspaper Vedomosti co-organized the conference 'Growth in Competitive Conditions: Faster, Higher, Stronger.' Over 70 growth entrepreneurs, consultants, investment professionals, as well as top managers from large companies participated. The conference focused on ways to improve company success in increasingly competitive markets. Key topics included strategies for sustaining growth, gaining a competitive edge, and overcoming market challenges.

Key Organizations Involved

Vedomosti, the business newspaper, is known for providing vital insights into economic and political developments. As a leading source of business news, it continues to be a valuable resource for entrepreneurs and industry leaders. Their partnership with The Center for Entrepreneurship signifies a commitment to fostering an environment conducive to business growth and competitive success.

July 17, 2003

A Unique Networking Opportunity for Entrepreneurs

The U.S. Entrepreneur Exchange is a program where The Center for Entrepreneurship sends entrepreneurs to the United States for 10 days of learning and networking with American entrepreneurs in the same industry. This program is a unique networking opportunity that allows you and your American host to learn from each other's experience, compare strategies for further growth, and share insights into overcoming the issues associated with owning and managing a high growth company.

content_item.parsed_text: Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city to receive our e-Bulletin (3 times a year) Last Name First Name Company Title E-mail Telephone City Industry - Agriculture Construction and Real Estate Consulting Food Industry Investor Legal Media NGO Production Other Russian Government Services Technology Transport/Logistics U.S. Government University Education Role Manager Entrepreneur Top Manager Instructor Government Employee Expert Student Other Submit Русский Join us on Facebook Twitter Subscribe For announcements of upcoming events and/or our e-Bulletin About Programs for Entrepreneurs Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development Partners Matching Funding Resource Center For Donors Partners Contacts Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development September 27, 2012 at the annual conference, Developing Entrepreneurial Companies, organized and held as part of the 10th anniversary of the Center for Entrepreneurship, leaders of Russian regional entrepreneurship development organizations signed a Partnership Agreement with the Center for Entrepreneurship to unite efforts in entrepreneurship development by creating the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development. The Alliance activities are focused on providing Russian entrepreneurs access to international and national entrepreneurship events, educational programs targeting prospective entrepreneurs, and initiatives that promote entrepreneurship as the foundation of economic well-being, and that create a favorable environment for innovation.  The Alliance also promotes entrepreneurship education methodology by promoting entrepreneurship programs in universities and conducting trainings for professors. To qualify as an Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development partner, an entity must be an entrepreneurship organization whose main goal is the development of entrepreneurship, and which has the resources and expertise necessary to hold entrepreneurial events and train entrepreneurs and faculty. For details about the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development, call the Center for Entrepreneurship at +7 499 929 7927 or e-mail elevkin@cfe.ru . All information related to the performance of the Alliance you may get at the Russian webpage of the Alliance at www.cfe.ru/alliance/ © The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 2010 Site Map Development — Webmaster.SPb

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development

June 9, 2013

Bringing Together Entrepreneurial Efforts for Economic Growth

On September 27, 2012, at the annual conference Developing Entrepreneurial Companies, leaders of regional entrepreneurship development organizations signed a Partnership Agreement with the Center for Entrepreneurship to create the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development. The Alliance is focused on providing entrepreneurs with access to international and national entrepreneurship events, educational programs targeting prospective entrepreneurs, and initiatives that promote entrepreneurship as the foundation of economic well-being, fostering a favorable environment for innovation. The Alliance also promotes entrepreneurship education methodology by endorsing entrepreneurship programs in universities and conducting trainings for professors.

Key Organizations Involved in the Alliance

The Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development collaborates with various key organizations to further its mission. One notable program is Global Entrepreneurship Week, which gathers millions of entrepreneurs across the globe to celebrate innovation and progress. Another significant program is Startup Huddle, a community-building initiative that helps one entrepreneur at a time by offering a test-bed for their ideas and encouraging a supportive environment. These programs, among others, play a crucial role in developing a robust entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Partners Subscribe to receive announcements about upcoming events in your city to receive our e-Bulletin (3 times a year) Last Name First Name Company Title E-mail Telephone City Industry - Agriculture Construction and Real Estate Consulting Food Industry Investor Legal Media NGO Production Other Russian Government Services Technology Transport/Logistics U.S. Government University Education Role Manager Entrepreneur Top Manager Instructor Government Employee Expert Student Other Submit Русский Join us on Facebook Twitter Subscribe For announcements of upcoming events and/or our e-Bulletin About Programs for Entrepreneurs Youth Entrepreneurship Initiatives Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development Partners Resource Center Partners Contacts Partners All Kaliningrad Voronezh Yekaterinburg Kazan Rostov-na-donu Samara Gorno-Altaysk Perm Tomsk Pulsar Venture LLC Pulsar Venture LLC was founded in Kazan in 2009 to become a part of the innovative entrepreneurship ecosystem in Russia. Pulsar Venture has become the center of competences in strategic and investment consulting, supporting development of startups in the high-tech sphere, and interacting with venture funds, techno-parks, universities and government institutions all over Russia. Details 12 in-house and 20 independent experts provide consultative services in business strategy, deal structuring, financial management, “smart packaging” of business for investors and investor relations.  Pulsar Venture contributes to development of entrepreneurship skills and competences of innovative startup teams and projects; provides assistance to foreign companies and investors entering Russian market and supports entrepreneurship projects in fundraising. Pulsar Venture maintains entrepreneurship ecosystem by means of raising entrepreneurs’ competence and filling the gap between invention and project implementation. Pulsar Venture LLC became Alliance regional partner in 2012. Contacts: Pavel Korolev, General Director, +7 843 227 4027 pavel.korolev@pulsarventure.com Olga Kigel, External Affairs Department Director, +7 843 227-4027, +7 987 296 8084 (mobile), olga.kigel@pulsarventure.com Regional Information Consulting Center LLC The main goal of the Regional Information Consulting Center LLC is assistance to business development in Russia. 
Regional Information Consulting Center realizes information projects in the field of entrepreneurship development: business meetings, seminars, workshops, forums and other activities aimed at development of business in Russia. Details As part of the group of companies “Brain” the Center is publishing monthly business-magazine «Own business media» which is distributed in Rostov, Krasnodar, Voronezh and Kaluga regions as well as in Moscow. 
The Center issues monthly magazine «SEA» (Security of Economic Activity) distributed by subscription and focused on the security of economic activities of private businesses and banks. Mikhail Koltunov, one of the founders of the Center, is the regional coordinator of the program “Youth Business Russia” in Rostov region. In November 2012 the Center was one of the organizers of the Russian Youth Entrepreneurship Forum «OWN BUSINESS 2.0». Regional Information Consulting Center LLC became Alliance regional partner in 2012. Contacts: Koltunov Mikhail Igorevich, Managing Partner Adamov Georgiy Nikolaevich, Manager Rostov-on-Don, Pr. Budennovsky, 42/50
+7 863 301 20 01 (301 20 10) mb@brain-media.ru Agency for Development of Qualifications - Kaliningrad Autonomous noncommercial organization “Agency for Development of Qualifications - Kaliningrad” (brand name -- Technology Management K.R.U.G.) was established in 2011 to provide consultancy services in personnel management and business development in Kaliningrad region. Details The Agency is focused on interaction with business community in the region on a variety of issues starting from business training and workshops to corporate governance and personnel certification. Since its creation the Agency conducted a number of roundtables with different entrepreneurship communities in the region and a number of workshops devoted to selected entrepreneurship skills and practices. The Agency is aimed to develop relations with other Alliance partners to promote entrepreneurship development and organize joint events in Kaliningrad region. The Agency became Alliance associate partner in 2013. Contacts: 236010, Russia, Kaliningrad, Pobeda avenue, 54a +7 4012 96 11 77 (95 67 62) +7 911 476 7155 mail@kruginfo.ru www.kruginfo.ru Institute of Public Administration and Entrepreneurship The Institute of Public Administration and Entrepreneurship is a structural division of the Ural Federal University (named after the first President of Russia B.N.Yeltsin).  Entrepreneurship education is a key priority for the Institute and is carried out at the Department of Innovations and Entrepreneurship in close cooperation with the Institute of Economics, Ural Branch of the Russian Academy of Science. Details A lot of advanced training programs and retraining courses, and a number of MBA programs (RABE accredited) are provided at the Center of Additional Professional Education.  The Center of Innovative Entrepreneurship administers Institute’s projects, provides consulting and research activities, and promotes additional educational programs in entrepreneurship for students of different training levels.  Main projects of the Institute are: - development and promotion of a new federal educational standard "Entrepreneurship " under the auspices of the Russian Association for Entrepreneurship Education - implementation of joint educational projects with the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development - organization of the annual International Summer School: Knowledge Generates Business (KGB) - development and supervision of the competition “EntrepreneurshipLand (Predprinimaniya): Start a business at the Ural Federal University” - organization of the city and regional championships "Iron Entrepreneur" together with the High School of Economics - conducting annual monitoring of student’s attitudes on entrepreneurship and series of studies "Monitoring and analysis of SMEs of Sverdlovsk region, 2008-2012” - organization of the "Global Entrepreneurship Week" in Sverdlovsk region in cooperation with the Center of Entrepreneurship The Institute of Public Administration and Entrepreneurship became Alliance regional partner in 2012. Contacts: Alexey Klyuyev , Director, +7 343 371 56 04 klyuev.alexey@gmail.com Vitaly Kopnov, Director of the Department of Innovation and Entrepreneurship, +7 343 371 56 04 (ext. 119), kopnov@list.ru www.igup-urfu.ru OJSC Technopark OJSC Technopark was established by the Government of Samara region in 2002 as an innovation support infrastructure institution in Samara region.  The Government of Samara region, National Research University - Samara State Aerospace University and Samara State Medical University are the founders of the company. Technopark is the managing company of two projects: “Technopolis in Samara” and “Industrial park Preobrazhenka” (Volzhskiy municipal district).  The mail objective of the Technopark is to create material and technical basis for the operation of innovative organizations and innovation infrastructure, to increase production of high-tech goods and improve product competitiveness in the Samara industrial cluster. Details Technopark provides the following services: • support for small and medium-sized innovative companies projects from stage Seed to stage Start Up in business incubation program; • consulting: - economics and business planning; - legal support and protection of intellectual property; - accounting; • outsourcing of non-core activities; • organization of training and professional development for entrepreneurs; • exhibition activities; • market research and promotion of innovative products. Our key task is promotion of entrepreneurship, creation of comfortable conditions for small and medium-sized innovative companies, increase in the number of high-tech businesses. OJSC “Technopark” became Alliance regional partner in 2013. Contacts: Popov Dmitry, Head, Innovation department 443086, Russian Federation, Samara, Moskovskoe shosse, 34A, building 3B, office 22 +7 (846) 267-44-00 popov-ds@technopark-samara.ru Voronezh Regional Public Organization «Union of Entrepreneurs» Voronezh Regional Public Organization «Union of Entrepreneurs» was founded in 1995 by the group of entrepreneurs. About 200 entrepreneurs of different spheres are the members of the Union today. The main directions of activity of VRPO «Union of Entrepreneurs» are: - development of business in the city of Voronezh and Voronezh region; - popularization of entrepreneurship; - building a constructive dialogue between business, government and society; - encouraging development of youth entrepreneurship; - provision of information, advisory, legal and other assistance to small and medium businesses; - consulting services in the field of entrepreneurship. Details VRPO «Union of Entrepreneurs» keeps track of actual information about changes in Russian legislation and improves it by introducing amendments to enactments in business sphere through issuing appeals to federal and local bodies of representative and executive power. The Union improves economic and legal competences in business sphere among all groups of entrepreneurs, encourages young people to start a business and tries to improve entrepreneurship environment in Voronezh region. The Union is a member of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Voronezh region, Russian Coordination Centre of regional entrepreneurship organizations, a partner of program Youth Business International in Voronezh. Voronezh Regional Public Organization «Union of Entrepreneurs» became Alliance regional partner in 2013. Contacts: Irina Gorelova, Executive Director +7 4732 77 22 05, +7 915 585 95 06 Irina_gorelova09@mail.ru , vooo_op@mail.ru Republic of Altai Foundation for the Development and Support of Small and Medium Businesses The Republic of Altai Foundation for the Development and Support of Small and Medium Businesses is a non-profit organization whose main purpose is to implement the Republican Program of Government Support for Small and Medium Businesses, and co-fund other programs, projects and events to ensure the development of competition, enhance product markets, and create new jobs. Details Key areas of activity of the Foundation are as follows: - build market relations using government support for small and medium entrepreneurship; - implement programs, projects and events in the field of small and medium entrepreneurship; - take part in building market infrastructure creating opportunities for small and medium businesses; - provide microfinance (up to one million rubles) to small and medium businesses; - manage the Republican Entrepreneurship Support Center Business Incubator. Business Incubator is the only innovative business incubator in the Republic of Altai.  Its mission is to ensure favorable conditions for the development of small businesses in the Republic of Altai by granting companies property support on beneficial terms, as well as material, information, advisory and other services. The main activities of the Business Incubator are as follows: - support residents; - interact with municipal centers of entrepreneurship support; - organize and conduct seminars for small and medium businesses in the Republic of Altai; - set up and develop a regional system of entrepreneurship education; - provide advisory and information support for small and medium businesses; - support export producers. The Foundation has been a regional partner of the Alliance for the Development of Entrepreneurship since 2013. Contact Information: Yelena Kudachinova 9 Komsomolskaya Ul, Gorno-Altaisk Tel. +7 38822 47 241 binkra@mail.ru www.binkra.ru Perm Foundation for the Development of Entrepreneurship The Perm Foundation for the Development of Entrepreneurship is a non-profit organization founded by the Perm Krai Ministry of Industry, Entrepreneurship and Trade in October 2012. The Foundation operates as requested by the Perm Krai Ministry of Industry, Entrepreneurship and Trade and is focused on developing entrepreneurship in the Perm Krai, supporting competitiveness of small and medium businesses. Details Key areas of activity are as follows: - organize a network of Centers for support of entrepreneurship in the Perm Krai - facilitate local economic development - assist in the development of youth entrepreneurship - promote the positive image of entrepreneurs - develop entrepreneurial literacy - set up an Internet web-site for entrepreneurs The Foundation motivates, teaches, helps, and supports young people as they open up and develop their businesses; advises on entrepreneurial issues; informs and trains startup and active entrepreneurs; helps set up a favorable entrepreneurship ecosystem; develops the entrepreneurial culture; creates a positive public perception of entrepreneurs; and promotes entrepreneurship ideas. The Foundation arranges seminars, trainings, master classes, fora, and competitions for entrepreneurs. The web-site for small and medium businesses, www.цпп-пермь.рф, offers future, beginning and active entrepreneurs up-to-date and useful information concerning government support and government orders, foundations of business and business planning, accounting and taxation, legal issues, and many other matters related to entrepreneurial activities. The Foundation has a call center for Perm Krai entrepreneurs. Any entrepreneur calling the hotline at 8-800-300-8090 can receive free advice from skilled experts in entrepreneurial matters. The Perm Foundation for the Development of Entrepreneurship has been a partner of the Alliance for Entrepreneurship Development since 2014. Contacts: Irina Leushkanova, Deputy Director +7  922 34 8003 lis@frp59.ru www.цпп-пермь.рф NPO “Promotion of Innovation Technologies Business Partners” NPO “Promotion of Innovation Technologies Business Partners” was founded in 2010 to develop social, economic, technological environment conducive to the development and promotion of entrepreneurial and innovative systems in the Tomsk region.  It is a voluntary union of professionals of national and global levels aimed at regional economic development via transfer and introduction of advanced knowledge in the following areas: - project management; - theory of inventive problem solving; - Youth entrepreneurship and innovation. Details We provide educational and consulting services to our clients. Coaches, who provide these educational services, are certified specialists in project management and TRIZ.  Specialists of the company organize various activities aimed at the development of professional community of project management in the Tomsk region, including “The Club of Project Managers”. The company is a regional representative of the National Association of Project Management «SOVNET», International Association TRIZ «MATRIZ» and is included in the register of regional SME infrastructure support organizations. NPO “Promotion of Innovation Technologies Business Partners” became Alliance regional partner in 2014. Contacts: Svetlana Smolyakova, Commercial Director Tomsk, Gertsena street 10, office 310 +7(3822) 333 125 E-mail: office@ipartner.pro http://ipartner.pro © The U.S. Russia Center for Entrepreneurship 2010 Site Map Development — Webmaster.SPb

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Pulsar Venture LLC Supporting Entrepreneurship

February 7, 2016

Pulsar Venture LLC: A Key Player in Entrepreneurial Development

Pulsar Venture LLC, established in 2009, has become a crucial part of the innovative ecosystem, specializing in strategic and investment consulting. With 12 in-house and 20 independent experts, the company offers services in business strategy, deal structuring, financial management, and investor relations. Pulsar Venture also aids foreign companies and investors entering the market and supports fundraising efforts for entrepreneurial projects. The firm's goal is to bridge the gap between invention and project implementation, fostering skill development and entrepreneurial competence.

Additional Key Services and Collaborations

Pulsar Venture LLC is dedicated to building a sustainable entrepreneurship ecosystem. Its experts provide comprehensive support to startup teams in the high-tech sector. Among the services offered are smart packaging of business for investors and mentorship in development stages, from seed to startup. The company maintains strong partnerships with various entities, including techno-parks, universities, and venture funds. Their collaboration with the The Center for Entrepreneurship started in 2012, and they have since carried out numerous projects together, significantly contributing to the global entrepreneurship landscape and providing invaluable resources for budding entrepreneurs.
