Center for Entrepreneurship empowers partners and universities to integrate entrepreneurial education across curricula and equip students with the skills, connections, credentials, and real-world experiences needed to lead change and own their futures through entrepreneurship.  Center for Entrepreneurship has been implementing the Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom (DEC) program since 2006, more than 500 teachers from higher education institutions from 18 cities have taken part in the program. DEC has a great influence on the promotion of entrepreneurship education in universities  . Thanks to the program, more than 80 new programs and entrepreneurial initiatives have appeared in more than 30 universities. DEC is a training program in the format of a three- or five-day seminar with the participation of leading experts in the field of teaching entrepreneurship from Russia, Europe and the USA, providing university teachers with an introduction to methods of teaching entrepreneurship as a discipline, focused on developing the practical and business skills of future entrepreneurs.  DEC provides participants with pedagogical content and teaching methods, and also helps to hone their teaching skills. The training is implemented on three key topics: - why do we teach entrepreneurship? - what do we teach in entrepreneurship? - how do we teach entrepreneurship?   Raymond Smilor	was the key partner for developing and runnging DEC with for Center for Entrepreneurship has been implementing the program since 2006, more than 500 teachers from higher education institutions from 18 cities have taken part in the program. DEC has a great influence on the promotion of entrepreneurship education in universities  Professor at the Neeley School of Business at the University of Texas.	Professor of Entrepreneurship and Academic Director of the Entrepreneurship Program at the University of Florida College of Business Administration.	Professor of the Department of Strategic and International Management, Graduate School of Management, St. Petersburg State University, Director of the Center for Entrepreneurship, Graduate School of Management, St. Petersburg State University.   The program is designed specifically for teachers of higher education institutions, as well as for representatives of higher education and organizations involved in the development of entrepreneurship education standards and its implementation in the educational program.     DEC is aimed at: assisting those beginning to teach entrepreneurship, including practicing entrepreneurs, in mastering the most effective teaching techniques; providing the opportunity to develop a new course program on entrepreneurship with the assistance of experienced experts; the opportunity to learn from the experience of those who came to entrepreneurship training from other fields of activity, as well as to share experiences with colleagues; introduction to a range of truly creative and highly effective teaching approaches that are practice-oriented and include case studies, working with business plans, and inviting practicing entrepreneurs into the classroom; use of the proposed simple but effective structure for organizing an entrepreneurship course; exchange ideas on specific issues in entrepreneurship education: where to start a class, how to develop a creative mentoring program, the content of an entrepreneurship curriculum, and much more.    BENEFITS OF PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM  Teachers of higher education institutions: new knowledge; mastering successful methods of teaching entrepreneurship as a discipline, aimed at developing the practical skills of future entrepreneurs; improving personal qualifications and status; networking, exchange of experience. Higher education institutions prestige and authority of the university in the region, development of the teaching staff; competitive advantages, attracting active youth and authoritative teachers; engaging successful entrepreneurs as mentors and experts DEC provides teachers with unique content and competencies that contribute to the formation of a full-fledged scientific discipline. The entrepreneurship course includes: theory and practice, recognition and assessment of opportunities, effective use of resources, innovation and research.  DEC answers the question of how to teach entrepreneurship through a focus on practical experience , how to allow students to realize their entrepreneurial abilities and talents, testing the acquired knowledge in practice .

G20 Young Entrepreneurs' Alliance Summit, G20 YEA Summit The Summit is the leading international event for young entrepreneurs , annually bringing together more than 400 entrepreneurs from G20 countries in the country holding the G20 Presidency to develop international business cooperation and continue dialogue on key aspects of entrepreneurship development as a key means of stimulating economic growth.  Based on the results of the summit, a Final Communiqué is adopted, addressed to the heads of state of the G20 and containing recommendations on priority measures to stimulate entrepreneurial initiative and create conditions for the development of small and medium-sized businesses in new technological and socio-economic realities.  The greatest value for the participants – young entrepreneurs – is informal communication with colleagues from the G20 countries, which allows them not only to get acquainted with new business models and industry trends, but also to find potential suppliers, clients or partners, meet like-minded people, and develop new ideas.  The Center for Entrepreneurship was the organizer of the summit is the G20 Young Entrepreneurs' Alliance (G20 YEA),  which unites leading organizations in the field of entrepreneurship development in the G20 countries.  The Center for Entrepreneurship is a co-founder of the G20 YEA, coordinates the work of the delegation at the summit ,  and was responsible for holding the Alliance's summit in 2013. The recommendations of the final communiqué of the G20 YEA summit  regarding promoting youth employment were included in the Declaration of the G20 leaders.  FOR WHOM  The G20 Alliance Summit is a platform that unites the goals, interests, experience, knowledge and initiatives of young entrepreneurs from the world's largest economies, organizations interested in developing entrepreneurship at the national and international levels, representatives of government bodies, development institutions, and international experts.  BENEFITS OF PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM  Young entrepreneurs (under 40):  communication, exchange of experience and cooperation with colleagues from other countries; study of best world practices; promoting your business, access to international markets and know-how; participation in the development of a communiqué addressed to G20 leaders with recommendations for the development of entrepreneurship. Entrepreneurial associations and organizations interested in developing a culture of entrepreneurship:  promotion and popularization of entrepreneurship; integration into the international community; enhancing the organization's image; exchange of best practices and experience in the development and implementation of entrepreneurship development programs. Representatives of government bodies and development institutions:  strengthening international economic ties; new approaches and tools for economic development; innovative proposals to stimulate entrepreneurial initiative.

More then 840 entreprenuers acquired business skills in the Center's FastTrac programs   Kauffman FastTrac® provides relevant content and tools to support the start, growth, and sustainability of your business. About Kauffman FastTrac® Kauffman FastTrac equips aspiring entrepreneurs with the business skills and insights, tools, resources, and peer networks necessary to start and grow successful businesses.  A facilitator leans in between two adult learners Let us help you clear the path from idea to business start. You decide how you want to learn: self-paced and online, or as an affiliate learner – in a classroom with other entrepreneurs and a FastTrac facilitator, in a virtual environment or a blend of both virtually and in-person.  Kauffman FastTrac was launched by the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation, About the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation Ewing Marion Kauffman was an entrepreneur and humanitarian whose innovative and long-lasting contributions have benefited millions of people in his hometown of Kansas City and beyond.    ALL INDUSTRIES Course content not industry specific and provides relevant learnings for entrepreneurs of all types.   LEARN MORE ABOUT THE PROGRAM Choose the learning approach that fits you best. Access modules in the order that works best for you, taking as much or as little time as you need. Use quizzes and assignments to assess your learning and knowledge. Receive step-by-step guides from ideation to launch.  90% of participants applied a lesson in helping them start or grow their business  91% of participants would recommend to a friend

Empowering Entrepreneurs through the Kauffman FastTrac® Program

Since 2004, the Center for Entrepreneurship has been organizing the Kauffman FastTrac® program, empowering over 840 entrepreneurs with critical business skills. The FastTrac® program provides content and tools to support the start, growth, and sustainability of new businesses, offering both self-paced online learning and immersive classroom experiences with facilitators. Kauffman FastTrac® was launched by the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation, named after the renowned entrepreneur and humanitarian Ewing Marion Kauffman. This initiative helps participants transition from business ideas to successful launches, supported by peer networks and step-by-step guides.

About Key Organizations

The Center for Entrepreneurship is dedicated to fostering entrepreneurial growth by providing diverse programs that cater to both new and established business ventures. One such program, Kauffman FastTrac®, is a cornerstone project launched by the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation. The Foundation, inspired by Ewing Marion Kauffman's legacy, focuses on educational and entrepreneurial activities that promote economic independence. Alongside the FastTrac® program, the Center for Entrepreneurship also collaborates with the Global Entrepreneurship Network to support initiatives like Global Entrepreneurship Week and runs programs like Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom and Fasttrac. These partnerships and programs ensure a robust support system for entrepreneurs worldwide.

content_item.parsed_text: Center for Entrepreneurship has been implementing the growth programs for entrepreneurs since 2002.  Among them are two important programs: ScaleUp accelerator and Startup Club.   Center for Entrepreneurship Accelerator program is a great way to scaleup and running quickly. They provide expert guidance, mentorship, resources, and networking opportunities that can help your business reach its full potential. For entrepreneurs and startup founders, it’s important to understand what these programs are and how your company can benefit from them.  These programs offer access to experienced mentors who can guide your entrepreneurial and allow you to connect with like-minded people. This can open doors to new partnerships and collaborations that could take your business further than ever.  One of the Acceleration program for existing entrepreneurs ScaleUp The ScaleUp accelerator is designed for 9 months , for active entrepreneurs with high growth potential undergo group training and practical training. The program includes 10 interactive training sessions, at least 10 networking events, at least 18 meetings with an individually selected mentor .  The program was developed by "Center for Entrepreneurship" based on the best international practices of creating similar programs. The goal of implementing the acceleration program in the regions is to develop the ecosystem of entrepreneurship and human capital of the region through the transfer of knowledge, experience and growth tools according to a specially developed methodology that combines successful international practice and the best Russian entrepreneurial experience.  The ScaleUp program is a comprehensive set of tools aimed at both increasing the individual business performance of participants and developing the local entrepreneurial ecosystem as a whole.  Program components:  Training: transfer of knowledge and applied tools, including interactive solution of practical problems using a special methodology Experience exchange: mini-conferences bringing together entrepreneurs, professional service providers and investors to exchange experiences and information on business development issues. Expert sessions on problematic situations. Mentoring: individual interaction between a student and an experienced entrepreneur-mentor, who shares theoretical knowledge with the mentee and helps solve practical problems Interactive training is conducted in the following areas:  Strategic planning Marketing Digital Marketing Sales management Personnel Management Management and leadership Cash flow management Finance for non-financiers Attracting investments Presentation to the investor  FOR WHOM The ScaleUp acceleration program is designed specifically for existing entrepreneurs and provides applied tools to accelerate business growth. The program is implemented by the Entrepreneurship Center through a regional partner network and the involvement of the regional expert community interested in creating and maintaining an entrepreneurship ecosystem in the region. As part of the program, local mentors and coaches undergo special training.  In addition to the interests of business owners, the program responds to requests from government officials and support organizations regarding the development of the region as a whole.  Thus, the ScaleUp program unites the interests of entrepreneurs, mentors, coaches, regional partners, the expert community , thereby stimulating the active development of the local entrepreneurial ecosystem .   BENEFITS OF PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM   access to the entrepreneurial best practices and knowledge; gaining the knowledge and applied skills necessary for rapid business growth; personal growth of an entrepreneur through interaction with an experienced mentor; long-term support from more experienced entrepreneurs; business growth; expanding contacts with business organizations and the expert community at the state, federal and international levels; involvement in international entrepreneurial initiatives.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Empower Your Business with the Center for Entrepreneurship Programs

Unlock Success with the Center for Entrepreneurship's ScaleUp Accelerator and Startup Club

Since 2002, the Center for Entrepreneurship has been the backbone of numerous growth programs for entrepreneurs. The Center offers two pivotal programs: the ScaleUp accelerator and Startup Club. These initiatives are designed to provide aspiring and existing entrepreneurs with the tools they need to reach new heights. The ScaleUp program is a 9-month extensive training module that includes interactive sessions, personalized mentoring, and networking events. Participants engage in 10 interactive training sessions, at least 10 networking events, and 18 one-on-one meetings with seasoned mentors. These elements work together to ensure entrepreneurs receive comprehensive guidance and resources, helping them scale their operations. Notably, the ScaleUp program features training on diverse topics such as strategic planning, marketing, digital marketing, sales management, personnel management, and more. Similarly, Startup Club focuses on fostering connections among startup founders, providing access to a wealth of resources and guidance. Entrepreneurs gain the chance to collaborate with like-minded individuals, explore new business opportunities, and expand their networks.

Key Organizations Supporting Entrepreneurship

The Center for Entrepreneurship collaborates with numerous organizations to ensure its programs are effective and beneficial for participants. One such collaboration is with the Entrepreneurs' Organization, a global network that helps entrepreneurs grow through peer-to-peer learning, networking, and mentor relationships. Another significant partner is the Global Entrepreneurship Network, which operates in over 170 countries to build an entrepreneurial ecosystem that supports innovation, job creation, and economic growth. The Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation provides extensive research and resources to foster a more inclusive and innovative entrepreneurial environment. Additionally, collaborations with US Department Of State initiatives promote international entrepreneurial efforts, enhancing the global reach and impact of the programs offered by the Center for Entrepreneurship.

Mentors and experts  the opportunity to re-evaluate your own business experience; synergy of the results of the mentor and the mentee, new ideas; improving one’s own entrepreneurial competencies; influence on the development of the entrepreneurship ecosystem in your region; expanding the network of business contacts. Trainers  training in modern international methodology of working with entrepreneurs; exchange of experience and knowledge with other trainers and the expert community; expanding your professional portfolio and circle of contacts. Regional partners  competitive advantages – the program is unique in its quality and comprehensive approach; new connections at the federal and international levels. Local authorities and development organizations  development of the entrepreneurial community in the region and the region as a whole; Entrepreneurs in the region receive growth tools every year, increasing the number of jobs, the efficiency of their business and the number of new projects; participants in the entrepreneurial ecosystem receive an effective tool for interaction; conditions are being created for the development of human capital and the growth of the volume of investments attracted to the region.   Center for Entrepreneurship' Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom empowers partners and universities to integrate entrepreneurial education across curricula and equip students with the skills, connections, credentials, and real-world experiences needed to lead change and own their futures through entrepreneurship.  Center for Entrepreneurship has been implementing the Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom (DEC) program since 2006, more than 500 teachers from higher education institutions from 18 cities have taken part in the program. DEC has a great influence on the promotion of entrepreneurship education in universities  . Thanks to the program, more than 80 new programs and entrepreneurial initiatives have appeared in more than 30 universities. DEC is a training program in the format of a three- or five-day seminar with the participation of leading experts in the field of teaching entrepreneurship from Russia, Europe and the USA, providing university teachers with an introduction to methods of teaching entrepreneurship as a discipline, focused on developing the practical and business skills of future entrepreneurs.  DEC provides participants with pedagogical content and teaching methods, and also helps to hone their teaching skills. The training is implemented on three key topics: - why do we teach entrepreneurship? - what do we teach in entrepreneurship? - how do we teach entrepreneurship? With the comprehensive interaction of all parties involved in the implementation of the ScaleUp acceleration program , a full-fledged entrepreneurship ecosystem is developing in the region , ensuring the growth of well-being and the achievement of the goals of each participant in the ecosystem.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Center for Entrepreneurship Empowers Entrepreneurs Through Innovative Programs

ScaleUp Accelerator, Startup Club, and Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom Transforming the Entrepreneurial Landscape

The Center for Entrepreneurship has been implementing diverse entrepreneurship programs since 2002. Key initiatives include the ScaleUp Accelerator for existing entrepreneurs, the Startup Club for new entrepreneurs, and the Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom. Such programs offer expert mentorship, resources, and networking opportunities critical for business growth. ScaleUp Accelerator offers a 9-month journey for active entrepreneurs with high growth potential through group training, interactive workshops, and mentorship sessions. The program aims to elevate participants' business performance and contribute to local entrepreneurial ecosystems. Startup Club is geared towards new entrepreneurs, providing crucial insights, practical skills, and industry connections essential for startups. Lastly, the Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom integrates entrepreneurial education into university curricula, helping students gain real-world skills and experiences needed to lead entrepreneurial ventures successfully. These programs not only benefit individual entrepreneurs but also stimulate the regional economy by promoting human capital development, creating jobs, and inspiring new projects.

Additional Information on Key Organizations

The Entrepreneurs' Organization (EO) is a global network that connects successful entrepreneurs to share experiences, expertise, and support. EO aims to foster entrepreneurial growth and provide a peer-to-peer learning environment. The Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation is dedicated to advancing educational achievement and entrepreneurial success, offering resources, research, and programs that promote innovative and sustainable entrepreneurship practices. The Global Entrepreneurship Network (GEN) operates a platform of programs in 180 countries aimed at making it easier for anyone, anywhere to start and scale a business. GEN's initiatives encourage cross-border collaboration and foster a global entrepreneurial community.

content_item.parsed_text: It not that easy for entrepreneurs that want to grow to find good program Since 2002, the Center for Entrepreneurship has been the backbone of numerous growth programs for entrepreneurs.  The Center offers high impact program that has proven and efficient program for entrepreneurs: the ScaleUp accelerator  Accelerator program is a great way to scaleup and running quickly. The program provide expert guidance, mentorship, resources, and networking opportunities that can help your business reach its full potential. For entrepreneurs and startup founders, it�s important to understand what these programs are and how your company can benefit from them.  These programs offer regular seesion withexperienced mentors who can guide your entrepreneurial and allow you to connect with like-minded people. This can open doors to new partnerships and collaborations that could take your business further than ever.  One of the Acceleration program for existing entrepreneurs ScaleUp The ScaleUp accelerator is designed for 9 months , for active entrepreneurs with high growth potential undergo group training and practical training. The program includes 10 interactive training sessions, at least 10 networking events, at least 18 meetings with an individually selected mentor .  The ScaleUp program was developed by "Center for Entrepreneurship" based on the best international practices .  the program key component is mentorship.  BENEFITS OF PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM  A good long-term entrepreneurship mentorship program where a more experienced entrepreneur mentors a less experienced one can offer a multitude of benefits, fostering growth and success on both personal and professional levels. Here are some key advantages:  1. Guidance and Support A seasoned mentor provides invaluable guidance, helping the mentee navigate the complex world of entrepreneurship. This support can include advice on business strategy, problem-solving, and decision-making, significantly reducing the learning curve for the mentee.  2. Knowledge and Skill Development Experienced entrepreneurs possess a wealth of knowledge acquired through years of running businesses. By sharing this knowledge, mentors can help mentees develop crucial skills such as leadership, financial management, marketing, and operations. This skill development is essential for the mentee's long-term success.  3. Networking Opportunities A mentor often has an extensive professional network that they can introduce to the mentee. These connections can open doors to potential partnerships, investors, clients, and other opportunities that might otherwise be inaccessible. Building a strong network is critical for business growth and sustainability.  4. Personal Growth and Confidence Regular interaction with a mentor can boost the mentee's confidence and self-esteem. Overcoming challenges with the mentor's support helps build resilience and a positive mindset, essential traits for any successful entrepreneur.  5. Problem-Solving and Innovation Having a mentor allows the mentee to discuss challenges and brainstorm solutions, leading to innovative ideas and approaches. The mentor's experience provides a fresh perspective, often revealing new ways to tackle problems and seize opportunities.  6. Moral and Emotional Support Entrepreneurship can be a lonely and stressful journey. A mentor offers moral support and encouragement, helping the mentee stay motivated during tough times. This emotional support can be a critical factor in maintaining the mentee's mental well-being and perseverance.  7. Long-Term Business Growth With the mentor's guidance, the mentee can avoid common pitfalls and make informed decisions, leading to more sustainable business growth. The long-term relationship allows the mentor to provide continuous support as the business evolves, adapting strategies to meet changing market conditions.  8. Enhanced Innovation and Creativity A mentor can inspire the mentee to think outside the box and explore new ideas. This encouragement fosters a culture of innovation within the mentee's business, driving competitive advantage and long-term success.  9. Mutual Learning and Growth The mentorship relationship is mutually beneficial. While the mentee gains from the mentor's experience and knowledge, the mentor can also learn from the mentee's fresh perspective and new approaches. This exchange of ideas can lead to personal and professional growth for both parties.  In summary, the Center for Entrepreneurship growth programs are transformative experience, offering a blend of practical advice, emotional support, and strategic guidance. By leveraging the mentor's experience and network, the mentee can significantly enhance their chances of building a successful and sustainable business.

Since 2002, the Center for Entrepreneurship has been the backbone of numerous growth programs for entrepreneurs. This mentor-mentee relationship fosters mutual learning and growth, significantly enhancing the chances of building a sustainable business. Partners such as the Global Entrepreneurship Network and the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation contribute to these transformative experiences, ensuring access to global best practices and industry standards.

This mentor-mentee relationship fosters mutual learning and growth, significantly enhancing the chances of building a sustainable business. Partners such as the Global Entrepreneurship Network and the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation contribute to these transformative experiences, ensuring access to global best practices and industry standards.

The Center for Entrepreneurship Programs and Opportunities

Comprehensive Programs for Entrepreneurs, Mentors, and Regional Partners

The Center for Entrepreneurship offers an extensive range of programs catering to startups through our Startup Club, existing businesses via the ScaleUp Acceleration Program, and universities with the Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom. These initiatives bring together the interests of entrepreneurs, mentors, regional partners, the expert community, and government bodies, thereby stimulating the active development of the local entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Benefits for Participants

Participants in these programs gain a plethora of benefits. Active entrepreneurs can engage in a multilateral exchange of entrepreneurial experiences, acquire essential knowledge and skills for rapid business growth, experience personal growth through mentorship, receive long-term support from seasoned entrepreneurs, and expand their network regionally, federally, and internationally. Mentors and experts have the opportunity to re-evaluate their business experience, develop new ideas through synergy with mentees, enhance their entrepreneurial competencies, influence regional entrepreneurship development, and widen their business networks. Trainers are trained in modern international methodologies, share expertise with other trainers and the expert community, and boost their professional portfolios. Regional partners gain competitive advantages through a unique and comprehensive program, expand their federal and international connections, and benefit from a developed regional entrepreneurship ecosystem. Furthermore, development agencies, non-commercial organizations, and local entrepreneurial communities see increased job creation, business efficiency, and investment growth in the region.

Maximize Your Startup Success with Expert Guidance and Community Support

You are building a startup and will be looking for good support in your journey. If you're doing this for the first time, and you've started gathering what needs to be done and the many hats you will be wearing, There's so much to learn, so many decisions to take, and only yourself to rely on. It's easy to get overwhelmed. The good startup program is a great answer for staying organized. A good program can make the difference in helping you survive and thrive.

The Center for Entrepreneurship has been implementing startup programs since 2002. Key programs such as Startup Club, Startup Huddle, and FastTrac are based on the best international experiences. These programs provide you access to a supportive community, industry knowledge, and expert mentoring. The advantages of having a good startup program with a mentor include gaining valuable insights, fast-tracking your path to success, and avoiding common mistakes. A mentor's wisdom, gained from both successes and failures, is invaluable, providing insights from customer development to fundraising. Additionally, programs utilizing startup communities enable you to build a strong network, which is crucial for growth. Mentors help expand your network through strategic introductions, whether to potential partners, customers, or investors, fostering both personal and business growth. Overall, The Center for Entrepreneurship's comprehensive approach ensures startups receive the necessary support to thrive, offering not just knowledge but a robust network and invaluable mentorship.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Learn to Be an Entrepreneur with The Center for Entrepreneurship Programs

Can You Learn to Be an Entrepreneur? Absolutely, with the Right Program!

If you dream of running a business but don’t have any experience, you’re probably wondering: Can you learn to be an entrepreneur? We firmly believe that you can! Starting a business isn’t limited to people with a natural talent for leadership or making good investments. Through access to entrepreneurship programs and regular engagement with a community of peers, anyone can build a successful company. You can look for entrepreneurial skills that are most important and what to look for in a startup learning community. Or you can take the program that is right for you. The Center for Entrepreneurship provides learning programs for new entrepreneurs since 2002. Programs like FastTrac or Startup Club will guide you and provide the necessary knowledge. The Center for Entrepreneurship equips aspiring entrepreneurs with the business skills and insights, tools, resources, and peer networks necessary to start and grow successful businesses. Let us help you clear the path from idea to business start.

Features and Benefits of Our Programs

Our programs are designed to be inclusive and supportive, offering a variety of features to ensure your entrepreneurial success. The content is industry-agnostic, making it relevant for entrepreneurs from all sectors. You can choose the learning approach that fits you best, accessing modules in an order that works for you and taking as much or as little time as you need. Quizzes and assignments help assess your learning and knowledge. With step-by-step guides from ideation to launch, 90% of participants have applied a lesson to help them start or grow their business, and 91% would recommend our programs to a friend. We partner with esteemed organizations such as the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation and the US Department of State, ensuring that you receive top-notch support and resources.

For universities that want to teach the entrepreneursion Center for Entrepreneurship has been implementing the Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom (DEC) program since 2006, more than 500 teachers from higher education institutions from 18 cities have taken part in the program. DEC has a great influence on the promotion of entrepreneurship education in universities  . Thanks to the program, more than 80 new programs and entrepreneurial initiatives have appeared in more than 30 universities. DEC is a training program in the format of a three- or five-day seminar with the participation of leading experts in the field of teaching entrepreneurship from Russia, Europe and the USA, providing university teachers with an introduction to methods of teaching entrepreneurship as a discipline, focused on developing the practical and business skills of future entrepreneurs.  DEC provides participants with pedagogical content and teaching methods, and also helps to hone their teaching skills. The training is implemented on three key topics: - why do we teach entrepreneurship? - what do we teach in entrepreneurship? - how do we teach entrepreneurship?

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Learn to Be an Entrepreneur with the Center for Entrepreneurship Programs

The Center for Entrepreneurship: Empowering Aspiring Entrepreneurs

You are probably wondering: can you learn to be an entrepreneur? We firmly believe that you can! Starting a business is not limited to people with a natural talent for leadership or making good investments. Through access to entrepreneurship programs and regular engagement with a community of peers, anyone can build a successful company. You can look for the most important entrepreneurial skills and what to seek in a startup learning community, or you can take the program that is right for you. The Center for Entrepreneurship has been providing learning programs for new entrepreneurs since 2002. For those who want to start their own business, the Center offers programs like FastTrac or Startup Club, which will guide you and provide the necessary knowledge. Gain comprehensive knowledge and skills for venture creation and growth. You will have access to content, templates, and tools as you progress through modules that mirror the entrepreneurial journey. By the end of the course, you will have developed and refined your entrepreneurial vision into a thoroughly researched and tested business plan.

Key Programs and Benefits

The Center for Entrepreneurship delineates the entrepreneurial journey in distinct phases: IDEATE, POSITION, COMMIT, REFINE, and LAUNCH. Through the IDEATE phase, get started making your idea a reality and exploring the entrepreneurial journey. In the POSITION phase, focus on market positioning, understanding customers, and solidifying your business model. The COMMIT phase ensures you are ready to reach your market, make sales, and protect your business. The REFINE phase perfects your strategy before launch and ensures your financial readiness. Finally, the LAUNCH phase prepares you for leading and growing your business. The Dynamic Entrepreneurship Classroom program, implemented since 2006, has trained over 500 higher education teachers across 18 cities, resulting in over 80 new programs and initiatives in more than 30 universities. This intensive 3-5 day seminar employs methods from leading experts to enhance teaching skills and entrepreneurial education. Additionally, the Center's partnerships with organizations like the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation and the US Department of State amplify the impact and resources available to aspiring entrepreneurs.

content_item.parsed_text: February 15, 2024  Center for Entrepreneurship announces the dates of Global Entrepreneurship Week  GEW Dates + FAQs When is Global Entrepreneurship Week?  Global Entrepreneurship Week takes place each November. The exact dates for the coming years are:  2024 November 18 - 24 2025 November  17 - 23 2026 November 16 - 22 How many countries participate in Global Entrepreneurship Week?  Roughly 180 countries now celebrate Global Entrepreneurship Week each November (complete list by continent). The number has grown since the initiative launched in 2008:   2008: 77 countries 2009: 88 countries 2010: 104 countries 2011: 123 countries 2012: 131 countries 2013: 140 countries 2014: 149 countries 2015: 160 countries 2016: 165 countries 2017: 167 countries   2018: 167 countries 2019: 170 countries 2020: 180 countries 2021: 180 countries 2022: 175 countries What is Global Entrepreneurship Week?  Global Entrepreneurship Week is the world’s largest celebration of the innovators and job creators who launch startups that bring ideas to life, drive economic growth and expand human welfare. During one week each November, GEW inspires people everywhere through local, national and global activities designed to help them take the next step in their entrepreneurial journey. These activities, from large-scale competitions and events to intimate networking gatherings, connect participants to potential collaborators, mentors and even investors — introducing them to new possibilities and exciting opportunities.    Where is Global Entrepreneurship Week happening?   Everywhere. Global Entrepreneurship Week is not one single event — it is tens of thousands of events, activities and competitions happening in 180 countries.   Who can get involved in Global Entrepreneurship Week?  Anybody. Anywhere. Anytime. Organizations can get involved in a variety of capacities— planning events and activities as a local partner or even coordinating the initiative for an entire country as a GEW host. Individuals interested in exploring their entrepreneurial potential can find a broad array of activities—from local events to global competitions. Entrepreneurs and investors can share their ideas and experiences—face-to-face or online. How you get involved is up to you. If you want a little guidance, connect with the Host for your country. If there is not a Host for your country, please contact us to suggest one.    Why should you plan or schedule an activity during Global Entrepreneurship Week?  By hosting an event or activity during Global Entrepreneurship Week you have a positive—and potentially life-changing—impact on aspiring and nascent entrepreneurs, moving them along the spectrum from simply having idea to actually launching a startup. In addition, these activities help recognize and celebrate the contributions made to your community by local entrepreneurs. More directly, planning one or more events during GEW also has some tangible benefits for you and your organization: Raise awareness of your organization and gain recognition for the work you do throughout the year. Reach new audiences within your community, potentially identifying talented volunteers or even new employees. Enhance your leadership profile within the entrepreneurial ecosystem of your city, state, region or country. Strengthen connections with existing supporters and sponsors by providing them with more visibility for them.    How can I connect with other people involved in Global Entrepreneurship Week?  In addition to connecting face-to-face during GEW events and activities, participants can continue their conversations year-round through a handful of official GEW social media channels:

Center for Entrepreneurship Announces Global Entrepreneurship Week Dates

February 15, 2024

Key Dates and FAQs for Global Entrepreneurship Week

Global Entrepreneurship Week, the world's largest celebration of innovators and job creators, will take place from November 18 to 24 in 2024. This annual event inspires individuals through various local, national, and global activities designed to help them along their entrepreneurial journey. Offering everything from large-scale competitions and events to intimate networking gatherings, GEW connects participants with potential collaborators, mentors, and investors, introducing them to new opportunities and possibilities. As announced by the Global Entrepreneurship Network, the dates for the upcoming years are: 2024 - November 18 to 24, 2025 - November 17 to 23, 2026 - November 16 to 22. Since its inception in 2008, when 77 countries participated, the number of countries celebrating GEW has grown to approximately 180 each year. Participants of all backgrounds are encouraged to join GEW events, share ideas, and explore opportunities, enriching the entrepreneurial ecosystem globally.

Why You Should Get Involved

Hosting or participating in an event during Global Entrepreneurship Week offers significant benefits. For organizations, it raises awareness and gains recognition for your work year-round. It also helps you reach new audiences, identify potential volunteers or new employees, and strengthen connections with existing supporters and sponsors. For aspiring entrepreneurs, it provides a platform to connect with potential collaborators, mentors, and investors. The Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation and US Department Of State are key organizations that support GEW, offering various programs and initiatives to help entrepreneurs thrive. The Global Entrepreneurship Network provides resources, events, and advocacy aimed at making it easier for anyone, anywhere to start and scale a business. They also offer platforms like the Global Entrepreneurship Week, which serves as a crucial touchpoint for aspiring and established entrepreneurs to connect and grow.

компании отчетность Павел Кривозубов Павел Новиков партнеры резидентам резиденты робототехника Сколково стартапы ЦРТ-инновации эванти Компании Сколково рассказали о своих решениях в области AI на Startup клубе Деловой России December 18, 2020 7:08pm 17 декабря Startup клуб «Деловой России» провел заседание, посвященное проектам, работающим с технологиями искусственного интеллекта. Эксперты клуба рассмотрели восемь проектов. С приветствием к участникам встречи обратился руководитель направления «Робототехника и искусственный интеллект» ИТ-кластера фонда «Сколково» Павел Кривозубов. «Тематика самая актуальная, особенно в свете последних событий, вызовов, которые нам дал последний год. Во всех сферах идет трансформация, в том числе с помощью систем искусственного интеллекта», — отметил он. Председатель Startup клуба, член генерального совета «Деловой России» и генеральный директор Центра предпринимательства Денис Дидковский напомнил, что клуб работает уже почти год, за 19 прошедших встреч он стал эффективной площадкой для тех, кто ищет экспертную помощь в реализации не только пилотных, но и  достаточно «зрелых» проектов, а также для тех, кто заинтересован в привлечении инвестиций. Модератором встречи выступил партнер CBI Pioneer, эксперт по инвестиционной привлекательности и региональным институтам развития Дмитрий Ягодкин. Участники представили восемь проектов. Интеллектуальный пешеходный переход Кирилл Минибаев представил проект интеллектуального пешеходного перехода, который предупреждает пешеходов о высокой скорости приближающегося автомобиля, а водителей — о том, что на пешеходном переходе находится человек. Специальные технологии обеспечивают максимальную видимость пешеходного перехода для всех участников движения. Системы компьютерного зрения Smart Timber Татьяна Елисеева рассказала о сервисе для подсчета объема срубленного леса, уложенного в штабель или в лесовоз. Сейчас на предприятиях лесной промышленности гораздо чаще используется ручной труд, а имеющиеся автоматизированные решения недостаточно гибкие. Smart Timber использует технологии компьютерного зрения и машинного обучения для автоматизации процесса подсчета объема древесины. Команда проекта ищет контакты потенциальных заказчиков и партнеров для решения смежных задач. IPG — система слот-координации для аэропортов Алексей Цыплаков выступил с презентацией платформы по созданию решений для планирования и оптимизации управления ресурсами на основе слот-координации. Существующие экспертные системы управления ресурсами не могут создать наиболее оптимальный результат в условиях большого количества ограничений и ресурсов. Предлагаемая система на основе искусственного интеллекта способна создавать модели для получения результата, который можно рассчитать и который должен удовлетворять множеству условий, включая взаимоисключающие. Такой сервис может быть полезен для аэропортов, спортивных лиг, строительных компаний, крупных учебных и медицинских организаций. AURORAi — система мониторинга сложных технических объектов Василий Манько представил решение, которое использует алгоритмы машинного обучения, совмещенные с компонентами компьютерного зрения, что позволяет определять техническое состояние объектов в ходе производственного процесса. Система поможет автоматизировать процессы, которые раньше мог проводить только человек, например, диагностику состояния колесной пары и навесного оборудования, описание рудного материала в горнодобывающей промышленности и другие. Компания ищет выходы на новые рынки, заказчиков и инвесторов. Oz Forensics — биометрические платформы Светлана Ефимова рассказала о биометрической платформе, которая может проверять подлинность изображения, сравнивать лица, определять живого человека в кадре. Спикер отметила, что потери от идентификационного мошенничества в мире в 2019 году достигли 16,9 млрд долл. Авторы проекта обещают защитить своих клиентов от идентификационного мошенничества с точностью до 99,87%. Создание диалоговых систем и систем умного поиска на базе ИИ Артем Артемов выступил с презентацией языкового процессора B2NLP, функционал которого он описал так: «Превращает текстовые данные в ценные знания». Авторы проекта ориентируются в основном на государственный сектор и предлагают решения на основе своей разработки для анализа обращений граждан, умного поиска по документам, анализа медиаполя. Компания ищет выход на потребителей и пилотные проекты с заинтересованным в результате посредником. Платформа «Цифровая Россия» Максим Шевченко представил сервис для решения бизнес-запросов «Цифровая Россия». Это единая платформа для взаимодействия всех участников рынка от бизнес-сообществ до институтов развития. Платформа помогает решать задачи нетворкинга, поиска исполнителей, поиска потенциальных клиентов и развития бизнеса. Проект заинтересован в информационной и финансовой поддержке, а также сотрудничестве с институтами развития и предпринимательскими сообществами. Сооснователем проекта является член генерального совета «Деловой России» Алексей Мостовщиков. Виртуальные цифровые ассистенты iPavlov: корпоративный нейроинтеллект большого бизнеса Лоран Акопян рассказал о компании iPavlov как успешном проекте, который проделал путь от стартапа до зрелой компании. В портфель проектов компании входят пять продуктов: чат-бот-платформа iPavlov, компьютерное зрение, технологии для цифрового здравоохранения, нейрокриптография — аппаратные и программные способы защиты информации. Все платформы интегрируются с наиболее популярными внешними системами. На правах сложившегося бизнеса компания iPavlov выразила готовность делиться с участниками Startup клуба опытом привлечения инвестиций. it стартапы резиденты ru Clusters IT BioMed Energy Nuclear Space Technopark About Technopark Офисы и лаборатории Services R&D Services Contacts Education Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology International gymnasium Accommodation Apartments Cottages Townhouses Infrastructure Customs and Finance Company Intellectual property centre COMMUNICATIONS Press User Agreement Contacts © 2024 Skolkovo Foundation

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Companies Presented AI Solutions at Startup Club Meeting

December 18, 2020

Innovative AI Solutions at Startup Club Meeting

On December 17, the Startup Club held a meeting dedicated to projects leveraging AI technologies. Eight innovative projects were presented. Pavel Krivozubov, the Head of Robotics and AI, welcomed participants and highlighted the relevance of AI in today's rapidly transforming world. Denis Didkovsky, Chair of the Startup Club and Director of The Center for Entrepreneurship, underlined the effectiveness of the Club as a platform for expert assistance and investment opportunities. Dmitry Yagodkin moderated the session, showcasing projects like the Intelligent Pedestrian Crossing by Kirill Minibaev and Smart Timber by Tatiana Eliseeva. Other noteworthy projects included Alexey Cyplakov's IPG system for airport slot coordination, Vasiliy Manko's AURORAi for monitoring technical objects, and Svetlana Efimova's Oz Forensics for advanced biometric platforms. Artem Artemov introduced B2NLP, a language processor for creating valuable knowledge from text, while Maxim Shevchenko presented the Digital Russia platform to solve business queries. Laurent Akopyan from iPavlov shared the journey from startup to a mature company, highlighting five key products, including a chatbot platform and neurocryptography solutions.

Key Organizations and Their Roles

The Center for Entrepreneurship aims to foster entrepreneurship through actionable programs and initiatives. The institution provides resources for startups, from initial ideas to scaling businesses. Key initiatives include the Acceleration Programs and Mentoring Programs, offering comprehensive guidance and support to emerging businesses. With a focus on innovation and collaboration, the Center bridges the gap between entrepreneurs and investors, fostering a dynamic ecosystem for growth and success. By participating in events like the Startup Club, The Center for Entrepreneurship connects members with critical insights and opportunities.

About Kauffman FastTrac® Kauffman FastTrac equips aspiring entrepreneurs with the business skills and insights, tools, resources, and peer networks necessary to start and grow successful businesses.  Kauffman FastTrac was launched by the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation, About the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation Ewing Marion Kauffman was an entrepreneur and humanitarian whose innovative and long-lasting contributions have benefited millions of people in his hometown of Kansas City and beyond. page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Center for Entrepreneurship Partnering with Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation

Empowering Entrepreneurs through Kauffman FastTrac Programs

Since 2004, the Center for Entrepreneurship has been partnering with the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation to organize the Kauffman FastTrac® programs. More than 840 entrepreneurs have acquired vital business skills through these programs. Kauffman FastTrac® provides relevant content and tools to support the start, growth, and sustainability of businesses. It equips aspiring entrepreneurs with the necessary business skills, insights, tools, resources, and peer networks for launching and growing successful ventures. The curriculum is not industry-specific, making it relevant for entrepreneurs of all types. Participants can access modules in any order, taking as much or as little time as needed. They benefit from quizzes, assignments, and step-by-step guides from ideation to launch. Notably, 90% of participants have applied lessons from the program to aid in starting or growing their businesses, and 91% would recommend it to friends.

Partnership Highlights

The Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation, founded by entrepreneur and humanitarian Ewing Marion Kauffman, has a profound history of supporting entrepreneurship and innovation. Based in Kansas City, the foundation's initiatives have benefitted millions. Their collaboration with the Center for Entrepreneurship leverages the foundation's legacy to support new business ventures through the FastTrac programs. The programs offer flexible learning solutions, including access to valuable content and practical tools. By emphasizing real-world applications of business concepts, the FastTrac programs have been instrumental in fostering entrepreneurial success stories. This partnership has consistently contributed to the development of robust entrepreneurial ecosystems, helping startups and established businesses alike to thrive.

content_item.parsed_text: Center for Entrepreneurship partners with Global Entrepreneurship Network from 2008. Aiming at making it easier for anyone, anywhere to start and scale a business.    By fostering deeper cross-border collaboration and initiatives between entrepreneurs, investors, researchers, policymakers and entrepreneurial support organizations, GEN fuels healthier start and scale ecosystems that create more jobs, provide education, accelerate innovation, and strengthen economic growth.    GEN’s comprehensive global footprint of national operations and global verticals in policy, research and programs ensures members have uncommon access to the most relevant knowledge, networks, communities, and programs relative to size of economy, maturity of ecosystem, language, culture, geography and more.   Center for Entrepreneurship partners with Global Entrepreneurship Network in 2 key programs: Global Entrepreneurship Week and Startup Huddle   Parnership divides its efforts into four distinct categories:    Celebrate: Programs, including Global Entrepreneurship Week, an awareness campaign engaging millions of people each November through thousands of events that celebrate entrepreneurs and inspire others – particularly those who face structural barriers or may have never considered the idea of launching a startup – to follow in their footsteps.    Understand: Programs, including GEN Research, and other initiatives that compile, share, and analyze data related to new firm formation to better understand the underlying conditions that best enable entrepreneurs to thrive.    Support: Programs that support entrepreneurs at all stages to reach their next phase of growth. These include: GEN Policy; GEN Invest; GEN Accelerates; GEN Campus; GEN Space; GEN Starters Club; Global Enterprise Registration; Startup Huddle; and the Entrepreneurship World Cup.   Connect: Programs that strengthen local ecosystems around the world by connecting entrepreneurs, ecosystem builders and community leaders. These include the Global Entrepreneurship Congress, GEC+, the Startup Nations Summit and an expanding range of virtual programming.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Center for Entrepreneurship Partners with Global Entrepreneurship Network

The Center for Entrepreneurship Forms Key Partnership with Global Entrepreneurship Network

Since 2008, Global Entrepreneurship Network (GEN) has collaborated with The Center for Entrepreneurship to facilitate easier access to starting and scaling businesses worldwide. By promoting deeper cross-border collaboration and initiatives among entrepreneurs, investors, researchers, policymakers, and entrepreneurial support organizations, GEN supports the creation of healthier startup ecosystems. These initiatives aim to create more jobs, provide education, accelerate innovation, and strengthen economic growth. GEN's extensive global presence ensures its members have exceptional access to pertinent knowledge, networks, communities, and programs, tailored to various factors, such as the size of the economy, the maturity of the ecosystem, language, culture, and geography.

Joint Programs and Initiatives

The Center for Entrepreneurship and GEN collaborate on two key programs: Global Entrepreneurship Week and Startup Huddle. These efforts are categorized into four main areas: Celebrate, Understand, Support, and Connect. The Celebrate area includes initiatives like Global Entrepreneurship Week, which engages millions each November through events that celebrate and inspire entrepreneurs. The Understand area focuses on GEN Research and other data-driven initiatives to understand the conditions that help entrepreneurs thrive. Support programs assist entrepreneurs at various growth stages, including GEN Policy, GEN Invest, GEN Accelerates, and more. Finally, Connect programs, such as the Global Entrepreneurship Congress, foster local ecosystems by connecting entrepreneurs and community leaders. GEN's global initiatives play a crucial role in strengthening entrepreneurial ecosystems, promoting innovation, and driving economic growth.

page_cooked.page_description: Center for Entrepreneurship and Global Entrepreneurship Network collaborate to simplify starting and scaling businesses worldwide, fostering global entrepreneurial growth.
page_cooked.page_keywords: entrepreneurship, business growth, startup, Global Entrepreneurship Week, Startup Huddle, innovation, economic growth, Global Entrepreneurship Network

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Center for Entrepreneurship Partners with YEO Since 2004

Expanding Global Entrepreneurial Opportunities

The Center for Entrepreneurship has been proudly partnering with Entrepreneurs' Organization (EO) since 2004 to help entrepreneurs achieve their full potential through life-enhancing connections that lead to infinite possibilities. As a member of the Entrepreneurs' Organization, the choices available are vast, offering a wide-open playing field for members to expand their interests, learn from others, and challenge their perspectives, fostering both personal and professional growth. In collaboration with YEO and Ernst & Young, the Center also participates in the 'Entrepreneur of the Year' award. Together, new chapters have been launched outside of North America, broadening their global reach. The Center for Entrepreneurship also partners with YEO to implement the Global Student Entrepreneur Awards (GSEA), the premier global competition for students who own and operate a business while attending college or university. Nominees compete against peers from around the world in various local and national competitions, hoping to qualify for the Global Finals.

Joint Activities and Achievements

The Entrepreneurs' Organization (EO) is a global network of entrepreneurs committed to learning and growing together. Through this partnership, EO members gain access to unique opportunities and resources that support their entrepreneurial journey. EO's Global Student Entrepreneur Awards (GSEA) are a testament to their dedication to nurturing young entrepreneurial talent. By recognizing and rewarding student entrepreneurs, GSEA helps them gain valuable insights, mentorship, and exposure on a global stage. Additionally, the 'Entrepreneur of the Year' award, in collaboration with Ernst & Young, celebrates the achievements of outstanding entrepreneurs who demonstrate excellence and innovation in their respective fields. These initiatives not only provide recognition but also foster a vibrant community of entrepreneurs who inspire and support each other.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Center for Entrepreneurship Partners with American Chamber of Commerce Since 2003

Collaborative Efforts to Strengthen Local Ecosystems Worldwide

The Center for Entrepreneurship has been partnering with the American Chamber of Commerce since 2003. The American Chamber of Commerce is a nonprofit, nongovernmental organization that provides information, networking opportunities, business support services, and advocacy to promote a mutually beneficial bilateral business environment for U.S. companies. Through this partnership, the Center for Entrepreneurship and the American Chamber of Commerce have developed programs aimed at strengthening local ecosystems around the world by connecting U.S. entrepreneurs, ecosystem builders, and community leaders.

About Our Partner: American Chamber of Commerce

The American Chamber of Commerce (AmCham) is dedicated to fostering a positive business environment through its extensive network and resources. Since its inception, AmCham has provided invaluable support to U.S. companies seeking to establish and grow their presence internationally. By hosting regular networking events, offering business support services, and engaging in advocacy efforts, AmCham plays a crucial role in the global business landscape. The collaboration with the Center for Entrepreneurship has further amplified AmCham's impact, enabling the development of specialized programs designed to address the needs of entrepreneurs and ecosystem builders. These initiatives have included mentorship programs, workshops, and regional conferences, all aimed at fostering innovation and sustainable growth. Together, the Center for Entrepreneurship and AmCham continue to drive forward-thinking initiatives that nurture entrepreneurial ecosystems and support business development worldwide.

Junior Achievements programs; in the core content areas of work readiness, entrepreneurship and financial literacy ignite the spark in young people to experience and realize the opportunities and realities of work and life in the 21st century. Purpose Junior Achievement's purpose is to inspire and prepare young people to succeed in a global economy. Proven Success Junior Achievement is one of a few nonprofits to use independent, third-party evaluators to gauge the impact of its programs. Since 1993, independent evaluators have conducted studies on Junior Achievement's effectiveness. Findings prove that Junior Achievement has a positive impact in a number of critical areas. These results are available for free upon request. Summaries of the findings are also published in the JA Programs section at jausa.ja.org/programs

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Center for Entrepreneurship Partners with Junior Achievement to Foster Young Entrepreneurs

Developing Market Economy and Entrepreneurship Training Programs for Students

The Center for Entrepreneurship has been partnering with Junior Achievement since 2003 to develop schoolchildren and student training programs in the market economy and entrepreneurship. This partnership has led to the creation of new Business and Tourism programs, a project of the World Travel and Tourism Partnership. Additionally, they have developed new training guides and launched the regional Young Entrepreneur conference. Junior Achievement USA is the nation’s largest organization dedicated to giving young people the knowledge and skills they need to succeed economically, plan for their future, and make smart academic and economic choices. Junior Achievement’s programs in core content areas such as work readiness, entrepreneurship, and financial literacy ignite the spark in young people to experience and realize the opportunities and realities of work and life in the 21st century. The purpose of Junior Achievement is to inspire and prepare young people to succeed in a global economy.

Proven Success and Continued Collaboration

Junior Achievement's commitment is evident through the use of independent, third-party evaluators to gauge the impact of its programs. Results have shown a positive impact in several critical areas since 1993, proving the efficiency and importance of their educational efforts. These findings are available for free upon request, and summaries can be found in the JA Programs section of their website. The collaboration between the Center for Entrepreneurship and Junior Achievement focuses on innovative youth education, particularly in areas like financial literacy, entrepreneurship, and work readiness. The ongoing partnership aims to continue to foster the entrepreneurial spirit among young people, offering them various resources, mentorship, and practical experiences through state-of-the-art programs. The regional Young Entrepreneur conference is a highlight of their collaboration, providing a platform for students to showcase their business ideas, network with like-minded peers, and gain insights from industry experts.

content_item.parsed_text: Since 2002, the Center for Entrepreneurship has been the backbone of numerous growth programs for entrepreneurs.  The Center offers high impact program mentoring that has proven and efficient program for entrepreneurs: the ScaleUp accelerator and Startup Club.   All programs including mentoring by existing entreprenuers.   Accelerator program is a great way to scaleup and running quickly. The program provide expert guidance, mentorship, resources, and networking opportunities that can help your business reach its full potential. For entrepreneurs and startup founders, it�s important to understand what these programs are and how your company can benefit from them.  These programs offer regular seesion withexperienced mentors who can guide your entrepreneurial and allow you to connect with like-minded people. This can open doors to new partnerships and collaborations that could take your business further than ever.  One of the Acceleration program for existing entrepreneurs ScaleUp The ScaleUp accelerator is designed for 9 months , for active entrepreneurs with high growth potential undergo group training and practical training. The program includes 10 interactive training sessions, at least 10 networking events, at least 18 meetings with an individually selected mentor .  The ScaleUp program was developed by "Center for Entrepreneurship" based on the best international practices .  the program key component is mentorship.  BENEFITS OF PARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM  A good long-term entrepreneurship mentorship program where a more experienced entrepreneur mentors a less experienced one can offer a multitude of benefits, fostering growth and success on both personal and professional levels. Here are some key advantages:  1. Guidance and Support A seasoned mentor provides invaluable guidance, helping the mentee navigate the complex world of entrepreneurship. This support can include advice on business strategy, problem-solving, and decision-making, significantly reducing the learning curve for the mentee.  2. Knowledge and Skill Development Experienced entrepreneurs possess a wealth of knowledge acquired through years of running businesses. By sharing this knowledge, mentors can help mentees develop crucial skills such as leadership, financial management, marketing, and operations. This skill development is essential for the mentee's long-term success.  3. Networking Opportunities A mentor often has an extensive professional network that they can introduce to the mentee. These connections can open doors to potential partnerships, investors, clients, and other opportunities that might otherwise be inaccessible. Building a strong network is critical for business growth and sustainability.  4. Personal Growth and Confidence Regular interaction with a mentor can boost the mentee's confidence and self-esteem. Overcoming challenges with the mentor's support helps build resilience and a positive mindset, essential traits for any successful entrepreneur.  5. Problem-Solving and Innovation Having a mentor allows the mentee to discuss challenges and brainstorm solutions, leading to innovative ideas and approaches. The mentor's experience provides a fresh perspective, often revealing new ways to tackle problems and seize opportunities.  6. Moral and Emotional Support Entrepreneurship can be a lonely and stressful journey. A mentor offers moral support and encouragement, helping the mentee stay motivated during tough times. This emotional support can be a critical factor in maintaining the mentee's mental well-being and perseverance.  7. Long-Term Business Growth With the mentor's guidance, the mentee can avoid common pitfalls and make informed decisions, leading to more sustainable business growth. The long-term relationship allows the mentor to provide continuous support as the business evolves, adapting strategies to meet changing market conditions.  8. Enhanced Innovation and Creativity A mentor can inspire the mentee to think outside the box and explore new ideas. This encouragement fosters a culture of innovation within the mentee's business, driving competitive advantage and long-term success.  9. Mutual Learning and Growth The mentorship relationship is mutually beneficial. While the mentee gains from the mentor's experience and knowledge, the mentor can also learn from the mentee's fresh perspective and new approaches. This exchange of ideas can lead to personal and professional growth for both parties.  In summary, the Center for Entrepreneurship growth programs are transformative experience, offering a blend of practical advice, emotional support, and strategic guidance. By leveraging the mentor's experience and network, the mentee can significantly enhance their chances of building a successful and sustainable business.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
The Center for Entrepreneurship: Backbone of Growth Programs Since 2002

The Center for Entrepreneurship's High-Impact Programs for Entrepreneurial Growth

Since 2002, the Center for Entrepreneurship has been the backbone of numerous growth programs for entrepreneurs. The Center offers high-impact program mentoring that has proven to be efficient for entrepreneurs, including the ScaleUp Accelerator and Startup Club. All programs include mentoring by existing entrepreneurs. The accelerator program is a great way to scale up and run quickly. The program provides expert guidance, mentorship, resources, and networking opportunities that can help your business reach its full potential. For entrepreneurs and startup founders, it is important to understand what these programs are and how your company can benefit from them. These programs offer regular sessions with experienced mentors who can guide your entrepreneurial journey and allow you to connect with like-minded people. This can open doors to new partnerships and collaborations that could take your business further than ever. One of the acceleration programs for existing entrepreneurs, the ScaleUp Accelerator, is designed for 9 months. Active entrepreneurs with high growth potential undergo group training and practical training. The program includes 10 interactive training sessions, at least 10 networking events, and at least 18 meetings with an individually selected mentor. The ScaleUp program was developed by the Center for Entrepreneurship based on the best international practices, with the program's key component being mentorship.

Additional Information on Key Programs and Benefits

The benefits of participating in the Center's programs are manifold. Mentorship provides invaluable guidance, support, and knowledge development, helping reduce the learning curve for mentees by advising on business strategies and problem-solving. The mentorship extends to networking opportunities with extensive professional networks, leading to potential partnerships, investors, and clients. Personal growth is also a significant advantage, as regular interaction with a mentor boosts confidence and resilience. Additionally, mentors help in fostering innovation and creativity by encouraging out-of-the-box thinking. The mutual learning and growth aspect of mentorship allows both mentor and mentee to benefit from each other's perspectives, leading to continuous development. The Center also collaborates with organizations like the Entrepreneurs' Organization, Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation, and US Department of State to further enrich the entrepreneurial ecosystem through valuable resources and partnerships.

page_cooked.page_cooked_html:
Center for Entrepreneurship Growth Programs

Transformative Programs for Entrepreneurs to Scale and Succeed

Since 2002, the Center for Entrepreneurship has been implementing growth programs for entrepreneurs based on best practices from the world's leading accelerators and startup programs. The Center offers high-impact programs for existing entrepreneurs like the ScaleUp accelerator and various startup programs. These programs provide expert guidance, mentorship, resources, and networking opportunities to help businesses reach their full potential. The Center partners with Global Entrepreneurship Network and other key international entrepreneurship organizations. All programs include mentoring by experienced entrepreneurs. Regular sessions with experienced mentors offer valuable guidance, allowing participants to connect with like-minded individuals and forge new partnerships. The ScaleUp accelerator is a 9-month program designed for active entrepreneurs with high growth potential, featuring 10 interactive training sessions, at least 10 networking events, and 18 meetings with individually selected mentors. The key component of this program is mentorship.

Key Benefits and Partners

Participating in the Center for Entrepreneurship's growth programs offers numerous benefits. Firstly, seasoned mentors provide invaluable guidance, helping mentees navigate the complex world of entrepreneurship. This support includes advice on business strategy, problem-solving, and decision-making. Secondly, mentors share their wealth of knowledge, aiding in skill development crucial for long-term success, such as leadership, financial management, and marketing. Moreover, mentors introduce mentees to their extensive professional networks, opening doors to potential partnerships, investors, and other opportunities. Additionally, regular mentor interactions boost confidence, foster personal growth, and encourage innovative problem-solving. The emotional support provided by mentors helps mentees stay motivated and resilient. The Center's partners, such as Junior Achievement and the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation, add credibility and support to these programs. Together, these elements contribute to the significant long-term growth and sustainability of participating businesses.

content_item.parsed_text: Since 2002, the Center for Entrepreneurship implementing growth programs for entrepreneurs based on the best .  The Center offers high impact programs for existing entreprenuers like ScaleUp accelerator and also startup programs The Importance of a Professional Team in Running an Accelerator In today's rapidly evolving business landscape, the role of accelerators has become increasingly pivotal. These entities provide crucial support to startups, offering resources, mentorship, and networks that can significantly enhance the chances of success for budding entrepreneurs. However, the true efficacy of an accelerator program hinges on the quality and professionalism of the team running it. Here are several reasons why a professional team is indispensable for the success of an accelerator.  1. Expertise and Experience A professional team brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to the table. They understand the intricacies of startup ecosystems and are adept at navigating the challenges that new businesses face. Their expertise spans various domains, including business strategy, marketing, finance, and technology. This diverse skill set allows them to provide comprehensive support to startups, addressing their unique needs effectively.  2. Credibility and Trust The reputation of an accelerator is significantly influenced by the caliber of its team. A professional team with a proven track record instills confidence in startups, investors, and other stakeholders. This credibility is essential for attracting high-potential startups and securing investment opportunities. Startups are more likely to join an accelerator if they trust the team's ability to guide them toward success.  3. Network and Connections One of the most valuable assets a professional team brings to an accelerator is their network. They have established connections with industry leaders, investors, mentors, and potential customers. These relationships can open doors for startups, providing them with opportunities that would otherwise be difficult to access. A well-connected team can facilitate strategic partnerships, funding rounds, and market entry, accelerating the growth trajectory of startups.  4. Tailored Mentorship Every compamy is unique, with its own set of challenges and opportunities. A professional team is skilled at providing tailored mentorship, offering insights and guidance specific to each startup's context. This personalized approach ensures that startups receive relevant advice and support, maximizing their chances of overcoming obstacles and achieving their goals.  5. Operational Efficiency Running an accelerator requires meticulous planning and execution. A professional team ensures operational efficiency, managing the various components of the program seamlessly. From selecting and onboarding startups to organizing workshops and events, they handle the logistics with precision. This efficiency allows startups to focus on their core business activities, knowing that the accelerator's operations are in capable hands.  6. Long-Term Impact The goal of an accelerator is not just to provide short-term support but to create long-term impact. A professional team is committed to the sustained success of startups. They offer post-accelerator support, helping startups navigate the critical phases of scaling and expansion. This ongoing relationship fosters a sense of community and continuity, contributing to the broader entrepreneurial ecosystem.  Conclusion The importance of a professional team in running an accelerator cannot be overstated. Center for Entreprenuership  expertise, credibility, network, tailored mentorship, operational efficiency, and commitment to long-term impact are essential ingredients for the success of both the accelerator and the startups it supports. In an environment where startups face numerous challenges, the guidance and support of a professional team can be the difference between success and failure. For accelerators aiming to make a meaningful impact, investing in a professional team is not just an option�it is a necessity.
